loans.name: Komanta

texts.fr: Femme dynamique de 48ans, Komanta est mère de 02 enfants. Pour aider son mari imprimeur dans les charges du foyer  elle désire avoir ce prêt pour  acheter du charbon de bois à Lomé et pour revendre à domicile.  Notons qu’en plus de la vente du charbon, elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs qu’on appelle chez nous « AKASSAN » accompagné des petits beignets faite à base de la farine de Blé. Elle exerce l’activité depuis 2003.
texts.en: An energetic 48-year old woman, Komanta is the mother of two. In order to help her husband, who is in the printing business, provide for the family needs, she is seeking this loan  to buy charcoal in  Lomé for resale  from home. It should be noted that, in addition to charcoal sales, she prepares corn porridge known locally as "akassan," accompanied by  small wheat beignets. She has been in this business since 2003.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more salt, sodas, soap, cosmetics, sugar and other items for his shop.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 35 years of age, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has a retail store that she has been operating for almost four years. Her net income is 19,000 PHP per month. Rosalie is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store. She also plans to set up a mini-eatery in their village to make additional income. She would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of her business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Christ Est Vivant Group

texts.fr: CHRIST EST VIVANT est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes et dont la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Diane. Les membres du groupe résident tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 28 Octobre 1982 au Togo, Diane est mariée à un tourneur du nom de Gildas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Après avoir arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, Diane a commencé depuis quatre ans, la vente de mèches et de produits cosmétiques dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. de façon secondaire, Diane vend des chemises. Diane s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Diane et à son groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: “Christ est vivant” [“Christ is living”] is the name of a group composed of four members whose representative (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is Diane. The group members all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Born on October 28, 1982 in Togo, Diane is married to Gildas, a metal worker. The spouses have two dependent children, both in school. After having dropped out of high school, four years ago Diane started selling hair extensions and cosmetic products in her neighborhood, which allows her to provide for different family needs jointly with her husband. As a secondary business activity, she also sells shirts. Diane stocks up in Benin. This second loan will allow Diane and her group to expand the level of their activity and increase the number of customers as well as the revenues.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 03enfants, Akossiwavi  réside à Agoé lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente des petits poissons, de la tomate, du riz, huile végétale). Elle achète au Grand Marché. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son troisième crédit. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants vue qu’elle prend seule en charge ses derniers, avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits, et plus tard  faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT.
texts.en: A mother of three children, Akossiwavi resides in Agoé, where she has her business (selling small fish, tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil). She makes her purchases at the Grand Market. She is a previous client of WAGES, and she is on her third loan. She wants to ensure a brilliant future for her children, since she is alone in supporting them. She also wants to obtain a store for displaying her products and later to have an import-export business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, tomatoes, and other items

loans.name: Kouko

texts.fr: Revendeur  de produits  génériques (efferalgan, seringue, nifluril gel…), Mr Kouko a crée une petite entreprise « SANTE POUR TOUS » en  2008. Sa femme est également revendeuse et ils ont 01 enfant. Il vend à domicile après achat dans un laboratoire de médicaments. Ce crédit  lui servira à renforcer  son activité.
texts.en: A retailer of generic pharmaceutical products (Efferalgan, syringes, Nifluril Gel...), Mr. Kouko established a small enterprise named “SANTE POUR TOUS” in 2008. His wife is also a retailer, and they have one child. After making purchases from a medicines laboratory, Kouko sells out of his house. This loan will serve to bolster his business.

loans.use: to buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 47-year-old married man with 24 children who lives in his own house with four bedrooms and two living rooms in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a peasant and also a cattle trader, who has spent 30 years in this business. He was initially a coffee farmer and after accumulating savings he started to trade cattle. His major challenge is limited funds to meet the demand of his customers. His dream is to own a ranch. Richard needs money to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Mededjigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MEDEDJIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laetitia  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laetitia  est née le 03 Novembre 1973 dans une ville du Sud du Bénin. Laetitia  est mariée à un imprimeur du nom de Victorin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les diverses charges de la maison. Laetitia  a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Afin de s’impliquer activement dans les charges du ménage, Laetitia achète des sous-vêtements qu’elle revend dans une ville du Bénin. Laetitia  exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laetitia  sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MEDEDJIGBE, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
The MEDEDJIGBE group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the third time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, so as to raise the level of their activities. The representative of the group, Laetitia, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Laetitia  was born on November 3, 1973 in a town in the south of Bénin. She is married to a printer, Victorin. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school; only one is still under their roof. The family live together and the couple share in supporting the household. 

Laetitia left school at the secondary level. In order to play an active role in supporting the household, she  buys underwear which she resells in a town in Bénin. Laetitia has been in this business for four years. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her turnover and thus her income, Laetitia  is requesting, together with the other members of her group MEDEDJIGBE, a third loan.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale.

loans.name: Madefamati

texts.fr: Mariée à un enseignant, et mère de 02 enfant, Madefamati  réside à TOKOIN FOREVER lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente de riz, huile végétale, sucre, lait). Elle achète depuis 2006 au Grand Marché. Ce montant lui permettra d’acheter des produits pour  aider la famille.
texts.en: Married to a teacher, and mother of two children, Madefamati lives in Tokoin Forever where she runs her business selling rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk. Since 2006 she gets her supplies from the Grand Market. This loan amount will enable her to buy products to help her family.

loans.use: To buy staples (tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 33 years old, married, and has two children who go to school. She has been operating Ebenezer general shop to earn a living for five years, and employs one person in her business. She also owns two motorbikes which earn her extra income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money, thereby enabling her to manage her finances. Caroline is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets for her store.

loans.name: Hodo- Alou

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 36ans, Hodo-Alou revendeuse  d’encens, parfum  tissus et divers au marché d’Assiyéyé. Elle exerce cette activité il ya 5ans et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui servira à acheter des marchandises pour revendre.
texts.en: Hodo-Alou is a 36-year-old young lady who retails incense, perfume and various products at the Assiyéyé market. She has been pursuing this activity for the past five years and gets her supplies from Lomé. This second loan she is requesting will serve to purchase goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается производством попкорна. Уже год как он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для увеличения производства попкорна. То есть он хочет купить сахар, масло и несколько мешков кукурузы.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the Dangara region. He is 36 years old. He is married, with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Nurali has receveid secondary education. He makes popcorn for sale out of his home. He has been in this business for a year. He is taking out a loan to increase the popcorn production volume. This means he would like to buy four bags of corn and one bag of sugar.

loans.use: to increase his volume of popcorn production

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a fifty-five-year-old single mother of three living in a rented house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on her and her desire is to build a house and educate her children.

She has been selling clothes for two years after diverting from the selling of fresh food where she earned her initial capital. She faces the challenge of limited capital but has big plans of owning a boutique. Edith needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jesugnon Vossa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON VOSSA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Clémentine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clémentine est née en 1978 dans une ville du Bénin. Clémentine est mariée à un transitaire nommé Valentin et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à sa charge. Clémentine et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Clémentine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Clémentine exerce depuis sept ans environs comme activité la vente de divers produits (igname, manioc, patate, riz, etc. et de façon secondaires, la vente de bouillie de maïs dans un des marchés du Bénin. Clémentine achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Clémentine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON VOSSA, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The JESUGNON VOSSA  group is composed of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Clémentine, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Clémentine was born in 1978 in a town in Bénin. She is married to a shipping agent named Valentin and has four children, all enrolled in school, of whom three live under her roof. Clémentine and her husband share in supporting their family. She lives with her husband and her children in a town in Bénin. 

In order to support herself and improve her standard of living, Clémentine has been selling various foodstuffs (cocoyams, manioc, sweet potatoes, rice, etc.) for about seven year. Secondarily, she sells maize porridge in one of the markets in Bénin. She buys her products in Bénin. 

Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her income, Clémentine is requesting, together with the other members of her group JESUGNON VOSSA, another loan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (cocoyams, manioc, sweet potatoes, maize and rice).

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en:
Salohidin is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of one daughter. He sells grocery products in his store. He started his business with the small sum of 1000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) three years ago. Today his working capital is 8500 TJS. His store is located in the central market of his village called Zimtud. Salohidin would like to get a loan of 5100 TJS in order to purchase new goods for the needs of his village's people. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortments of foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his car and pay for insurance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Iddriss

texts.fr: Jeune papa de 34ans, Idriss est marié à une enseignante. Il est photographe, reporter et en même temps vendeur de portables, CD. Il sollicite ce troisième crédit pour acheter les accessoires de portables, des CD et des pellicules à Lomé. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en: A 34 year old young father, Idriss is married to a teacher. He is a photographer, reporter, and also a seller of mobile phones and CDs.  He is asking for this third loan to buy mobile phone accessories, CDs, and camera film in Lome.  One person helps him in his business.

loans.use: To buy CDs, mobile phones, and other items.

loans.name: Olouwatobi Group

texts.fr: OLOUWATOBI est un groupe constitué D. trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Adèle Nelly. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds D. roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès D. ALIDé. Adèle Nelly est née le 24 Janvier 1970 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à  un certain Paul. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adèle Nelly a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux D. ses enfants, Adèle Nelly mène comme activité la vente tissus, D. mèches et des chaussures par le système D. distribution. Adèle Nelly exerce cette activité depuis près D. sept ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges D. sa famille. D. façon secondaire, Adèle Nelly vend du jus D. bissap. Adèle Nelly s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Adèle Nelly et aux autres membres du groupe OLOUWATOBI, D. rehausser le niveau D. leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
OLOUWATOBI is a group maD. up of three persons whose president (the member who is raising her hand) is named Adèle Nelly. The members of the group all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to increase their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Adèle Nelly was born on January 24, 1970 in a town in Bénin and is married to Paul. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school and under their roof. Adèle Nelly went to school up to the secondary level. To support herself and her children, Adèle Nelly has been working at selling cloth, hair extensions and shoes through the distribution system. She has been in this business for almost seven years, which has permitted her to cover the various expenses of her family. 

Secondarily, Adèle Nelly sells hibiscus flower juice. She buys her supplies in one of the biggest markets of Bénin. This second loan will certainly permit Adèle Nelly and the other members of the group called OLOUWATOBI to raise the level of their activities and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy cloth, hair extensions, shoes, and dried hibiscus flowers (to make juice).

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.en:
Norbibi is a hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a worker. She engaged in selling of biscuits, sweets, chocolates, sugar etc. Her store is located in the central market of Panjikent city. 

Nobibi purchases her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan city. She has many customers and she makes a good profit. Norbibi would like to get a loan of 12,000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of her products. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of foods

loans.name: Sissitatcho

texts.fr: Mère d’01enfant, Mme est âgée de 36ans et réside à Toglékopé  lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente de riz, huile végétale, sucre, lait). Elle achète au marché d’Agoé. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son deuxième crédit. Son mari est chauffeur.  Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants, avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits, et plus tard  faire du commerce international. Elle a commencé en 2006.
texts.en: Mother of one child, this lady is 36 years old and lives in Toglékopé where she runs a business selling rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk. She buys at the Agoè market. She is a long-time member of WAGES and is applying for a second credit loan. Her husband is a driver. She wants to ensure a bright future for her children, to own a shop to showcase her products, and later move into international trade. She began her activity in 2006.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Phionah

texts.en: Phiona is a thirty-two-year-old hardworking married woman with three children, living in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She looks after her family with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. Their dream is to educate their children. She is a petrol station attendant and also a custodian and has been in service for ten years. Phiona intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business so as to supplement their income.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and start a transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy generic health products

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida,représentante du groupe d’affaire « Zawadi»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Son mari est vendeur de chèvres au marché Kahembe. Elle fait le petit commerce des divers. Elle  installe ses marchandises  dans une boutique (kiosque). Elle exerce cette  activité depuis 1992. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  18 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  25 kg de sucre, 1 carton de laits Nido, 1 casier de Fanta, 25 kg de savon Omo, 10 paires de babouches, 3 cartons de lotions de beauté, sel, allumettes, carton de PH, etc., le reste d’argent servira pour la réalisation de microprojets familiaux.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « zawadi» est majoritairement féminins qui intègrent la discipline et rigueur dans la gestion de leurs affaires.
texts.en: The customer Faida, who is the representative of the Zawadi business group, is a 38-year old entrepreneur; she is married and mother to seven children who are all studying. Her husband sells goats at the Kahembe market. She has a small trading business selling a variety of products. She has all her goods set up on a stand. She has been carrying out this business since 1992 and hduring this time as had eighteen loans from Hékima. This new loan will be used to buy 25kg of sugar, a carton of Nido milk, a case of Fanta, 25kg of Omo soap powder, ten pairs of "babouches" (oriental slippers), three boxes of beauty lotion, salt, matches, boxes of toilet paper etc..; the rest of the money will be used for small family projects. Furthermore, her ambition is to be able to pay for her children's schooling. The customer is grateful Hékima for its actions in favour of poor women who have no access to classic banks. It should be noted that the Zawadi business group is primarily composed of women who manage their businesses with discipline and rigor.

loans.use: to pay for 25kg of sugar, one box of Nido milk, I case of Fanta, 25kg of Omo soap powder, ten pairs of oriental slippers ("babouches"), three boxes of beauty lotion, salt, matches, boxes of toilet paper etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Agbéwabi

texts.fr: En 2007, Mme a décidé de vendre des objets en plastique (bassines, assiettes, glacières) dans sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son conjoint est chauffeur et ils ont en charge 03 enfants. Ce prêt l’aidera à relancer son activité afin de subvenir à l’avenir de ses enfants.  Elle vend auusi des sandalettes.
texts.en:
In 2007, this lady decided to sell plastic objects (basins, plates, coolers) in her shop. She gets her supplies from the Grand Market in Lomé. Her husband is a driver and they care for three children. This loan will help boost her business in order to provide for 
her children’s future. She also sells sandals.

loans.use: to buy plastic products

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
Abdulatif has been selling foods for eight years. He sells sugar, sweets, oil, tomatoes etc. His mother helps him in this business. He purchases the goods from the market of "Farovon" in Dushanbe city. His store is located in a crowded place in the market of "Ganj." 

Abdulatif wants to expand his business and increase the assortments of his goods. He would like to get a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to purchase new goods in order to expand his business and increase the assortment of his goods. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food for his store

loans.name: Tusiimye Development Group

texts.en:
Even though Rose has had a secretarial services business for five years, most friends of the 50-year-old say she has the makings of a Christian Evangelist, given the fact that she walks around with a Bible most of the time. 

As the group picture on here shows, the single mother of six completely looks a picture of good health. Many of her friends describe Rose as a tough cookie, driven by ambition and self confidence. Rose, who is aided by her daughter at her shop, says she got inspiration from her significant other, that is her husband, in starting this business. 

Rose is a teacher by profession and she started off by teaching. At length, she used some of her savings to start this business. She does some tailoring on the side too. Weekly she says this business generates revenue to the tune of 100,000 shillings. 

Rose wants to revamp her secretarial business with a better computer. The purchase of this new computer is what this Kiva loan is for, she says.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer to use in her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last 21 years. He is 51 years old, married to Rachael, and they have five school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to plant potatoes in his farm. He will use the loan  to buy the seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labor during planting. 

In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizer, and pay for labour

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last 10 years. She is 48 years old, married to Joshua, and together they have four school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. 

She plans to plant potatoes on her farm, and so she will use the loan to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In the future, Ruth hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gandjehou Group

texts.fr: GANDJEHOU est un groupe constitué de deux personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Célestine. Les membres du groupe vivent dans la même maison. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Célestine est née en 1981 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à  un certain moïse. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Célestine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Célestine mène comme activité la vente des céréales (maïs, riz) et des conserves. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Célestine s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Célestine et aux autres membres du groupe GANDJEHOU, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
GANDJEHOU is a group composed of two persons whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Célestine. The group members live in the same house. With the goal of increasing their working capital, they are requesting for the third time a loan from ALIDé. Célestine was born in 1981 in a city in Benin. She is married to a man named Moïse. The couple has three children, all in school and their care. 

To support herself and her children, Célestine runs a business selling grains (corn, rice) and canned foods. She has had this business for nearly five years. It enables her to ensure that the various family expenses are covered. She gets her supplies at one of the largest markets in Benin. This third loan will surely allow her and her group to boost their level of business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy grains and canned foods

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last 15 years. She is 38 years old, married to James, and together they have four school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to plant potatoes on her farm. She will use the loan to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In the future, Maria hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 15 years. He is 63 years old, married to Wanjiru, and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of KES. 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to plant potatoes in his farm, and so he will use the loan amount to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In future, Titus hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Makhmasharif

texts.en:
Makhmasharif is married and the father of five children. He is a hard-working man. He has been running his business selling foods for seven years. He sells eggs, cakes, sweets and other daily products. Makhmasharif purchases his goods from the firms “Shirinohoi sharki” and “Shirin” from Khujand city 2-3 times a week. His son helps him in this business. 

Makhmasharif would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase a new assortment of foods in order to expand his business and increase his working capital. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of foods.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a thirty-year-old married man with three children living in a two-bedroom house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He looks after the family with the help of his wife who is a shopkeeper and their dream is to educate their children up to university level.

For seven years Edward has been selling beans and he got his initial capital from the sale of bananas. He has challenges with inadequate funds and his dream is to own a grocery store.

Edward needs the loan to buy beans for sale.

loans.use: To buy beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Siyakhula Group

texts.en:
Nonkululeko is 29 years old and married with three children between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. None of her children attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal in Empangeni, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in business for a year selling cold drinks, sweets, snacks and perfumes, selling near a school. She says that the main challenge to her business are not having her own shelter because she rents the one that she is using. Nonkululeko requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy cold drinks, sweets, snacks and perfumes.

In future she would like to own her own shelter to use for her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life by having enough food for her family.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, sweets, snacks and perfumes.

loans.name: Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: GRÂCE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La présidente du groupe, Hortense (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 20 Septembre 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Michel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Hortense et son mari vivent ensemble avec l'enfant. Hortense a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Hortense prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.), qu'elle vend dans un quartier du Bénin. Hortense exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Hortense vend de la bouillie de maïs. Hortense s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hortense sollicite un crédit avec les membres du groupe GRÂCE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
GRÂCE DE DIEU is a group composed of three persons whose president resides in the same district in Benin. The group’s president, Hortense (whose hand is raised in the photo) was born on September 20, 1973 in Benin and is married to a mechanic by the name of Michel. The couple has two children, both in school. One of the children lives with the couple. 

Hortense has had little schooling. For nearly seven years, she has been making food (corn mash and rice served with fish sauce, etc.) that she sells in her district in Benin. She operates this business with passion, and it enables her to support herself and her children. Secondarily, she sells corn porridge. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers. Hortense is requesting a loan along with the members of the group GRÂCE DE DIEU. This loan will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sauce condiments, fish, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorry For We” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Dorise is the leader of this group. Dorise is age 40; she was born in the city of Kenema where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary school and secondary school respectively . Dorise sells fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy fish in bulk.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Mamuwa, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 21 years. He is 55 years old, married to Margaret, and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his 3rd loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to plant potatoes in his farm for the coming season, so he will use the loan amount to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In future, Samson hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a 50-year-old man married man with seven children and four dependents living in his own two-bedroom house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children to the tertiary level so they can earn a good living.

A cattle and subsistence farmer for 24 years, Benon's major challenges are seasonal changes and inadquate labour; his dream is to increase his farm supplies. Benon is requesting a loan to pay for farm labour and to buy pestcides and fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for workers on the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, onions, biscuits, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of polythene bags for sale

loans.name: Olonbayar

texts.en:
Olonbayar is a 47-year-old married man with two daughters aged 23 and 25. He lives with his wife in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a primary school teacher at a local school in the area. 

He used to work as a schoolteacher in the province of Bayankhongor but had stopped after he moved to Ulaanbaatar in 2006. Since then, he has been running a public transportation business using a minivan, based on a leasing contract. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes which lacks bus services. With the business profits, he repaid the leasing contract and managed to make the minivan his own. 

Olonbayar is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase a new engine for his vehicle. He and his wife desire to build their own small house to have better living conditions. He is a highly educated, responsible and experienced man who is very thankful for the institution and the support it has offered him.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for a minivan

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cotton cloth, gara lappers, blouses, skirts, baby clothes, etc. to add to her business

loans.name: Carol Nokuthula's Group

texts.en:
Carol is 35 years old and married with 2 children who are 4 and 18 years of age. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for 3 years selling juice, making dresses and selling them and does hiring. She also receives income from the government's child support grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is transport when she has to do orders.

Carol requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy juice and fabric materials for hiring. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her children get a better education. In future, she would like to see her business grow and end up doing a tent-hiring business.

loans.use: to buy juice and fabric material for hiring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize flour and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of polythene bags for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is high cost of transportation. 

For the past six years, she has operated a "kikoi" (traditional African cloth) sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fruit juices, her other source of income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding the juice business and incorporating mineral water for sale. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of "kanga"s for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of "kanga" (traditional African print cloth) for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for an expanded herd.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a kanga-selling business (selling traditional African cloth). She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanaisha dreams of establishing  retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of "kanga" for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of "kanga" (traditional African cloth) for sale.

loans.name: Twekembe Kabungo Namutamba Group

texts.en:
49-year-old Resty has been engaged in a food sales business for close to 30 years now in Mityana. Resty is a married mother with six kids who are all on the shady side of 20. 

Resty principally sells maize and beans. A pep talk from her brother was all she needed to set forth in this business. What plays in the favour of her business is the fact that she gets most of the crops she sells from her farm. This cuts down on the cost of operating her business. Thus far, she is basking in the glow of better sales revenue as clients increase. 

Resty says her longevity has not come easy. She has had to work hard to obtain a robust enough niche on the food market in Mityana. Weekly this business's profits add up to shillings 25,000. 

Resty has a small pig husbandry business that she also runs. This loan, she says, will help her purchase different foods that she does not normally sell like rice, sorghum, millet, cassava, bananas, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sorghum, millet, cassava, bananas,etc. to resell.

loans.name: Bidala

texts.en:
Bidalla is a married woman with one child who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling household consumption items like tomatoes, vegetables and fruit. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bidalla dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and bundles of maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and bundles of maize flour.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 36 years old. She has five children who are aged 6-15 years. Her husband is a farmer and they are happily married. Pelagie sells foodstuffs such as sorghum and some animals. She has done this business for 10 years. 

This business has enabled her to feed her family and develop her standard of living. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits. With the profit she plans to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to buy sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro trabaja como chofer propietario de un minibus en el sindicato “Señor de Mayo”de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad y compra de un motor nuevo. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Ramiro works as an owner-driver of a minibus in the “Señor de Mayo” syndicate in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle and to buy a new engine.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the Acachicala sector of La Paz.  He is single and has no children.  This is the first time he’s gotten a loan in IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy an engine and to service his minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used fridges & refrigerators for summer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es tejedora artesanal; teje y trenza mantas las mismas las comercializa en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir los gastos de la operación de vesícula biliar que se realizará, pues le ha estado molestando por mucho tiempo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto; es divorciada  y tiene tres hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: María is an artisanal weaver.  She weaves and knots blankets that she sells in various markets in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to pay for a gall bladder operation she’s going to have because it’s been bothering her for a long time.  She lives in her own house located in the Seke sector of the city of El Alto.  She is divorced and has three children.  This is her first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her gall bladder surgery.

loans.name: Belthilde

texts.en: Belthilde is 36 years old. She has six children who are ages 3-14 years. Her husband is a farmer. She is sells foodstuffs, and she has been selling foodstuffs for the past 12 years. This business has enabled her to feed her family and to pay house rent. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a married woman with two children; one attends school, while one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport expenses. 

She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She also sells window curtains, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for making window curtains for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for making window curtains for sale.

loans.name: Afrodita De Tolcayuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Afrodita de Tolcayuca" porque para las integrantes del grupo el nombre de “Afrodita” es muy representativo ya que es la diosa de la belleza. El grupo se ubica en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. La señora Xochitl es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica en Comercio. Xochitl se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene un negocio fijo en un lugar concurrido del municipio, su negocio es un bazar en la cual vende ropa y zapatos, ya tiene 14 años en su negocio. La señora Xochitl decidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa ya que le permiten obtener ingresos extras que le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar, así como apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. La señora tiene dos hijos, uno de 15 y otro de 11 años respectivamente quienes estudian actualmente en la localidad. El prestamo que solicita es principalmente para la compra de un mostrador donde pueda ofrecer de una manera más visible sus artículos y esto poder ayudarle a incrementar sus ventas. Xochitl es conocita como una mujer que lucha por tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia además de que es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y con gran carisma para sus clientes, vecinos y familiares. La foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Xochilt. Con las ganancias que obtenga seguira invirtiendo en mercancia y para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Afrodita de Tolcayuca because the name Aphrodite represents the Goddess of beauty.  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  The group is comprised of ten members.

Xochitl is the president of the group.  She is 35 years old, and she studied for a technical career in business.  Xochitl sells clothes, and she has a fixed business in a very busy place in the municipality.  Her business is a bazaar where she sells clothes and shoes.  She has had the business for 14 years.

Xochitl decided to sell clothes because it allows her to get extra income.  This helps her pay the household expenses and helps with her children’s education.  She has two children, ages 15 and 10.  They are currently in the local school.

The loan she is requesting is mainly to buy a display case where she will be able to offer her goods in a more visible way.  This will help her increase her sales.

Xochitl is known as a woman who struggles to have a better quality of life for her family.  She is an enterprising and responsible woman with great charisma for her customers, neighbors, and family members.

The photo was taken at Xochilt’s business.  With the earnings that she gets she will continue investing in merchandise and paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a display case for clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel es minero y su esposa se dedica a la venta de pescado. El crédito lo necesita para compra de material de construcción, para construir un par de habitaciones en su casa y brindar más comodidad a su familia. Vive en la zona Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto en casa propia. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2009 y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Fidel is a miner and his wife sells fish.  He needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a pair of rooms on his house and provide more comfort for his family.  He lives in the Los Andes sector of the city of El Alto in his own house.  He’s been our client since 2009 and this is the second time his loan has been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a restaurant business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is 46 years old. She has 5 children who are between 9 and 17 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Stephanie sells a local drink called Ubushera, made out of sorghum. This business has enabled her meet her needs and feed her family as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and continue making more Ubushera. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina realiza trámites legales ya que ella trabaja como notaria en la provincia Loayza del Departamento de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de un curso de post grado para mejorar sus conocimientos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  en la ciudad de La Paz,  es separada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en: Cristina facilitates legal paperwork because she works as a Notary in Loayza Province of La Paz Department.  She needs the loan to pay for a post graduate course to improve her knowledge.  She lives in her own house located in the Tembladerani sector of the city of La Paz.  She’s separated and has a son.

loans.use: to pay for a Law post graduate course.

loans.name: Nineth

texts.es: Nineth trabaja vendiendo zapatos en un puesto de venta de su propiedad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una movilidad así podrá traer mayor cantidad de mercadería y bajara el costo de transporte, pues ella viaja a la frontera con Chile para comprar los calzados que vende. Vive en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Nineth works selling shoes from a sales stall that she owns.  She needs this loan to buy a vehicle that she can use to transport a larger quantity of merchandise and thereby lower her transport costs as she travels to the Chilean border to buy the footwear that she sells.  

Nineth rents her accommodation in Villa Nueva Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has had a loan from IMPRO

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to use when going to buy shoes so that she can save on transport costs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is under age. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, he has raised vegetables for sale, selling at the market to his neighboring community members. He faces major challenges of high cost of transportation and seasonality in his business. Stephen dreams of expanding his business to earn more income to improve his family living standards.

With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Desde hace unos años Álvaro Antonio comenzó su negocio de diligencias en horas de la tarde, ya que en la mañana trabaja como empleado en una empresa.

Álvaro para poder mantener su negocio y para que pueda crecer necesita tener un crédito para sacar sus tarjetas personales y así poder incrementar sus clientes, además de esta forma el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: A few years ago Álvaro Antonio started his small message delivery and odd jobs business in the afternoons since he’s employed by a firm mornings.  In order for Álvaro to keep his business running and so that it can grow he needs a loan to print his personal business cards so that he can increase his customer base.  Besides, he will also be able to improve his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to print his business cards.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de chocolates que los vende en colegios y su esposo es mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción  para la construcción de un muro divisorio en la casa donde vive. Vive en casa de parientes ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Tembladerani de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos  hijos, es la primera vez que Guadalupe tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Guadalupe's business is selling chocolates in schools.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She needs this loan to buy construction supplies to build a dividing wall in her home.  Guadalupe lives in a house which belongs to her relatives, in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is her first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy bricks and sand to build a dividing wall in her home

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es: Maria Nelly tiene 52 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora. Ella tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que sus inicios no fueron muy fáciles ya que ella era madre soltera y tenía que buscar la manera de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, pues con todos los sacrificios que Maria ha hecho ha podido salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de lápiz labial, ropa en general, perfumes, calzado y bolsos.
texts.en:
Maria Nelly is 52 years old and her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years.  She has always been a very tenacious and hard-working person.  Maria has three children who all work independently. 

Maria had a hard time initially as she was a single mother and she had to find a way to cover her household expenses.  However, with all the sacrifices that she has made, she has managed to get ahead in life.  She is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, clothes, perfume, footwear and bags.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, clothes, perfume, footwear and bags

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean de Dieu is 31 years old. He has 3 children who are between 1 and 4 years old. His wife is a farmer, while Jean de Dieu sells clothes. He has been selling clothes for the past 2 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell and make more profits. He wants to renovate his house with the profits he plans to make.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Desde hace muchos años María Elena ha trabajado toda su vida en restaurantes, sin embargo desde hace 15 años ella decide montar su propio negocios en su casa vendiendo comidas rápidas como tortas de chócolo, empanadas y buñuelos.


Ella quiere ofrecer mas variedad de productos y para esto necesita algunos implementos de cocina que le permitan realizar las comidas y en mayor cantidad, además al crecer su negocios le permitirá a ella y su familia mejorar sus calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elena had worked her whole life in restaurants.  However, 15 years ago, she decided to set up her own business in her home selling fast food such as 'torta de choclo' (a kind of Colombian cornbread), empanadas and 'buñuelos' (a type of doughnut).

María Elena would like to offer her customers a greater variety of products and, in order to achieve this, she needs some cooking implements that will help her to make her meals and make them in larger quantities.  This enable her to grow her business and allow her and her family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cooking implements

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar es chofer y trabaja con una volqueta de su propiedad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, estuco) para la refacción de una habitación. Vive en casa de parientes ubicada en la zona de de la ciudad Villa Adela  de la ciudad de El Alto; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Edgar is a driver and he works with a dump truck that he owns.  He needs this loan to buy construction supplies (sand, cement and plaster) to refurbish a room.

Edgar lives in a house belonging to some relatives which is located in Villa Adela district, in the city of El Alto.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  This is his first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and plaster to refurbish a room in his home

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with 2 children, both of whom are still young for school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a photography business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a retail shop which contributes to his other source of income. Patrick faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing a petrol station in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, he wants to purchase petrol for sale and bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for his retail shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for sale and bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for his retail shop

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: La señorita María persona soltera es bueno saber que  lucha en la vida por tener una buena educación y mejorar su forma de vida, la actividad que realizan es de la venta de comida el negocio  de una restaurante familiar mucho tiempo funcionando y se encuentra en un crecimiento considerable por el cual solicito  un préstamo en la institución para comprar pintura para el pintado y refacción del restaurante, como se describió anteriormente inicio su negocio  hace mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados ya que los platos que sirve son de muy agradables para su clientela, siendo este un emprendimiento de una mujer es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días a partir de las 09:00 am hasta las 22:00 pm,  esta es la rutina de María atienden todos los días de la semana, para que amabas puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a single woman.  It is good to know that she works hard in life to have a good education and improve her way of living.

María's business is selling meals.  She owns a family restaurant business which has been around for a long time.   As her business is growing considerably right now, María requested a loan from our institution so that she could buy paint in order to paint and refurbish her restaurant.  As we have already said, she started her business a long time ago, with very humble beginnings, and obtained good results because the dishes that she serves are very good.  This woman's venture is well valued for the effort that she puts in every day, from 9.00am to 10.00pm.  This is the routine that María works every day of the week so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her capital and paint her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Glorious

texts.en: Glorious is 22 years old and has a 7 month old baby. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells food items and rears animals such as goats. She has done this business for 2 years. This business enables her to meet her needs and everything is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs. With the expected profits, she wants to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passerby. Samuel faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing a pick-up to transport his charcoal. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén desde muy joven ha trabajado con su tío en una carnicería y ha aprendido esta actividad y disfruta de ella, es por esto que desde hace varios años él decide tener su propio negocio que no solo es carnicería sino también frutera y legumbrería.

Este negocio le ha permitido mantener a su familia que es su mamá y su hijo, Rubén quiere que su negocio crezca y poder tener más adelante su propio local y para que sus ingresos se incrementen y así le pueda mejorar la calidad de vida a su hijo necesita tener un buen surtido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubén had worked with his uncle since he was very young in a butcher shop.  He has learned this occupation and enjoys it.  Because of this several years ago he decided to have his own business that’s not just a butcher shop but also a fruit and vegetables store.

This business has made it possible for him to support his family which consists of his mother and his son.  Rubén needs his business to grow and to have a locale of his own later on and so that his income will rise and he can provide his son with a better quality of life he needs to have more varied stock for his business.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto hombre soltero que tiene como actividad laboral el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi) cabe mencionar que es de nuestra entera satisfacción saber que lucha y pasa los obstáculos que la vida le pone en frente todo para darle una buena y mejor vida a su madre y para mejorar sus ingresos decidió solicitar otro préstamo en la institución para emprender un nuevo negocio que llegaría a ser la venta de almendras al por mayor  lo que el comprara con el dinero del crédito es almendras,  tiene una competitividad baja en el mercado por eso el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento que puede tener gracias al crédito otorgado en la institución, de manera sacrificada pero rentable y obteniendo buenos resultados el rendimiento es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, para que el y en compañía de su madre puedan tener una mejor calidad y forma de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Humberto is single and offers taxi service. It is of great satisfaction to us knowing he works hard to overcome any obstacles life presents him to offer his mother a well and improved life. To increase profits he decided to request a loan to start a new business where he sells wholesale almonds and will use the loan to buy almonds. There is a low level of competition in this market which is why he plans on investing the loan in this business. The hard work he does every day is valued for the profitable and well results he gets so that he and his mother can have a better quality of life and higher standard of living.

loans.use: buy almonds for his new business.

loans.name: Yonny Alberto

texts.es:
Yonny siempre ha trabajado en el campo como administrador de fincas y conoce muy bien la producción de leche, luego de un tiempo Yonny decide dejar su empleo y comprar algunas vacas para comenzar su propio negocio.

Es por esto, que Yonny necesita no solo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia sino que necesita que su negocios crezca y para  esto va a comprar 2 vacas que le van a incrementar la producción de leche y así sus ingresos mejoraran.
texts.en:
Yonny has always worked in the fields running farms.  He is very knowledgeable about milk production.  After some time, Yonny decided to leave work and buy a few cows to start his own business.

Because of this, Yonny needs not only to improve his family’s quality of life but he also needs his business to grow and to accomplish this he will buy two cows that will increase milk production which will lead to improved income.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 45 years old. She has eight children who are ages 6-25 years old and all are in school. Her husband is a tailor; she is also a tailor, and she has been a tailor for the past 25 years. She enjoys her profession. She is requesting a loan to buy some fabrics and some tailoring materials. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making different styles for her clients.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Raphael has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He also operates a farming business that  contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the 70,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a water tank, do plumbing to sell water, and to purchase a generator. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and do plumbing to sell water, and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge Antonio tiene 44 años, su actividad es un bar y comedor. Hace más de 4 años que lo tiene, el local se encuentra en un punto en donde es transitado por muchos clientes pues él lo inicio con su compañera de vida con el objetivo de buscar ingresos para su hogar, por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo el se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras de los granos básicos,  azúcar, aceite, frutas, verduras y bolsas plásticas. El financiamiento es para comprar materia prima. El sueño de Jorge es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Jorge Antonio is 44 years old.  His business is a bar and eatery.  He has had his business for more than 4 years.  It is currently at a point where it is busy with lots of customers.  He started the business with his wife with the aim of creating income for his home, as he has 3 children to support.  He gets up very early to make his purchases of basic grains, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables and plastic bags.  The loan is for the purchase of raw materials.  Jorge's dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables and plastic bags.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: La señora Laureana se dedica a la elaboración D. pan en su domicilio hace 11 años labor que realiza con la ayuda D. su familia y su esposo quien le ayuda a comercializar entregando tienda por tienda en su barrio y en distintas zonas D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba el crédito que se le dio a  la Sra. Es para incrementar el capital D. trabajo que cuenta por que por la época D. frio aumenta la demanda D. pan y comprara Harina y manteca por cantidad, ella vive en casa propia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Laureana has run a bakery for the last 11 years with the help of her family and husband, who help deliver bread to stores throughout Cochabamba. She now seeks credit to build her working capital ahead of the winter season's corresponding increase in demand for fresh bread.  She plans to buy flour and butter wholesale to increase production and meet local demand.  Laureana is a hardworking woman who supports her household and is very grateful for the access to credit she has been given.

loans.use: to increase working capital for a community bakery

loans.name: Clay Bayardo

texts.en:
Clay is 39 years old and lives near the city of San Gabriel in northern Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, aged 18, 15, and 8. He describes himself as a peaceful person who likes to work and does not neglect his daily tasks. 

His work is agricultural. He plants peas, barley and carrots. He began farming on his own but he ran low on money and started working for wages. This is his first loan and he is going to use it to grow his own crops of carrots and peas. Clay believes that this loan will improve the life of his family, his income, and his crops. His future goal is to increase his business and buy his own home.

loans.use: to grow peas and carrots.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a married man with one boy and one girl. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the purchase of seeds during farming season, from the month of May to July. For the past year, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, his potential customers being neighbors and passersby. He also does construction, which contributes to his other source of income. Hamisi faces a major challenge of the high cost of fuel. He dreams of building rental houses in the future. With the 70,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Dorena Oleiva

texts.es:
Dorena desde hace 5 años tiene su propio negocio de comidas rápidas donde ofrece perros, hamburguesas, chuzos, carne asada entre otros, ella le gusta este oficio y con el ha podido mantener a su familia y darle una buena calidad de vida.

Ella quiere que su negocio crezca y por eso necesita comprar sillas, mesas y otros utensilio e insanos para brindarle a sus clientes una mejor atención y mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Dorena has had her own fast food business for five years where she sells hotdogs, hamburgers, shish kabobs, and grilled meat among other things. She likes this business and has been able to support her family and give them a good quality of life with it.

She wants her business to grow. That is why she needs to buy chairs, tables, other utensils and supplies to provide better attention and more variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Amaraa

texts.en:
Amaraa, age 49 and the mother of three children, lives with her husband and the youngest son in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest two sons live separately but her youngest son, who graduated college this year, lives with his parents. Amaraa has been operating a butcher shop for over 10 years. 

She runs her stall at local outdoor market called “Kharkhorin” with help from her husband. She has a large number of customers, including public-service establishments, who buy flesh meat every day. Although the income is considerably high, usually 95 percent is expected as an expense. She supported her oldest sons to start their lives with the profit she made (small house, furniture, electric goods, etc.).

Amaraa is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to order and purchase more flesh meat before Naadam, the biggest Mongolian national holiday. She is a bright and experienced woman who supports children as well as being willing to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flesh meat products for the upcoming holiday.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: La Sra.
