Bernardina vive en la localidad de el torno,  percibe renta de un vehículo hace unos años, y en las noche es educadora en un centro para personas mayores(cema), es nacida el mismo municipio, es soltera con compromiso, sus padres son nacidos en el departamento de Cochabamba donde muy jóvenes se vinieron a la localidad de el torno en busca de nuevos horizontes,  es la mayor de tres hermanos, de sus ingreso que percibe les ayuda a sus padres, el destino del crédito es para realizarle un buen mantenimiento a su vehículo, trabaja tiempo con la institución por lo que se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo financiero brindado.
texts.en: Bernardina lives in the the town of El Torno. For several years she has received rent from a vehicle. At night she is an educator at a center for older people. She was born in the same town. She is single and is engaged. Her parents were born in the Cochabamba region. When they were very young they came to the town of El Torno in search of new horizons. She is the oldest of three siblings. From her income that she receives, she helps her parents. The loan will be used to perform maintenance on her vehicle. She feels thankful to the institution for the financial support that it provides.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with four children. Three of the children attend school and one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighbors and passersby. He sells household consumptions like maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase 10 bundles of maize flour, 5 sacks of sugar and 5 gallons of cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Carlos Tulio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Carlos es cultivador de legumbres en la vereda El Porvenir, el cultiva en su casa lulo, fríjol, tomate y otros, sin embargo en algunos momentos trabaja como jornalero en otras fincas.

Él con este trabajo sostiene su familia y para poder mantener su negocios necesita tener un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y así la producción nace de excelente calidad y la puede vender a buen precio y así se incrementa sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos grows vegetables in El Porvenir district.  He grows 'lulo' (a native fruit), beans, tomatoes and other crops.  However, sometimes he also works as a day laborer on other people's farms.

Through this work, Carlos supports his family.  In order to be able to keep his business running, he needs a loan so that he can maintain his crops and ensure an excellent-quality production which he can sell for a good price and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a grocery business selling vegetables, onions and potatoes at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanasiti dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of cabbages, sacks of onions, and 1 sack of potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Filomena Roxana

texts.es: La señora Filomena se dedica a la venta de artículos de temporada en esta época vende ropa como chompas y blusas, comenzó con esta actividad desde joven junto a su amiga ahora venden estos productos en la ceja de el alto y en ferias zonales, poco a poco logro reunir un capital considerable, donde los ingresos que le genera esta actividad le ayuda con los gastos familiares, su esposo es albañil y ambos viven con sus hijos en casa de su suegra. Es la primera vez que solicitan crédito en una institución financiera. Con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir parte de su domicilio,  ahora solicitan el crédito para terminar la construcción de dos cuartos más y dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Se esfuerzan para brindar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Mrs. Filomena sells seasonal goods.  This time of year she sells sweaters and blouses.  She started working together with her friend when she was very young.  Now they sell these products in Ceja de El Alto and local fairs.  Little by little she was able to save a considerable amount of money.  Her earnings from this job help pay for family expenses.  Her husband is a masonry worker and both live in her mother-in-law’s house with their children.  This is the first time she has applied for a loan from a financial institution.  Through much effort they were able to build part of their house and now they are applying for the loan to finish building two more rooms to make their children more comfortable.  They try hard to offer their children a better future.

loans.use: BUY BUILDING MATERIALS TO FINISH TWO BEDROOMS

loans.name: Ryssalatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de légumes et boites de conserves, Rysselatou est mère de 02 enfants. Son conjoint est policier. Elle s’approvisionne à Baguida et revend au même lieu. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: A retailer of vegetables and canned food, Rysselatou is the mother of two children. Her husband is a police officer. She buys and resells in Baguida. This loan will be used to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy staple food items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene como principal actividad económica el servicio de transporte, trabaja en el radio taxi por mas de 2 años, gracias al préstamo de una institución financiera pudo comprar un taxi con el que trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche casi todos los días, su esposa ayuda con los gastos familiares con el ingreso que tiene con la actividad de trenzado de mantas para señoras de pollera, viven en la ciudad de el alto con su hijo que aun es pequeño, en un futuro piensa comprar su domicilio para dar comodidad a su hijo y a su esposa, por el momento ambos  trabajan todos los días para poder reunir dinero para un anticrético de un departamento por esto solicito el crédito para aumentar para el anticrético.  Don juan trabaja con la institución desde el año 2010 demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juan's main business activity is providing a transport service.  He has been working in the radio taxi business for more than two years.  Thanks to a loan from a financial institution, he was able to buy a taxi which he works with from morning to night, almost every day.  Juan's wife helps cover the family expenses with the income that she makes braiding shawls for 'señoras de pollera' (women who wear traditional outfits).

The couple live in the city of El Alto with their young son.  In the future, Juan plans to buy his home so that he can provide his son and wife with more comfort.  At the moment, both he and his wife work every day in order to be able to put together enough money to pay the 'anticrético'* on an apartment.  They are requesting this loan to increase their 'anticrético'* payment.  Juan has been working with the institution since 2010.  He has shown responsibility and punctuality in making his payments.

*'Anticrético' is a special type of arrangement in which property is 'loaned' to a tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment.  The rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period.

loans.use: to increase his 'anticrético' payment on an apartment

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías, de 32 años es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gilma de 30 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Isaías los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, que junto a su moto furgón sale en busca de productos para transportar. Él trabaja para los almacenes de la ciudad de Pucallpa, a quienes les hace el servicio de transportar productos como arroz, azúcar, agua mineral, etc., productos que son muy pesados, pero que gracias a la practicidad de su moto furgón, puede transportar sin problemas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Pucallpa, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche y a veces es muy peligroso. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una nueva moto furgón. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su moto furgón, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en: Isaías, who is 32 years old, is a very modest and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, 30-year old Gilma, and their 3 dear children.  He wants to be able to give his children a better quality of life.  For Isaías, the workday starts very early in the morning.  He goes out on his moto-van to look for products to transport.  He works for the groceries in the city of Pucallpa.  He offers the service of transporting products like rice, sugar, mineral water etc., products that are very heavy, but that thanks to the practicality of his moto-van, he can transport without any problem.  What Isaías likes most about his work is driving through the streets of Pucallpa; he finds it very enjoyable.  He has been in this business for 2 years, and he finds that the most difficult parts are having to work until late at night and that at times it is very dangerous work.  In time, Isaías hopes to save enough money to buy a new moto-van.  This will be Isaías's second loan with MFP.  He is aware that must be responsible for making his payments on time, as he doesn't want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank, by whom he is  well liked.  With the one-thousand two-hundred nuevos soles ($450 USD) that Isaías has requested, he will purchase new tires for his moto-van.  The ones he currently has are worn out from hard use.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his moto-van.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelly desde hace 6 años trabaja como ventera ambulante, ella vende tinto, mecato, confites y jugos, ella vive de su negocio y con el consigue el sustento diario para su  familia, sin embargo con sus problemas de salud hay días en que no puede trabajar sino unas pocas horas en el día.

Ella necesita tener su negocio con más surtido para que cuando no se sienta enferma pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y pueda recuperar los días en que no trabaja.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Nelly has been working as a street vender.  She sells black coffee, packed lunches, sweets and juices.  Nelly supports herself through her business and with it, she earns enough to provide for her family.  However, with her health problems, there are days in which she can only work for a few hours.

Nelly needs to have her business more well-stocked so that when she isn't feeling sick, she can offer a greater variety of products for sale and make up for the days that she can't work.

loans.use: to purchase consumables.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, de 33 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto esposa Llerlit de 23 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Precia de 4 y Yaisy de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El persistente trabajo de Marcial poco a poco va dando frutos, la pollería que con tanto esfuerzo a puesto cada día tiene más clientes. Y es que “El Aeropuerto”, que es como se llama su local, es uno de los lugares más concurridos, debido a la gran atención que brinda, pero sobre todo a la deliciosa sazón que tienen sus comidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ya que el es el administrador del restaurante, lleva ya 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es satisfacer a sus clientes y brindarles un buen servicio, ya que las personas son muy exigentes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Espera con el tiempo que su pollería crezca y se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de sus ustedes para cumplir con su propósito. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas para mejorar el ambiente de su pollería.
texts.en: Marcial, who is 33 years old, is a very friendly and modest man.  He lives in his own home with his 23-year old wife, Llerlit, and their 2 dear children, 4 year old Precia and 2 year old Yaisy.  He wants to give his children a better quality of life.  With Marcial's persistent work, his chicken restaurant is, little by little, bearing fruit; every day he has more customers.  His restaurant, "El Aeropuerto”, is one of the most popular places, due to the great service, but especially because of their deliciously seasoned dishes.  What Marcial likes best about his work is seeing to his customers, as he is the manager of the restaurant.  Marcial has been in this business for 4 years, and he feels that the most difficult part is satisfying his customers and giving them good service, as the people are very demanding.  Even so, he knows that that is his job and he has to see to it.  Marical hopes that in time his chicken restaurant will grow to be one of the best known in the city.  This will be Marcial's third loan with MFP,  and he therefore hopes for the support of each one of you in following through with his plan.  With the two-thousand five-hundred nuevos soles ($925 USD) that he has requested, Marcial will purchase new tables and chairs to improve the atmosphere in his chicken restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz, tiene 22 años, ella esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía no asisten a clases, ella junto a su esposo  ofrecen Servicio de Amplificación para fiestas y otros eventos, además de ofrecer alquiler de sillas, mesas y manteles a los diferentes colegios y eventos particulares que atienden. Hoy ellos necesitan del crédito ya que con el tiempo han aprovechado de comprar una fotocopiadora que funciona junto a un colegio y quieren implementar un punto internet, ya cuentan con los monitores y sólo les falta la caja para colocar las tarjetas y sistema técnico de las computadoras por eso solicito el crédito para la compra de una  computadora, Ellos a pesar de jóvenes se caracterizan por ser responsables ya que no es la primera vez que trabajan con Emprender y hemos podido ver como empezaron vendiendo comida y luego ir implementado el servicio Alquiler de Amplificación,  fotocopiadora y ahora el punto internet.
texts.en: Señora Beatriz is 22.  She is married and has 2 children who are still too young for school. She and her husband rent sound systems for parties and other events, and also offer rentals of chairs, tables and linens to the different schools and special events that they attend. Today they need the loan as over time they have purchased a photocopier that is shared with a school, and now they want to start offering internet access.  They have monitors and lack only the hard drive and computer technical system.  This is why they asking for a loan to purchase a computer.  Although they are young, they are responsible and this is not the first time that they have worked with Emprender.  We have been able to see how they started selling food and then gone on to provide their audio systems rental service, photocopying and now internet access.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Jesuwanou Group

texts.fr: JESUWANOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La présidente du groupe, Brigitte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 08 octobre 1966 et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Brigitte et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant. Brigitte n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Brigitte exerce comme activité depuis près de six ans la vente des plateaux d'œufs frais. Brigitte s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de leur clientèle, et pour mieux se prendre à charge, Brigitte sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWANOU.
texts.en: Jesuwanou is a group of three people; all three members live in the same home.  The group’s president, Brigitte (who is raising her hand in the photo), was born October 8th, 1966, and is married to a man named Albert.  The couple has three children, all attending school, with one still in their care.  Brigitte and her husband live together with their child.  Brigitte never went to school.  Over the last six years, in order to meet her needs and her child’s needs, she has been selling cartons of fresh eggs.  She gets her supplies in one of Benin’s largest markets.  Wanting to both satisfy her clients and better support herself financially, Brigitte is asking for a loan along with the other members of the Jesuwanou group.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic necessities

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo, oriundo de Oropeza Sucre, su actividad es de albañil, esta prestando su servicio en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, desde hace ya varios años se vino de su ciudad Natal buscando un futuro mejor para su familia, el sr. Máximo esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una mezcladora ya que en eso invertirá el dinero que solicito y así tener un buen rendimiento en su trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida, es muy trabajador y desea lo mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo is originally from Oropeza Sucre.  He is a builder and provides his services in the city of Santa Cruz.  Several years ago he came to Santa Cruz from his home town looking for a better future for his family.

Máximo is grateful to our organization for having placed our trust in him and provided him with the support he needs to be able to buy a cement mixer (this is what he will invest his loan money in).  This will enable him to provide a good service and improve his quality of life.  Máximo is very hard working and would like the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer

loans.name: Dagbewato Group

texts.fr: DAGBEWATO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La présidente du groupe, Henriette Marie José (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 15 juillet 1967 au Bénin et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Patrice. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent encore à leur charge.  Henriette Marie José  et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Henriette Marie José n'a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Henriette Marie José mène comme activité la vente des produits divers (conserves, savons). Henriette Marie José exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Henriette Marie José vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Henriette Marie José s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Henriette Marie José  sollicite un troisième crédit avec les  autres membres du groupe DAGBEWATO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Dagbewato is a group of three people, all living in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group’s president, Henriette Marie José (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born July 15th, 1967, in Benin, and is married to an accountant named Patrice.  The couple has four children, all attending school, two of which are still in their care.  Henriette Marie José and her husband live together with their children.  Henriette Marie José only attended school through elementary level.  For nearly five years, she has been working selling various products (canned goods, soaps).  Her devotion to her business enables her to meet both her own and her childrens’ needs.  Henriette Maria José also sells prepaid telephone cards on the side.  Henriette Marie José gets her supplies at one of Benin’s largest markets.  In her desire to satisfy her customers, she is requesting a third loan along with the other members of the Dagbewato group.  This loan will help them better meet their customers’ demand and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soaps and prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela, de 23 años, es una joven muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La vida de Pamela no fue muy sencilla, desde muy pequeña siempre se preocupo por ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Actualmente ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, siendo ofrecidas de forma ambulante, y adquiere la cantidad de prendas de  acuerdo a los pedidos que le hagan sus clientes. Entre las prendas que ofrece están las casacas, chompas, pantalones, polos entre otros accesorios novedosos.  Lleva 2 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, ahora anhela aumentar su stock y tener más prendas de vestir para vender, lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, aun así esta dispuesta a cualquier sacrificio con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Asimismo cumplirá con sus cuotas, como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene.
texts.en:
Pamela is 23 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home.  What she wants more than anything is to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.

Pamela's life wasn't very straightforward.  She has always been concerned, since she was very young, about helping with the household expenses.  She currently has a business selling clothes as an itinerant street vendor.  She acquires a certain quantity of clothes in accordance with the orders that her customers make with her.  Among the garments she offers are jackets, sweaters, pants, tops and other new accessories.  She has been in this business for two years and what she most enjoys is chatting to her customers.  She would now like to increase her stock and have more items of clothes to sell.  What Pamela least enjoys about her work is having to walk all day long in search of customers.  However, she is prepared to make sacrifices in order to achieve her goals.

This will be Pamela's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to be receive your support.  She will make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Pamela is a very well-liked and well-respected member of her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes to increase the quantity of merchandise she has available.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: La Campanita Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LA CAMPANITA"; ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR DIEZ INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA ANGELA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA; ES AMA DE CASA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS DOS NIÑAS Y UN NIÑO. DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA CRÍA Y VENTA DE POLLOS Y DESDE HACE UN AÑO Y MEDIO SE DEDICA A LA CRIA DE POLLOS, NOS COMENTA QUE GRACIAS A QUE HA INVERTIDO EN EL NEGOCIO DE LOS POLLOS ELLA CONTRUYO SU CASA LA CUAL TODAVIA NO TERMINA. ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO PODER INVERTIR MAS YA QUE EN ESTA TEMPORADA ES CUANDO TIENE MAS VENTAS. ANGELA REALIZA SUS VENTAS DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD Y VAN PERSONAS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A COMPRARLE TAMBIEN EN SU DOMICILIO, ELLA DICE QUE EL EXITO DE SU NEGOCIO SE DEBE A QUE DA A BUEN PRECIO Y SIEMPRE TRATA DE TENER UNA CANTIDAD SUFICIENTE PARA NO QUEDARLE MAL A SUS CLIENTES. ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR MAYAS Y ALIMENTO PARA LOS POLLOS. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE EMOCIONADA Y TIENE PLANEADO BRINDARLES A SUS HIJAS LOS ESTUDIOS QUE ELLA NO TUVO PARA QUE TENGAN UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA Y PUEDAN VALERSE POR SI MISMAS.
texts.en: This communal bank is called "La Campanita" (The Little Bell).  It is located in the State of Mexico.  The group is of made up of ten members.  Sra. Angela is a member of the group.  She attended primary school and is a homemaker.  She has 3 children, two daughters and one son.  For the last three years, she has made her living raising and selling chickens, and for the last year and a half she has raised chickens.  She tells us that thanks to what she has invested in her chicken business, she was able to start building a house, which is not yet finished.  She hopes that with the loan she will be able to invest more, since this is the season for high sales.  Sra. Angela makes her sales within her community and some people come from nearby communities to purchase from her in her home.  Sra. Angela says that the success of her business is due to the good prices she offers and because she always tries to have a sufficient quantity of chickens on hand so as to not make a bad impression on her customers.  Sra. Angela is requesting the loan to purchase corn and feed for the chickens.  At the time that she requested the loan, Sra. Angela was feeling excited.  She plans to offer her daughters the education that she never had so they can have a better quality of life and be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase corn and feed for her chicken business.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Luego de terminar su bachillerato Carlos Arturo decide viajar a la Costa Colombiana a conocer el mar y allí aprendió a hacer artesanías.

Al regresar a Medellín comienza su negocio de artesanías que las vende en el parque San Antonio desde hace ya muchos años y para que su negocio crezca y el pueda tener su sustento diario necesita comprar insumos para mantener su negocio surtido y con variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
After obtaining his high school diploma, Carlos Arturo decided to travel to the Colombian coast to spend some time by the sea.  There he learned to make handicrafts.

When he returned to Medellín, Carlos set up his business selling handicrafts in San Antonio park.  He has been in this business for many years now.  In order for his business to grow and in order for him to be able to earn a daily living, he needs to buy supplies to keep his business stocked with a variety of products for his customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Houmaiyetou

texts.fr: En 2007, Mme Houmaiyatou  a commencé par  vendre de façon ambulante des produits génériques après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. Mère de 02 enfants, elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant plus de stock. Son conjoint est chauffeur.  En plus de produits génériques, elle vend des sachets plastiques.
texts.en: In 2007, Mrs. Houmaiyatou started selling generic products from place to place after stocking up at the main market in Lome.  Mother of 2 children, she would like to strengthen her business by buying more inventory.  Her husband is a driver.  In addition to generic products, she sells plastic bags.

loans.use: to buy generic products

loans.name: El Cocal Group

texts.es:
La señora América, vive  en la Ribera Copano, ella es casada con el señor Bersain y con quien procreo diez hijos quienes ya todos están casados y está muy orgullosa de cada uno de ellos.

    Se dedica a la compra  y venta de ropas para luego venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad, en esta actividad lleva un año y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a ha estado obteniendo ingreso en su hogar así apoya a su esposo quien trabaja en el campo.

    Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por una conocida quien le ofreció las ropa a un buen precio y que trabajara con ella apoyándola a vender y lo que  vendiera lo iban a partir así apoyar con sus ingresos, fue como se animo  y es como esta trabajando con esta pequeña actividad.

    Lo que quisiera  es lo gran seguir trabajando con el préstamo y  su actividad para así salir adelante junto  con la  bendición.

     Las  personas que integran en el grupo son: la señora Efrocinia, quien se dedica a la compra  y venta de pollos para venderlo destazados, como también la señora Lorena quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
América lives in the village of Copano.  She is married to Bersain and they have ten children, all of whom are married.  She is very proud of each and every one of them.

América buys clothes which she later sells in communities near her town.  She has been in this business for one year and she tells us that it is doing well.  Through her business she has been making income for her household and thereby supporting her husband who works on the land.

América started in this business when an acquaintance offered her some clothes at a good price and asked her to work with her, supporting her in making her sales.  What they sold they would share between them and they would thereby support themselves with their income.  América was inspired by this and it is how she comes to be working in this small business activity.

What América would like is to continue working in her business with this loan so that she can get ahead in life.

The other members of this group are: Efrocina, who buys chickens which she then sells in pieces, and Lorena who will invest her loan in buying merchandise with which to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her town

loans.name: Elvira Gregoria

texts.es: El cliente de nombre: ELVIRA, productora de legumbres, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados vacunos, avícola, etc. Debido a la crianza de estos es que nuestra clienta no tiene gastos por compra de abono ella también cuenta con un terreno en la zona de CHINCHAYA el cual le ayuda en realizar el cambio de tierra de su carpa solar  el cual lo realiza cada 4 meses, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para plantar legumbres. En general nuestro cliente no tiene muchos gastos operativos. El esposo de nuestra clienta tiene la actividad de albañilería, pero por el momento se encuentra en El País de estados Unidos por un contrato de su jefe que lo llevo en el mes de Marzo por un periodo de 6 meses, de igual manera les gira dinero para sus niños los cuales son tres que se encuentran en edad escolar, es un apersona trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The client named ELVIRA is a vegetable farmer.  She is also engaged in raising cattle, poultry, etc.. It is because of the raising of these livestock that our client does not have expenses for purchasing fertilizer.  She also has some land in the CHINCHAYA area, where she changes over her greenhouses every 4 months.  The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds to plant vegetables.  In general, our client does not have many operating expenses. Our client's husband works in masonry, but at the moment he is in the United States on a contract for his boss, who took him there in March for a period of six month.  In this way they are earning money for their three school age children.  She is a hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the assistance provided.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Nueva Organización Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama nueva organización y se integra de cinco personas y que cada uno tiene su respectiva actividad.

    Las señora quine se le timo  la entrevista se llama María del  Carmen, vive en la Rivera san Vicente de Copainala estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada y a su responsabilidad  tiene a dos hijos  y son: Víctor Habrán de  ocho años de edad y el más pequeño es Emanuel de Jesús de cinco meses de edad.

     Ella se dedica  a la elaboración de panes y solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes  cono son: huevo, aceite, quesos, azúcar, entre otros, para luego venderlo en la misma  localidad, en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello obtiene  ingresos para su hogar.

     En esta actividad se inspiro ya que también quiere apoyar su esposo con lo ingreso de la casa y así juntos sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella, en  esta actividad lleva  nueve años y cuatro meses y le está dando resultado.

    Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad pueda trabajar y con  el préstamo apoyarse con la compra de más ingredientes para poder trabajar y así tener sus  propios  ahorros para  salir adelante.

      Las personas que se integran en el grupo son: Corazón de Jesús invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Rafaelita se dedica a la elaboración de panes  para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, Vivían Ibis: compra y vende ropas, Sarita: se dedica a la compra y venta de pimienta para luego venderlo en la misma región.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Organización" has five members who each have their own businesses.

María del Carmen lives in Rivera san Vicente de Copainala, in the state of Chiapas, in México.  She is married and has two children:  Víctor Habrán, 8, and her youngest,Emanuel de Jesús, 5 months.  She makes bread for a living and is taking out a loan so she can buy ingredients like: eggs, oil, sugar, cheese, and other things.  Once she has made the bread, she sells it in her neighborhood.  She says that her business is doing well and she is making money for her family.  She started selling bread because she wanted to help her husband support the family and to help her family, the most important thing to her, get ahead.  She has been doing this for nine years and four months and is seeing a return on her investment.  

Her greatest desire is to be able to work doing what she is doing.  The loan will help her to buy more ingredients for her business and enable her to have her own savings so she can get ahead.  

The members of the communal bank are: Corazón de Jesús, who will invest her loan buying merchandise to stock her grocery store, la señora Rafaelita, who bakes and sells bread in her neighborhood, Vivían Ibis who buys and sells clothing, and Sarita who buys and sells chilies in the same region.

loans.use: para pagar la compra de ingredientes como son: huevo ,, harina, leche, queso, entre otrso., para la elaboración de panes.

loans.name: Hector Hernan

texts.es:
Hector Hernan tiene 25 años y tiene su esposa y una pequeña niña de 2 años, el trabaja como ayudante de construcción, pero desde hace 6 meses inició su negocio de velas y veladoras gracias a que un amigo le enseño este arte.

Para que su negocio crezca y pueda darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, Hector necesita materia prima para poder tener una gran producción de velas y veladoras y de esta forma poder venderlas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Hector Hernan is 25 years old, and has a wife and a little girl who's 2 years old.  He was working as a construction helper, but 6 months ago he started his business of candles and votives, thanks to a friend who taught him the art.

To grow his business and to be able to give his family a better quality of life, Hector needs raw materials in order to have a large supply of candles and votives, and in this way be able to sell them and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Zenabou

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante d’œufs de poules, Zenabou  a 02 enfants. Agée de 29ans, son conjoint est chauffeur. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et distribue à ses clients.  Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises. Il ya 6ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.
texts.en: Itinerant reseller of chicken eggs, Zenabou has 2 children.  She is 29 years old. Her husband is a driver. She stocks up in Lome and distributes to her customers. This loan will help her buy goods.  She has been in business for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de Rocío esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), ella se dedica a la venta de frutas como, plátanos, manzanas, naranjas, y verduras. Su puesto es muy surtido y concurrido por sus clientes, motivo por el cual su mercadería se vende muy rápido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, por que lo no puede dedicarle a su familia. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda mas grande donde pueda vender sus frutas con más comodidad. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más verduras, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Rocío, 38, is a very simple and humble woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Segundo, who is 47, and their 3 beloved children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  

Rocío's stall is located in the Bellavista market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa).  She sells fruit such as bananas, apples and oranges, and vegetables. Her stall is well-stocked and popular with customers, which is why her merchandise sells very quickly.  What she likes best about her job is being able to talk with the neighboring vendors.  She has spent 3 years doing this activity and believes that the hardest part is having to stay all day at her stall, so she cannot spend the time with her family.  For the future, she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell her fruit in more comfort. 

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual in paying her dues.  In her community bank, she is very dear to the members because of the joy she brings to the group. With the 1500 new soles requested, she will buy more vegetables, because she wishes to improve her sales position.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to grow her business.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Close to Habiba (on the floor) is a brown bowl of beans. Close to her also are a few bags of beans. She cooks wakye, which is made by cooking together beans and rice. She is married and has four children. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her husband is an electrician. Her income is used to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan she is hoping to get to purchase more beans and rice to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Habiba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace bakes bread and meat pies at Abura near Nyame Bekyere, a village in Cape Coast near Abura. Grace has received a senior high education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a driver. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake to sell. Her future plan is to buy land with her increased income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 33ans, marié à une couturière, Mama réside à Agoé. Il a une boutique (ETS GLOIRE A DIEU) où il vend des produits de premières nécessités. Il désire voir ses futurs  enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions  c’est pour cela il sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter  plus de marchandises  afin de répondre à la demande de ses nombreux clients. Il  s'approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: A 33 year old young man, married to a seamstress, Mama lives in Agoe.  He has a store (AND GLORY TO GOD) where he sells staple products.  He would like to see his future children grow up in good conditions.  For this reason, he is asking for this first loan to buy goods to meet the demand of his many customers. He stocks up in the market at Lome.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Harbey Alexander

texts.es:
Harbey desde siempre ha trabajado en las confecciones de ropa para dama y trabaja el corte para terceros, con este trabajo siempre a tenido el sustento de su familia y además les da una buena calidad de vida.

El necesita tener una mesa de corte mas grande ya que la que tiene es muy pequeña y se le hace muy difícil hacer esta labor, además con una mesa mas grande podrá ser mas eficiente en su trabajo y así podrá tener muchos mas clientes.
texts.en:
Harbey has always worked with women's clothing and he provides cutting services for third parties.  With this work, he has always been able to support his family and also give them a good quality of life.

He needs to have a larger cutting table since the one he has is very small and makes it very difficult to do this work.  Plus with a larger table he could be more efficient in his work and so could have many more clients.

loans.use: to purchase a cutting table.

loans.name: Capuchino Group

texts.es:
El grupo “CAPUCHINO” está ubicado en el estado de Morelos en donde la mayoría de la población se dedica al cultivo de sorgo (cereal poco comun ). 

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora FRANCISCA quien tiene 49 años de edad, es casada su esposo es campesino, la señora Francisca decidio poner su propio negocio para apoyar a su esposo ya que no alcanza el dinero para los gastos y el cultivo tarda mucho tiempo en realizarlo, ella se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, solicita el prestamo para comprar mercancia como productos de limpieza, alimentos y bebidas y así incrementar su inventario ya que sus clientes le solicitan variedad de productos para satisfacer sus necesidades, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con el objetivo de lograr un mejor nivel de vida para su familia y tener un futuro decoroso y tranquilo tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que no desean depender de sus hijos. 

Observaciones, las señoras que no se ven bien se llaman reina y Maria.
texts.en:
The group "CAPUCHINO" is located in the state of Morelos where the majority of the population is engaged in the cultivation of sorghum (an uncommon cereal).  

One of the members of this group is Señora FRANCISCA who is 49 years old.  She is married, and her husband is a farmer.  Señora Francisca decided to start her own business to support her husband.  Because they couldn't afford money for expenses and agriculture takes too long, she started her grocery store.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as cleaning products, food and beverages.  This will allow her to increase her inventory, and as her customers request a variety of products, to be able to meet their needs.  She wants to continue investing in her business with the goal of a better life for her family and a decent and peaceful future for both her ​​and her husband; they do not want to rely on their children. 

Note, the ladies who are hard to see are called Reina and Maria.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cleaning products, food and drinks.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Rakia has been cooking food to sell near a school. She cooks foods like wakye and rice. She serves these foods with tomato sauce, spaghetti, meat and others at Abura. She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy beans, rice, meat and others. She hopes to use reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, meat and other items.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a hairdresser at Abura.  She also cracks stones for distribution. Faustina has been through junior high school.  She is married to a security man and together they take care of their home. Her loan will be used to buy hair products for the salon and  stones to crack for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy hair products for the salon and  stones to crack for resale.

loans.name: Ayidote Guindehoug Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUG est formé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans la même zone géographique au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Assiba Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Assiba Josephine est née en 1950 dans une ville du Bénin. C'est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Assiba Josephine assure seule les différentes charges de sa famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Assiba Josephine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis sept ans environs, Assiba Josephine vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) et de poissons frits dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Assiba Josephine vend des bois de chauffage. Assiba Josephine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Assiba Josephine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUG sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Ayidote Guindehoug group is made up of three people, all living in the same geographic region in Benin.  The group’s representative, Assiba Josephine, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  She was born in 1950 in a city in Benin.  She is a widow and a mother of three; all children attend school, and two are still in her care.  Assiba Josephine is able to provide for her family’s expenses alone, thanks to her income from her business.  She never attended school.  For about seven years, she has been selling “akassa” (a local food made from corn starch) and fried fish in her neighborhood.  On the side, she also sells firewood.  She buys her supplies in a city in Benin.  This is the first time that Assiba Josephine and the other members of the Ayidote Guindehoug group are asking for a loan from Alidé.  This loan will help grow their business in order to better meet their customers’ demand.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fresh fish, vegetable oil and firewood.

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya sells rubber slippers, sandals and shoes in Abura. She has received junior high school education. She is single and pays for her accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more sandals for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her marriage.

loans.use: to buy more sandals for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Dani de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la ciudad de Pucallpa una de las pastelerías mas conocidas y concurridas es la que administra Rosa, sus deliciosas tortas y pasteles han hecho que su negocio sobre salga de entre los demás, motivo por el cual tiene más clientes que los de su competencia. Ella aprendió la repostería de sus padres, quienes tenían un horno y hacían pan y pasteles para vender. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que realiza, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasnocharse, para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Con el paso de los meses, espera abrir una nueva pastelería en otro lugar concurrido de la ciudad. Este será su décimo primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas vitrinas, para abrir su nueva pastelería.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old, a friendly and hardworking woman, and lives at home with her husband Dani, who is 47, and her 3 beloved children who she wants to offer a better quality of life. She manages one of Pucullpa's best known and most frequented bakeries. Thanks to her delicious pancakes and cakes her bakery stands out among the rest resulting in having more customers then her competitors. She learned how to bake from her parents who have an oven and made bread and cakes to sell. What she likes most about her job is decorating her cakes. She has a lot of patience to decorate and this can be seen in the beautiful designs she makes. She has been working in this business for 10 years and considers staying up late to finish orders to be the most difficult part. This will be her 10th loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments and plans to do the same for these payments. In her communal bank she is a responsible member which is why she is well liked. With the three thousand Peruvian Soles loan she will buy new display cabinets to open her new bakery.

loans.use: buy display cabinets to sell her cakes.

loans.name: Hakara

texts.en: Hakara is divorced and has four children. She is into the production and sale of Fante kenkey at Abura near Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. Hakara uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. Hakara will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hakara plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to prepare Fante kenkey for sale.

loans.name: El Grupo Dinamico Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge Augusto D. 48 años D. edad es el sustento D. su hogar, tiene una nieta D. 5 años el cual es su adoración, todos los días muy temprano sale con su auto a trabajar como taxista para llevar el alimento diario, una D. sus mayores metas es comprarse un carro para mejorar su economía y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y dejar el pago del alquiler diario.
El Sr. Jorge Augusto es el actual tesorero del Grupo Dinámico, grupo recién formado en EDAPROSPO, todos los integrantes  se dedican a las actividades D. transporte (taxi, mototaxi), mantenimiento D. loza deportiva, ayudante D. laboratorio, etc.
El reciente préstamo será invertido en el mantenimiento D. su auto.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Augusto, 48, is the bread-winner of the family.  He has a 5-year-old granddaughter who is the apple of his eye.  Every day he gets up early and goes out to work as a taxi-driver to earn an income.  One of his greatest goals is to buy a new car to improve his economic situation, give his family a better lifestyle and not have to pay daily rental.

Jorge Augusto is the current treasurer of "GRUPO DINÁMICO", a recently formed group in EDAPROSPO.  The members are involved in businesses such as transportation (taxi, moto-taxi), sports field maintenance, laboratory assistant, etc. 

The recent loan will be used for vehicle maintenance.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: For the past 15 years, Muniratu has been selling provisions such as milo, milk, biscuits, soap and other items at Abura. Married to a farmer, she takes care of one child. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Doña Rocio trabaja como empleada doméstica de una casa finca, ella en su tiempo libre siembra plantas ornamentales para venderlas, allí donde labora le dan el espacio para poder plantar y mantener en buen estado las plantar que están para la venta.

Este negocio es una fuente de ingreso para ella ya que así puede mejorar su calidad de vida y además puede ser mas independiente, ella quiere mas adelante tener su vivero, pero mientras tanto necesita los insumos necesarios para mantener las plantas que hoy día ella misma planta.
texts.en:
Rocio works as a domestic in a farmhouse.  In her free time she grows ornamental plants to sell.  In the place where she works, they give her space to grow and maintain in good condition the plants that she is going to sell.

This business is a source of income for her, since in this way she can improve her quality of life and also be more independent.  In the future she wants to have her own nursery, but in the meantime she needs supplies to maintain the plants that she currently has.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her plants

loans.name: Zenatu

texts.en: Zenatu is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She has received a senior high education. Zenatu sells provisions such as tissue paper, fruit juice, canned fish, meat, toothpaste and other items at Abura near Nyame Bekyere. She has been doing this business for five years. Zenatu uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Zenatu will use the loan to purchase more provisions. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zenatu plans to reinvest her additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She sells millet porridge and doughnuts in Abura. Ekua's income generated from her sales is used to help her husband meet the financial needs of the home. The loan she is anxiously waiting for will be used to invest in the porridge business by buying more millet, sugar and other things to make for sale. Ekua plans to buy land from her additional profit.

loans.use: to invest in her porridge business by buying more millet, sugar and other things to make for sale.

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 33ans, Mazalo achète des céréales (maïs, de mil, du fonio) à l’intérieur du pays depuis 2009. Elle est employée et ajoute à son activité la vente de céréales. Elle désire assurer la garantie de sa vie et de sa future vie maritale c’est pour cela elle veut ce montant pour renforcer son activité. Elle vend à son domicile.
texts.en: A young woman of 33 years, Mazalo buys grains (corn, millet and fonio, a nutritious grain widely consumed in West Africa) in the center of the country since 2009. She has a job, but adds cereal-selling to her usual work. She would like to secure a good life for herself and in her future marriage, which is why she wants to borrow money in order to grow her business. She sells from her home.

loans.use: to buy grain (corn, millet)

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua cooks banku, made from corn dough and cassava dough, at Abura.  She is a widow and has seven dependents.  Her loan will be used to buy corn dough and cassava dough for her banku.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying some land.

loans.use: to buy corn dough and cassava dough.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro, con tal de sobresalir en la vida. Aunque todavía es muy joven, Rosa sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para tener una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de hoja de Irapay (Hojas usadas en la selva para techar las casas). Es así que todas las mañana compra dichas hojas y los adquieres cuando los botes de carga provenientes de las islas de la laguna de Yanrinacocha, proveen este material.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender las hojas, ya que siempre consigue un buen precio y eso le ha generar ganancias y con ello pudo sostener a su familia. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las hojas, ya que son muy grandes y pesadas. Con el tiempo desea incursionar en el negocio de la venta de listones, material hecho de madera para sostener estas hojas. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y puntual. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más hojas, ya que últimamente está teniendo muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, is a cheerful and hard-working young woman.  She lives in a rented house and is ready to work very hard to get ahead in life.  Although she is very young, Rosa knows how to work very hard to have a better quality of life.  That is why she decided to start a business selling Irapay leaves (leaves used in the jungle to thatch roofs).  So every morning she buys these leaves from the cargo boats that come from the islands in the Yanrinacocha lagoon.  What she likes best about her work is selling the leaves since she always gets a good price and this generates income so that she can support her family. Rosa has been doing this for 4 years and what she says is the hardest is transporting the leaves, since they are very big and heavy.  In the future she would like to start a business selling the strips, material made of wood that supports the leaves. 
This will be her second loan with MFP.  She hopes that each one of you will support her in developing her business.  She is a very responsible and punctual member of her communal bank.  Rosa will use the fifteen hundred new sols requested to buy more leaves since lately she has had many orders.

loans.use: To buy more leaves to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Doña Lilia siempre a dependido de su esposo económicamente, sin embargo desde hace un tiempo ella decidió vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos.

Ella se siente muy contenta porque los ingresos que recibe son para darse gusto y ayudarle en ciertas ocasiones a su esposo, a ella le gustaría tener mas variedad de mercancía para ampliar su negocio y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lilia had always been dependent upon her husband financially.  However, some time ago she decided to start selling merchandise to her relatives, friends and neighbors.

She feels very content because the income she receives allows her to indulge herself occasionally and also help her husband.  She would like to have a greater variety of merchandise to expand her business, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Basha

texts.en: Basha is married and has two children. She sells provisions at Abura, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a cashier. Basha's income is used to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She wants to further grow her business, so the new profit will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Kwadjowa Christine

texts.fr: Christine est dans la restauration depuis 2007. Ce prêt l’aidera à acheter des produits alimentaires (haricot, riz, huile, tomate) servant à préparer  du « AYIMOLOU » riz mélangé avec du haricot. Son conjoint est maçon carreleur et ils ont 01 enfant en charge.
texts.en: Christine has been in the restaurant business since 2007.  This loan will help her buy the food products (beans, rice, oil, tomatoes) used to prepare “AYIMOLOU” a dish of rice mixed with beans. Her husband is a bricklayer and tile setter.  They have one child to support.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu sells fish that have been smoked at Abura. She is a widow taking care of six dependants. She sees to the well-being of her home. Ramatu has been selling fish for 10 years; she wants to grow her fish business, so she needs a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. Her newly acquired profit will be reinvested back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Efua Mavis

texts.en: Efua is a hair dresser by profession. She wishes to buy a hair dryer to use for her business. She has some money at hand and needs a loan to add to her money to buy the dryer. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She has been through junior high school. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to move from the house into a shop.

loans.use: buy a dryer for her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán, located on Ecuador's northern border with Colombia. She is married and lives with her family. She has four children, aged 28, 25, 23, and 20 years. She is an entrepreneurial person with a peaceful, kind, and tolerant character. 

With her loan, Blanca will purchase materials including paints and brushes for her pottery business, which she runs from her home. She reports that her business began with very few ceramic products that she sold to her close friends and neighbors. Her business has since expanded and she has some regular clients. 

Blanca has been getting credit from FODEMI for six years and has found that she has increased her sales so that she could provide a better quality of life for her children. Her goals for the future are to continue to have faith and hope, and to proceed with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes for her ceramics business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu has been cooking for six years. She cooks food such as wakye, jollof rice, and plain rice at Abura, near nyame bekyere. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Salamatu supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and beans to cook and sell. Her ambition for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz de 59 años y con dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde el año de 1980, cuando llegó procedente de su natal departamento de Quindío y   empezó a trabajar con el propietario de un kiosco, tarea de donde extrajo su mayor experiencia, que posteriormente la llevó a crear su propio negocio; una vez el propietario se fue y lo dejó  en calidad de arrendamiento el negocio, ella empezó a trabajar sola, pero 7 meses después su propietario le pidió a Luz que lo entregara;  así fue como se vio en la necesidad de emprender en otro punto,  un negocio y ubicó  un kiosco con el apoyo de las empresas de refrescos y bebidas; desde ese momento le fue muy bien, porque estas organizaciones la dotaron de infraestructura y  mercancías, no obstante a que poco tiempo después,  debió moverlo unos metros en ese mismo espacio, porque  en ese levantaron muro e iniciaron una empresa,  y esto fue  para el bien de ella, pues sus  empleados son  los principales consumidores  de refrescos, fritos, cigarrillos y demás alimentos que vende ella.  Luz  es una mujer muy trabajadora y persistente, vive en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y desde muy temprano se traslada diariamente al norte de esta ciudad  para atender su negocio. Además de los empleados de la empresa ubicada muy  cerca de su kiosco, tiene varios clientes en el sector, en empresas porque esta justamente en un sector industrial,  lo cual ha facilitado su sostenibilidad en el tiempo y le ha permitido apoyar a sus familia, aunque en la actualidad sus hijos como trabajadores independientes aportan a los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es tener una vejez tranquila, disfrutando de su trabajo. En la actualidad Luz está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual adecuará su local y comprará insumos para adicionar  el servicio de almuerzos, que tiene un buen potencial de consumidores, por las características del sector y además porque es muy conocida por los alimentos que vende para satisfacer a sus clientes todos los dias en las medias mañanas.
.
texts.en:
Luz is 59 years old and has two children, who are 22 and 40 years old. She has lived in the city of Barranquilla since 1980, when she arrived from Quindío, the department where she was born. She began working for the owner of a kiosk, a job where she got most of her experience, which she later used to begin her own business. When the kiosk owner left and she rented the business, she began to work on her own. However, 7 months later the owner asked Luz to hand it back over to him. This is how she found herself needing to start in another location. She opened a kiosk with the support of the soft drink companies. From that moment on, things went well for her because these companies helped her with infrastructure and merchandise. However, a little while later, she had to move her kiosk a few meters in the same area because someone built a wall and started a business there. This worked out well for her because the employees there are her main customers of soft drinks, fried foods, cigarettes, and the other foods that she sells.

Luz is a very hardworking and persistent woman. She lives in a neighborhood in the south of Barranquilla and she gets up very early to commute every day to the north of the city to tend to her business. In addition to the employees of the business that is located so close to her kiosk, she has many customers in the neighborhood because she is located right in an industrial area. This has helped with the sustainability of her business and it has allowed her to support her family, though now her children work independently and contribute to the household expenses. Her dream is to have a quiet time in her old age, enjoying her work. 

Luz is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to improve her kiosk and to buy ingredients so she can add a lunch service. She has potential customers for this because of the characteristics of the area and also because she is well known for the foods that she sells to her customers at mid-morning.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing lunches so she can add lunch service

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma sells banku at Abura, near nyame bekyere.  She serves this banku with okra stew. She is divorced and has three children. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy maize to prepare corn dough and cassava dough for banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to prepare corn dough and cassava dough for banku.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima buys and supplies bags of maize and charcoal at Abura. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a watchman. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business toward building a store room for her goods.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: La Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA GRÂCE DE DIEU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Josephine Ablawa, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Josephine Ablawa est née le 20 Mars 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Gaspard. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Josephine Ablawa et sa famille habitent ensemble. Josephine Ablawa a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire. Il y a environs six ans que Josephine Ablawa mène comme activité la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Josephine Ablawa s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. La clientèle de Josephine Ablawa devient de plus en plus grande, et Josephine Ablawa voudrait renforcer davantage son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Josephine Ablawa et les autres membres du groupe LA GRÂCE DE DIEU se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un premier crédit.
texts.en: The group La Grâce de Dieu [Grace of God] is made up of three people, all living in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group’s representative, Josephine Ablawa, is raising her hand in the photo.  This is the first time the group has requested financial support from Alidé in order to build their business.  Josephine Ablawa was born on March 20th, 1973, in Benin, and is married to a driver named Gaspard.  The couple has five children, all in school, three of which are still in their care.  Josephine Ablawa lives together with her family.  She attended school, but stopped at the secondary level.  For about six years, she has been working selling various products (canned goods, soaps, cassava root flour, etc.) in her neighborhood.  This business enables her to provide for her children without too much difficulty.  She buys her supplies in one of Benin’s markets.  Her customer base is expanding, and she wants to grow her business in order to better meet the demand.  To do so, and because she doesn’t have the financial resources to make her dream a reality, Josephine Ablawa has come to Alidé - along with the other members of the group La Grâce de Dieu - to request their first loan.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She sells maize and charcoal at Abura, near nyame bekyere, which she has done for eight years. In the photo, she can be seen standing near her bags of charcoal.  Ekua's husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Maria Celsa

texts.es:
María Celsa toda su vida ha trabajado de manera independiente para poder dedicarle más tiempo a su familia, ella actualmente tiene un puesto de frutas y jugos ubicado en un paradero de bus donde puede ofrecerle a muchos clientes sus productos.

Ella quiere comprar mas insumos para su negocios y algunos implementos de cocina para poder facilitar la producción de algunos de sus productos, ella quiera incrementar sus ventas y así mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Celsa has worked independently her whole life in order to be able to devote more time to her family.  She now has a post where she sells fruit and juices.  It is located at a bus stop where she can offer her products to many customers.

Maria wants to buy more supplies for her business, and some cooking implements to facilitate the production of some of her products.  She wants to increase her sales, and in this way improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont 3 enfants.   
Kossi a travaillé comme chaudronnier depuis 2005. Il fabrique des objets pour la décoration des portes pour toutes personnes.
Kossi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une meuleuse à disque, une perceuse à perçu et un étau métallique. Il veut satisfaire la demande croissante, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 33 year old man.  He is married to a seamstress. They have 3 children. Kossi has worked as a boilermaker since 2005.  He makes objects for door decorations for everyone.  Kossi requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a disc sander, a drill, and a metal vise.  He wants to meet growing demand, guarantee a better future for his children, and participate in the support of his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de 41 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont 3 enfants.   
Kodjo a travaillé comme commerçant depuis 2010. Il a une cafétéria pour toutes personnes à quelques kilomètres de Lomé. Il achète des produits de restauration au Grand Marché de Lomé et travaille avec un employé. 
Kodjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, de spaghetti et de l’ail. Il veut satisfaire la demande croissante, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: Kodjo is a 41 year old man.  He is married to a seamstress. They have 3 children.  Kodjo has worked as a merchant since 2010. He has a cafeteria open to everyone a few kilometers from Lome.  He buys restaurant supplies at the main market in Lome and works with one employee.  Kodjo requested his first loan from WAGES to buy rice, oil, spaghetti, and garlic.  He wants to meet growing demand, guarantee a better future for his children, and participate in supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food containers, cutlery, caldrons, industrial pots and disposable boxes.

loans.name: Yda

texts.es: Yda, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Jorge de 18 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Yda es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. En adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración económica de ustedes, Además es consiente de que tiene que pagar a tiempo la cuotas para poder acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Yda, 48, is a simple, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her beloved son, Jorge, age 18.  What she wants most in life is to improve their lifestyle.  Yda's grocery store is one of the busiest in the neighborhood.  Her charisma and kindness have made her the favorite among the neighbors who go out to shop early in the morning because they know the first store to open and the last to close will be hers.  What she enjoys most about her work is talking to neighbors about what's going on in the neighborhood.  

She has been in business for six years and feels the hardest part is spending the entire day in the store, since she has to work around the clock to prevent sales from decreasing.  Her dream for the future is to grow the business and have the largest store in neighborhood.  This is her seventh loan through MFP and she is counting on you for economic support.  She is committed to paying it back on time to be able to obtain future loans and so as not to complicate things for her communal bank, where she is much loved by the other members.  She plans to use the 3,000 PEN to buy more products for her grocery store and increase inventory.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: Yury

texts.es: Yury, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Yostel de 5 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobre salir en la vida. Para Yury los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar, él es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre esta pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Pucallpa, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro. Este será el primer crédito con MFP por tanto desea que lo apoyen económicamente para concretar sus planes. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Yury, 38, is a simple, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his beloved son, Yostel, age 5.  What he desires most is to work as hard as he can to get ahead in life.  For Yury the workday begins very early in the morning when he takes his motorcycle out to look for passengers.  He is very kind and always attentive because he wants to provide a good service so customers will come back.

What he enjoys most about his work is driving through the streets of Pucallpa.  He has been in business for 13 years and feels that the most difficult part of his job is having to work until late at night.  He hopes to be able to save enough money to buy a new motor vehicle at some point.  This is his first loan through MFP and he is counting on you to help him carry out his plans.  With the 1,000 PEN he plans to buy tires for his motorcycle because the current ones are getting worn because of all the hard work.

loans.use: To buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mahougnon 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 2 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Monique Berthe. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Monique Berthe est née le 11 Juillet 1979 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Athanase. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Monique Berthe a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Monique Berthe mène comme activité la vente de tissus et de chaussures par le système de distribution.
