Monique Berthe exerce cette activité depuis près de sept ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Monique Berthe s’approvisionne au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Monique Berthe et aux autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON 2, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Mahougnon 2 is a group of three people whose president (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is Monique Berthe.  All members live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  In order to increase working capital, the group is requesting a second loan from Alidé.  Monique Berthe was born July 11th, 1979, in a city in Benin, and is married to an accountant named Athanase.  They have four children, all attending school, two of which are still in their care.  Monique Berthe only attended school for a short time.  To meet her own needs and those of her children, she has been working selling fabric and shoes by distribution system.  For seven years, this business has enabled her to cover her family’s various expenses.  She buys her supplies in Togo, a neighboring country.  This second loan is expected to enable Monique Berthe, as well as the other members of the Mahougnon 2 group, to grow their business, expand their customer base and increase income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabric

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio adecuó su casa y sitio de trabajo, por eso ahora sus prendas permanecen muy cuidadas y está muy contenta con su anterior credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo financiamiento con el cual una parte la invertirá en la compra de materia prima y con la otra parte pagará la provisiòn de su nómina, pues debió hacer unas inversiones y quedó sin liquidéz por eso hoy recurre nuevamente a su credikiva. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Rocio ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/244189
texts.en:
Rocio adapted her house as a workplace and now her clothing products are well cared for, so she is very happy because of her previous credikiva loan.  She is applying for a second loan to invest in raw materials and make payroll.  She had to pay for several purchases and ran out of cash so is requesting a new loan.  If you would like to learn more about Rocio's background, please click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/244189

loans.use: To buy raw materials and provide for payroll.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Alan de 24 y Giancarlo de 26 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la ciudad de Pucallpa una de las pastelerías mas conocidas y concurridas es la que administra Carmen, sus deliciosas tortas y pasteles han hecho que su negocio sobre salga de entre los demás, motivo por el cual tiene más clientes que los de su competencia. Ella aprendió la repostería estudiando en la ciudad de Lima, desde entonces prepara deliciosos postres y vio una manera de generarse sus propios ingresos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que muestra sus tortas, lleva 19 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasnocharse, para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Con el paso de los meses, espera comprar un nuevo horno. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará ingredientes para elaborar sus deliciosas tortas.
texts.en:
49 year-old Carmen is a very kind and unassuming woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children, 24 year-old Alan and 26 year-old Giancarlo, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

In the city of Pucallpa, one of the busiest and best-known cake shops is the one which Carmen runs.  Her delicious gateaux and cakes have set her business apart from the others.  As a result, she has more customers than her competitors do.  Carmen learned how to make confectionery by studying the subject in the city of Lima.  Since then, she has been making delicious desserts and saw that it was a way to make her own income.

What Carmen most enjoys about her work is decorating the cakes.  She has a lot of patience and this is reflected in the beautiful decorations her cakes have.  Carmen has been in this business for 19 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be staying up very late to fill orders that people have placed with her.  In a near future, she hopes to buy a new oven.

This will be Carmen's first loan from MFP.  She has always been very punctual in making her repayments and she hopes to be punctual this time as well.  Carmen is a responsible member of her community bank and is very well-liked because of this.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy ingredients for making her delicious cakes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Armando Daniel

texts.en: Armando is 23 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in northern Ecuador, along the border with Colombia. He his single and lives with his parents. He has a two-year-old son. Armado is a calm, responsible, and friendly person. He raises pigs and is obtaining this loan to purchase more animals. When he was a child, his mother taught him how to care for animals, and he saw raising animals as a great opportunity to progress. Armando has completed two loan cycles in the past and reports that they helped him increase his sales and income. His goal is to grow professinally and increase his business breeding and selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Adiatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bonbons, de cigarettes, des biscuits en gros et détails, Adiatou  a 54ans. Malgré son âge, elle ne baisse pas les bras et assure son devoir de femme au ménage. Elle veut un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, ajouter d’autres activités complémentaire à la principale. Son approvisionnement s’effectue au Grand marché de Lomé et la revente à domicile.
texts.en: Reseller of candy, cigarettes, cookies, wholesale and retail, Adiatou is 54 years old.  Despite her age, she doesn’t let up and ensures her work as a cleaning lady. She wants a better future for her children, adding other complimentary activities to her principal one.  She stocks up at the main market in Lome and resells at home.

loans.use: to buy candy and cigarettes.

loans.name: Madiwna

texts.fr: Epouse d’un cuisinier, Madiwna est revendeuse ambulante de mèches et pagnes. Depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé .Elle veut assurer son avenir à son enfant et avoir sa propre boutique pour étaler ses marchandises et faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT.
texts.en: Madiwna is the wife of a chef and she sells hair extensions and "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric) on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé. She wants to provide for her child's future and have her own shop in order to display her goods as well as doing import and export trading.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric)

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy, de 23 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Jorge de 23 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Estefano de 1 y José de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de venta de ropa de Heidy esta ubicado en el asentamiento humano Alana Sisley, ella vende jeans, polos, vestidos, para todas las edades y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas en su barrio, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en stock y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho muy conocida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedaran, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es traer la ropa desde la ciudad de Lima, ay que es ahí donde mejores modelos consigue en prendas. En adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda mejorar su tienda de ropa. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio, En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
23 year-old Heidy is a very kind and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 23 year-old Jorge, and her two beloved children, 1 year-old Estefano and 4 year-old José, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  

Heidy's clothes business is located in the Alana Sisley [informal] settlement.  She sells jeans, tops and dresses for all ages and is one of the most popular saleswomen in her neighborhood.  The new designs that she has in stock and the affordable prices that she provides her customers with have made her very well known.

What Heidy most enjoys about her work is advising her customers about which designs will suit them best.  She has been in this business for two years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her clothes from the city of Lima as this is where she gets the best designs.  In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to improve her clothes store.

This will be Heidy's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in developing her business.  Heidy is a very well-liked member of her community bank as she is very cheerful.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she has more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr: Revendeur de matériels électriques (ampoule, rouleau de fil…) Mr Aboubacar est père de 03 enfants et mariée à une revendeuse. Depuis 1980 elle exerce cette activité et s’y plait énormément. Il prendra ce prêt pour acheter de nouveaux produits pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Aboubacar, who is a retailer of electrical goods (light bulbs, rolls of cable..), is father to three children and married to a retailer. He has been carrying out this activity since 1980 and he enjoys it enormously. He is taking out this loan to buy new products with a view to strengthening his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Adjowa est revendeuse  des habits pour enfants. Elle est à son second cycle de crédit et n’a pas eu de difficultés à payer le premier. Elle achète depuis 2005 au marché de Lomé et revend dans les différents marchés. Son mari est chauffeur. Ils ont 03 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Adjowa is 41 years old and sells children's clothing. She is on her second loan and did not have any problems paying back the first one. She has been buying her goods at the market in Lomé since 2005 and resells them in various markets. Her husband is a driver and they have three children in their care.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silver jewelry that she already has orders for

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntualmente y lo utilizo para invertir en el negocio de papelería.
       Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de cuadernos, lápiz, plumas, colores y varios artículos escolares, una copiadora más grande. Ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para la invertir en el negocio. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de negocio de papelería escolar  pagar el crédito, con la  pensión gubernamental que recibe será para los gastos familiares y gastos de sus tres hijos que tiene ya que es viuda.  
Desea invertir en el negocio y tener la mercancía antes de que empiece el ciclo escolar y así sus clientes podrán encontrar en su tienda los útiles escolares que les pidan a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pabla has already had a loan with KIVA which she paid off on time. She used it to invest in her paper store business. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, pens, crayons and various school items as well as a bigger copier.         She doesn't have the capital she needs on her own to invest in her business. With the earnings she obtains from the sales in her school supplies business she will pay off the loan. The government pension she receives will be for family expenses and the expenses she has for her three children, since she is a widow.
  
She wants to invest in the business and have the merchandise before the school year starts. IN this way, her customers will find the school supplies their children need in her store.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía, como es fruta, verduras, lácteos y productos de limpieza. No cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar esta inversión en su negocio y no quiere descapitalizar las ganancias ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea que su negocio tengas mas variedad de mercancía y así sus clientes encuentren  en su tiene los que necesitan.Con las ganancias que obtendrá de esta inversión pagara el crédito.
texts.en: Raquel has spent more than three years working in her little grocery store. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as fruit, dairy and cleaning products. She doesn't have the capital she needs to make this investment in her business and she doesn't want to de-capitalize her earnings, since this is the source of income that she has for her family. She is a single mother and has three children she is raising. She wants her business to have a wider variety of merchandise so her customers will find what they need in her store. With the earnings she makes from this investment, she will pay for the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raymundo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior de un cuarto que tiene de madera. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el materia que necesita que es madera, pintura y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Raymundo planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe ya que los gastos familiares le ayudara su esposa la señora Hilda. 
Desea que la recamara de su hijo el más pequeño este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
In Raymundo's house there is some pending work to finish the exterior and interior wooden walls of a room. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials, which are wood and paint, and pay the person who will carry out the improvement. 

Raymundo will pay for the loan with the pension he receives, as his wife Hilda helps him with household expenses. He wants his youngest son's room to be in good condition.

loans.use: to pay for the internal and external finish of a room with wooden walls.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Rene le está haciendo falta los muebles de la cocina. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar los muebles de madera que le están haciendo falta a la cocina de su casa. 
Don Rene planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de cargas, este sueldo es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea que el patrimonio que tiene este en las mejores condiciones para que su familia.
texts.en: Rene's home doesn't have any kitchen furniture. He is requesting a loan to buy wooden furniture for his kitchen. Rene is planning to pay for the loan through the revenue he earns through his work as truck driver. His salary is his family's source of income. He wants his home to be in the best condition possible for his family.

loans.use: to pay for furniture for his kitchen.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
El señor Benedicto A. O. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en Kuluyo un pueblito de la provincia Sacaba de la ciudad de Cochabamba y está casado con la señora Martina con quien tiene cinco hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de él y su esposa.

Benedicto es agropecuario el tiene cultivos de tarwi y también de papa, haba el lugar donde él vive esta muy alejado de la ciudad, hasta de la propia provincia, él y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora ya que ellos no tuvieron una educación el solo curso la primaria y su esposa no sabe escribir, esto a razón que la señora Martina tuvo desde muy niña ponerse a trabajar porque su padre las abandono a ella a sus hermanos y su madre, por ser ella la mayor tuvo que sacar a delante a los demás y trabajar junto con su madre que aun vive con ella es una persona de una edad muy avanzada pero Benedicto y Martina dan gracias que la señora siga con ellos y sus hijos porque ella ayuda con la educación de sus hijos  cuando Benedicto y  Martina trabajan ella es la que siempre está pendiente de sus nietos, porque Martina tiene que ordeñar a las vacas y elaborar quesillos para poder comercializarlos en el pueblito y de esa manera tienen un ingreso mas, mientras Benedicto está preparando la tierra para sembrar su productos.

Benedicto es un hombre trabajador y responsable el trabaja mucho para salir adelante ahora el solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono gallinazo para poder tener más ingresos y de esa manera poder ayudar a sus hijos que terminen el colegio, sus niños estudian en el colegio del pueblo ya que entre todos los comentarios pagan a la maestra para que venga y enseñe a los niños, Martina y Benedicto  quieren un futuro mejor para sus hijos por esa razón trabajan mucho.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 49 years old and lives in a village in Kuluyo, in the province of Sacaba, city of Cochabamba. He is married to Martina and they have five children, all of whom are financially dependent on him and his wife.

Benedicto is a farmer. He has lupine, potato and bean fields. He lives very far from the city, even from the province. He and his wife are a hard working couple. They weren't able to receive an education. He only went to primary school and his wife can't write. Martina had to start working from a very young age because her father abandoned her, her siblings and their mother. Since she was the eldest she had to work alongside her mother to support the family. Martina's mother still lives with her. She is very elderly but Benedicto and Martina are grateful that she is still with them, because when they are at work she helps with the children's education. Marina's mother looks after the children because Martina has to milk the cows and make cheese, which she sells in the village to obtain some extra income, and Benedicto works the land to sow his crops. 

Benedicto is a hard working and responsible man. He works hard to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and poultry manure in order to increase his income. This will help him support his children until they finish school. The children study in the local village school. All neighbours pay the teacher so she can come and teach the children. Martina and Benedicto want a better future for their children and that's the reason why they work so hard.

loans.use: to buy farming products such as seeds and manure.

loans.name: Colibri X Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "COLIBRI X", PORQUE UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO TIENE COLIBRIS, Y COMENTA QUE SIEMPRE LLENAN DE ALEGRIA SU CASA Y CONTAGIA A LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MÉXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA MARIA ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 31 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, VENDE LENCERIA Y TAMBIEN TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA EN UNA CASA PARTICULAR HACIENDO LIMPIEZA, TIENE DOS HIJOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN LENCERIA POR MAYOREO Y ASI OBTENER MAS DESCUENTOS Y PODER GENERAR MAS GANANCIAS. PARA LO CUAL ELLA SE SIENTE REALIZADA Y AGRADECIDA CON LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE BRINDAN. TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE CON ESTE MEJORAMIENTO SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE CONTINUEN ESTUDIANDO YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA Y DESEA UN MEJOR FUTURO PARA SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "Colibri X" [Hummingbird X] because one of the members has hummingbirds and says that they always fill her house with joy and it spreads to the other members.  They are located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is made up of 9 members.  Señora Maria is the treasurer of the group.  She is 31 years old and has a sixth grade education.  She sells lingerie and also works as a domestic employee, cleaning in a private home.  She has two children.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in wholesale lingerie so she can obtain more discounts and be able increase her earnings.  She feels fulfilled and grateful for this opportunity.  She also hopes that with this improvement she will be able to continue supporting her children so that they can continue studying.  She is a single mother and wants the best future possible for her children.

loans.use: buy wholesale lingerie.

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es: Quelita, de 53 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar de 63 años y su querido hijo Jason de 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Quelita abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. En adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco, para poder pagar su crédito por completo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Quelita is 53 years old and is a simple, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Cesar, 63, and her beloved son Jason, 14, who she wants to give a better quality of life.  Everyday, very early in the morning, Quelita opens her grocery store to wait on her customers.  She is a very skilled saleswoman because she knows how to treat her customers and always finishes her sales convincing them to buy something more.  Her store is very well stocked since she is always concerned about buying the products that are needed.  The thing she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  She has been running her store for 2 years and thinks that the most difficult part is having to remain in her store all day, not being able leave. In the future, she hopes to expand her store facilities so that she can carry more products.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to save a little everyday to be able to pay off her loan.  In her communal bank she is very responsible and is always aware of the agreements among members.  With the one thousand nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] she will buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 2, 3 & 7 Group

texts.en: Cleotilde is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Senor (Help Us, Lord) 2, 3 & 7, a group made up of mostly Haitian citizens. They are located in the city of La Romana, where decades ago Haitians emigrated to work in the sugarcane industry. They all live in a rural community outside of the main city. Cleotilde and her long-term partner make their home here in a simple structure with their three children. Their community is a Batey, where most of the people live without services and where it is necessary to go to a closer city to get everything they want. Cleotilde told us that with a loan from Kiva's partner, Esperanza International, many families, especially hers, have been able to improve their lives and to have hope. Cleotilde's excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has been running her business for two years. She started investing in calling cards when many people bought prepaid cellphones because they need to buy calling cards to recharge their mobile credits. She will use this loan to buy calling cards and clothing. Cleotilde's dreams are to have an improved business and to take care of her family in a safe and beautiful house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy calling cards and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene  36  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual está  ubicada en la zona del caserío Granja Sasape en el distrito de Pacora cuenta solo con servicios de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla Violeta es venta de comida y hamburguesas por las noches en el puente de granja Sasape, viene trabajando en ese lugar desde hace 02 años, es conocida por la zona y no presenta competencia cercana.

Violeta está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 100 para mantenimiento a su carrito sanguchero y compra de servicios e insumos, dado que su clientela ha ido en aumento y el lugar donde vende es bien transitado ya que se encuentra cerca a un paradero de motos.

Violeta es una madre de familia muy responsable  que desea que su familia alcance una mejor calidad d vida, por ello lucha diariamente, para poder contribuir a los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Violeta is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has her own home, which is located in the neighborhood of the Sasape Farm in the district of Pacora. The only utility service there is water. The community is small, with approximately 200 families. 

Violeta's work is selling hamburgers and other food in the evenings at the bridge of the Sasape Farm. She has worked in this place for two years. She is well-known in the area and there is no nearby competition. 

Violeta is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 100 soles to perform maintenance on her food cart and buy services and supplies, since her customer base has been expanding. The place where she sells her food is well-traveled since it is located near a place where motorcycles stop. 

Violeta is a very responsible mother who wants her family to achieve a better quality of life. She works hard each day toward this aim, so she can contribute in covering her household's expenses.

loans.use: to maintain her food cart and buy supplies.

loans.name: Elías Arturo

texts.es:
Elías Arturo es de origen campesino y de su padre heredó el amor por el campo y por los oficios agrícolas, los cuales le han permitido desde hace algunos años dedicarse a su propio negocio, la producción agrícola de hortalizas como cilantro, mora, entre otros productos propios de la finca que arrendó para tal fin, ubicada en Santa Fe de Antioquia, municipio de Colombia. 

Como gran visionario, Elías espera en el futuro tener su propia finca para mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su esposa y su hijo. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos, abonos y semillas pues durante la época de invierno que atravesó hace algunos días el país su producción se vio afectada, por lo que necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elías Arturo has farming roots and from his father he inherited a love of the land and a love for farming.  For several years this has allowed him to have his own business.  He grows produce such as cilantro and blackberries as well as other products from the farm that he rents for this purpose in Santa Fe de Antioquia, Columbia.  Since he is a great visionary, Elias hopes that in the future he will have his own farm so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his wife and son.  For now he needs a loan to purchase supplies, manure and seeds.   During the winter season, that started a few days ago, his production has been affected and he needs to increase his income.

loans.use: buy supplies, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar Alberto tiene 38  años de edad, el es casado y tiene  3 hijos menores de edad, Oscar Alberto cuenta con casa propia,la cual está ubicada en un zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mochumi, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque, cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Oscar Alberto se dedica a la venta de repuesto para bicicletas y motocicletas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, el a instalado su negocio en su misma localidad donde vive, por lo mismo que cuenta con  clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio, gracias a que con el pasar del tiempo Oscar Alberto a adquirido experiencia en el rubro su negocio se viene desempeñando con éxito.

Oscar Alberto está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que el con este dinero pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de repuestos para surtir de la mejor manera su negocio 

Oscar Alberto es una persona muy trabajadora y honrada, bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran tranquilo y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Oscar Alberto is 38 years old, married and has three minor children. Oscar Alberto has his own home which is located in an outlying urban area in the district of Mochumi, fifteen minutes from the city of Lambayeque. His home has electricity and running water. The place is a small community of approximately 100 families. 

Oscar Alberto works selling spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles, a business he has had for two years. His business is set up in the same place where he lives. For that reason he has a stable and loyal customer base, thanks to which, over time Oscar Alberto has acquired experience in his line of work and his business is developing successfully. 

Oscar Alberto is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to be able to buy a large quantity of spare parts to better stock his business. 

Oscar Alberto is a very hardworking and honorable person, quite well known and respected by the inhabitants of the area. The people who know him consider him to be easygoing and quite responsible.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of spare parts to stock his business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 29 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Aliardo de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Ximena de 12 y Kiara de 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Rosa es una vendedora de Productos de belleza muy solicitada en su barrio, siempre esta muy informada de los nuevos productos que han salido al mercado y no pierde la oportunidad para dar uno que otro consejito de belleza  a su habituales clientes, puesto que disfruta de vender sus productos y más aún cuando acaba su mercadería. Ella lleva 9 años en este negocio y espera posteriormente poder abrir un salón de belleza, donde pueda vender sus cosméticos, ya que actualmente le es muy difícil ir por todos los lugares donde deja sus productos de belleza y cobrarles uno por uno. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, asimismo promete cumplir con sus cuotas, ya que confía en su negocio y sabe que saldrá bien. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, is a friendly and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Aliardo, 35, and their 2 beloved children.  Ximena is age 12 and Kiara is 8, and she wants to provide a better quality of life for them.  

Rosa is a seller of beauty products that are in high demand in her neighborhood.  She is always well informed about the new products that have come to market, and she doesn't miss the opportunity to give one or two pieces of beauty advice to her regular customers. She enjoys selling her products and even more so when it is her own merchandise. She has been in this business for 9 years and hopes later on to open a beauty salon where she can sell her cosmetics, because it is very difficult currently to go into all the places where she sells her beauty products and charge them individually. 

This is her first loan with MFP,  therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you.  She also promises to meet her quotas, and has faith in her business and knows it will be fine. With the thousand new soles requested, she will buy more cosmetics to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Deidamia

texts.es:
Deidamia tiene 52 años de edad, ella vive con su padre e hija que es menor de edad, actualmente reside en casa de su padre  la cual está ubicada en un comunidad urbana, pequeña llamada Pacanga en el departamneto de La Libertad.

Deidamia  se dedica la venta de golosinas y gaseosas en el exterior de un  colegio desde hace más de 3 años en los cuales ha adquirido experiencia en el negocio.  Adicionalmente Deidamia se dedica a dar pensión cerca a una comisaria,allí da pensiona muchos policías, quienes le han sugerido que amplíe su  local ,para que pueda cubrir la demanda de su negocio.

 Deidamia está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar sillas mesas y otros muebles que le hacen falta para complementar su negocio.

Deidamia es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  tranquila y amable.
texts.en:
Deidamia is 52 years of age and lives with her father and minor daughter. Currently she lives in her father's home which is located in a small urban community called Pacanga in the department of La Libertad. 

Deidamia sells sweets and soft drinks outside a high school which she has done for over three years, gaining experience in her business. Additionally Deidamia provides pre-ordered meals to regular customers at a spot near a police station. There she provides meals for many officers, who have suggested that she expand her premises in order to meet the demand for her business. 

Deimadia is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles in order to buy chairs, tables and other furniture she needs to further outfit her business. 

Deidamia is a very hardworking and dedicated woman who makes the effort to get ahead every day and have a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be an easygoing and friendly person.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for use in her business.

loans.name: Heber Alexi

texts.es: Hebert Alexi tiene su actividad de granos básicos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio por lo que le ha gustado conversar con sus clientes, el los ofrece en su vivienda y de manaera ambulante pues el siempre se esfuerza por proporcionar un buen servicio para no perder la clientela. El vio este negocio como una oportunidad de empleo para mantener a su familia, ya que tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, concentrado,  aceite y otros productos. Su deseo es obtener nuevos clientes y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hebert Alexi’s business is basic grains.  He has had the business for over eight years, and he has enjoyed conversing with his customers.  He sells in his house and in an itinerant manner.  

He is always striving to provide good service so that he does not lose customers.  He viewed this business as an employment opportunity in order to support his family.  He has three minor children who are under his care.

The loan is to buy corn, beans, rice, concentrate, oil, and other products.

His wish is to get new customers and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, concentrate, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Hugo Alonso

texts.es:
Además de que su negocio es su única fuente de empleo, Hugo Alonso considera que éste le sirve como terapia para sentirse un hombre útil para la sociedad pues padece de una discapacidad de nacimiento, que no ha sido impedimento para que este emprendedor le diera vida a su negocio, una venta de dulces y minutos a celular ubicado en el Parque del municipio de Barbosa, cerca de Medellín. 

Hugo se siente orgullosos de ser microempresario y de conseguir a través de su trabajo los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos y comprar sus medicamentos. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar más variedad de dulces, así como ampliar el plan de minutos a celular lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In addition to the fact that his business is his only source of emplyment, Hugo Alonso feels that his business serves as therapy so that he can feel like a useful man in society.  He suffers from a disability at birth, which has not been an impediment for this entrepreneur to give life to his business.  He sells sweets and cell phone minutes at the Barbosa municipal park, which is close to Medillín.

Hugo is proud to be a small businessman.  He is proud that, through his work, he gets the income he needs to cover his expenses and to buy his medications.

He currently needs a loan to buy a greater variety of sweets.  He will also increase the cell phone minute plan, which will allow him to generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of sweets and to increase the cell phone minute plan.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en la comunidad de la trinchera el es una persona muy emprendedora.
Desde hace poco decidió empezar un negocio con un amigo suyo que trabaja con madera, ahora ellos se dedicaran  a la confección de muebles. Pero en este momento el no tiene todas las herramientas necesarias, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de esas herramientas. El desea poder empezar su negocio lo más antes posible para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El es  socio de la empresa de crédito Comunal de la Trinchera, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the La Trinchera community, and he is a very enterprising person.  Not long ago he decided to start a business with a friend of his, who works with wood.  They now make furniture.

However, at this time he does not have all of the necessary tools.  That is why he needs a loan for ₡500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) in order to buy these tools.  He wishes to be able to start his business as soon as possible in order to improve his quality of life.

He is a member of Crédito Comunal de La Trinchera, one of the 110 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Nazareth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nazareth es una luchadora incansable pues desde muy joven ha buscado la manera de salir adelante a través de diferentes oficios, entre ellos, como asistente en una peluquería en la que aprendió todo lo relacionado con este oficio hasta que desde hace algún tiempo decidió volar sola y crear su propio negocio, Stilo y Belleza, y aunque esta emprendedora trabaja más de 11 horas diarias todos los días de la semana es consciente que esta es la manera de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

A sus 45 años de edad, Nazareth es madre de 5 hijos y sueña con ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en una peluquería no sólo reconocida en Puerto Berrío Antioquia, sino también en los municipios cercanos.  

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar artículos de belleza que pueda vender en su peluquería y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nazareth is an indefatigable fighter, since from a very early age she has looked for a way to get ahead via different lines of work, among them, as an assistant in a hair salon. There she learned everything having to do with this type of work until, some time ago, she decided to fly solo and create her own business, Style and Beauty. Although this entrepreneur works over 11 hours a day, seven days a week, she is aware that this is the way to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her and her family. 

At 45 years of age, Nazareth is the mother of five children. She dreams of expanding her business and making it a hair salon that is known not only in Puerto Berrío Antioquia but also in the surrounding municipalities. 

Currently she needs a loan to purchase beauty items that she may sell in her hair salon and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase beauty items for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel forma parte del banco comunal “Mi Banco Mi Amigo 2” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 4 años, en diferentes ferias libres, vendiendo específicamente productos de acuerdo a la temporada. Durante el verano aprovecha de vender chalas para hombres, mujeres y niños. Durante invierno, temporada actual aprovecha de vender botas para todas las edades entre hombres, mujeres y niños. Además vende cosméticos y ropa nueva en menor cantidad. Trabaja los días martes, miércoles, viernes y fines de semana, con un horario de 10ºº 15ºº, durante la tarde se dedica a realizar labores domesticas en su hogar. Mabel comenta, que ha conocido mucha gente a lo largo de su trabajo y cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, ya que es la única que se dedica a vender zapatos nuevos en la feria. Mabel comenzó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano en el suelo, con los años su situación ha mejorado, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con un puesto y permiso legal para su instalación. 
Su mercadería la compra al por mayor, en distribuidoras donde los precios son a bajo costo y más conveniente para su inversión. 
Con el crédito comprará botas para abastecer su negocio durante la temporada de invierno.
Sus metas son continuar con su negocio y abastecerse de mercadería, para ahorrar dinero y finalmente comprarse un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería a la feria, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con un triciclo, el cual limita su espacio para comprar más mercadería. 
Su motivación de continuar con su negocio se debe a la flexibilidad horaria que le deja su trabajo, ya que le ha permitido acrecentar su relación familiar y criar a su hija. 
Mabel vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 15, 12 y 6 años de edad.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, desde la facilidad para optar al crédito, hasta la buena relación existente al interior del grupo del Banco comunal. Son personas muy buenas, cariñosas, confiables y esforzadas. Mabel participa activamente de las reuniones puesto que además es secretaria del grupo y se siente muy cómoda, ya que además le sirve como distracción. Considera que los talleres en las reuniones le han servido mucho para la aplicación de los aprendizajes en su negocio.
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Mabel is part of the "Mi Banco Mi Amigo 2" ["My Bank My Friend 2"] community bank, belonging to the Pudahuel municipality in the city of Santiago.
She has worked in commerce for 4 years, in various flea markets, selling products based on the season. During the summer she enjoys selling sandals for men, women and children. In the winter, the current season, she enjoys selling boots for men, women and children of all ages. She also sells cosmetics and a small amount of new clothing. She works Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and weekends, from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm. In the afternoon she does the housework in her home. Mabel says that she has gotten to know many people through her work, and she has a large customer base because she is the only person who sells new shoes in the market. Mabel started off selling second hand clothing outside on the ground, and with the passing of the years her situation has improved, since she now has a stall and legal permission for her business.
She buys her merchandise wholesale, from distributors whose prices are low, making them convenient for her investment.
With her loan, she will purchase boots to stock her business for the winter season.
Her goals are to continue with her business and stock up on merchandise, in order to save money and finally buy herself a vehicle, which will allow her to transport her merchandise to the market. She currently only has a tricycle, which limits her space for buying more merchandise.
She is motivated to continue with her business because it gives her a flexible schedule, and has allowed her to improve her family relationships and raise her daughter.
Mabel lives with her husband and three daughters ages 15, 12 and 6.
She is very happy, and she is grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza--from the ease of taking out a loan to the good relationships among the members of the communal bank. They are very good, loving, trustworthy and hard-working people. Mabel participates actively in the meetings, as she is also the group secretary. She feels very comfortable there and it provides her with something to do. She says that the workshops in the meetings have been very useful in helping her to apply what she has learned in her business.
Pudahuel is a community in the west of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the Metropolitana region. Metropolitana is a word in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) which translates as "place where the waters join" or "place of the puddles", since it has a varied network of rivers made up of the Mapocho river and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces streams. This provides a favourable soil for agricultural production due to the existence of abundant subterranean water.

loans.use: to purchase boots in order to stock her business during the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.en:
Ana Karen is 21 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in the northernmost region of Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents and her 1-year-old son. She is a happy and responsible person. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase pigs. She is starting a business to breed pigs to increase her income and provide for her son. She hopes that she will do well and she is sure that she will do so because "God knows which people who act in good faith and helps them." 

Her dream for the future is to watch her son grow up. She wants to give him a good education for his future. With the support of her loan, God, and her family, she hopes to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea D. 45 años D. edad convive con William con quien tiene un hermoso hijo llamado Anthony D. 8 años D. edad, juntos vive en su casa propia en el centro poblado D. Canayre del distrito D. LLochegua. Andrea, es una mujer muy trabajadora, recuerda que antes D. tener su botica, ofrecía sus medicamentos tocando puertas, trasladándose D. un pueblo a otro atendiendo a muchos pacientes, pues los médicos no llegaban a estos lugares. El puesto D. salud mas cercano estaba a más D. 4 horas, ella aprovechaba esto y vio que sus ventas estaban creciendo D. a poco pero con sostenibilidad, además ya tenia cartera D. clientes; es por ello que ella incursionó en la venta D. medicamentos.  La mayoría D. veces trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda  D. sus padres y su horario D. trabajo es desD. las 5:00 AM hasta las 9:00PM. En el futuro ella piensa ampliar su botica con la finalidad D. seguir previniéndoles muchas enfermedades, y calmándoles el dolor a muchos pacientes. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes, para continuar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles desea ampliar su botica.
texts.en:
Andrea is 45 years old and lives with her partner William.  The couple have a beautiful son called Anthony who is 8 years old.  They live together in their own home, in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.

Andrea is a very hard-working woman.  She recalls that, before she owned her pharmacy, she used to sell her medicines by knocking on doors, moving from one village to the next.  She served a lot of patients as the doctors didn't get out as far as these places.  The nearest health center was more than four hours away.  Andrea took advantage of this fact.  She saw that her sales were increasing gradually and sustainably, and she already had an established customer base.  Andrea therefore decided to make inroads into the medicine sales business.  She mostly works with her partner but she also sometimes receives help from her parents.  She works from 5.00am to 9.00pm.  In the future, she plans to expand her pharmacy with the goal of continuing to prevent many illnesses and relieving the pain of many patients.

This will be Andrea's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to rely on the support of each and every one of you so that she can continue in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Andrea would like to spend the 2,000 Peruvian soles on expanding her pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand her pharmacy

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima Del Carmen tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 año que busca la manera de mantener a sus 3 hijos Fátima  es una mujer emprendedora, ella es su propia jefa de su negocio pues se levanta todos los días temprano para ofrecer la variedad de sus productos, tiene clientes que cada día le solicitan diferente productos. Ella desea el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su negocio y comprar toallas, ropa, calzado y otros productos. Por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Fátima Del Carmen is 36 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been looking for ways to support her three children for more than 10 years.  Fátima is an entrepreneurial woman who owns her own business.  She gets up early every day to offer a variety of products to her customers.  She has customers who request different products from her every day.

Fátima would like this loan to invest in her business, buying towels, clothes, footwear and other products.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and in full.

loans.use: to buy towels, clothes, footwear and other products

loans.name: Maria Ysidora

texts.es:
María tiene  25 años de edad, ella es soltera no cuenta con hijos, vive con sus padres en un caserío anexo del distrito de Morrope con aproximadamente  300 familias es una zona rural a 20 minutos de Morrope, la mayoría de pobladores en sus comunidad son personas que se dedican al comercio y ala agricultura.

María cuenta con una bodega, instalada en su domicilio  la cual e es atendida por ella misma allí ella ofrece a sus  vecinos y amigos productos de primera necesidad, así como también productos de uso domestico,  María cuenta con  experiencia de 5 años  ubicado en su propio domicilio  cuenta con clientela fija, adicionalmente se dedica ala comercio y crianza de animales menores.

María desea invertir en su negocio comprando mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio con más productos novedosos para ofrecer a su clientes, por ello maría a creído por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para poder realizar dichas actividades.

María es una mujer de buen carácter, tranquila que desea poder superarse y poder brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old, single, and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in annex village in the Morrope district that has about 300 families.  It is located in a rural area about 20 minutes from Morrope.  The majority of the people in the community are people who work as merchants and in agriculture.

María has a small general store located in her home that she runs herself.  She offers her neighbors and friends staple products as well as domestic products.  She has five years of experience and has regular customers who also work in trade and raising small animals.

María wants to invest in her business by purchasing more merchandise to expand her store with more new products to her customers.  To do this, María asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles. 

María is a calm woman of good character who wants to improve herself and be able to give her parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Los Angeless Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "LOS ANGELESS", debido al nombre de la comunidad donde se localizan. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y se ubican en el estado de Puebla en México. La señora, ARIANA es la Tesorera del grupo, ella tiene 25 años, estudio unicamente la secundaria, es casada y tiene dos hijos (3 y un 1 año de edad). Se dedica a la venta de comida; es conocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha progresado constantemente, el prestamo lo requiere para comprar utencilios e insumos para su negocio y tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo para incrementar sus ingresos. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Angeles".  It is named after the community in which its members live.  The group has nine members who live in the State of Puebla, in Mexico.

Ariana is the group's treasurer.  She is 25 years old and studied at high school.  She is married and has two children aged 3 and 1.  Her business is selling meals.  She is known by her fellow group members as a responsible person who has managed to get ahead in life even though she has faced  difficulties.  She is originally from this community and has made constant progress.

Ariana needs this loan to buy utensils and supplies for her business.  She plans to continue investing in her business in order to increase her income.  She would like to use the profits that she makes to save up for her children's education and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for her business

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio de 40 años de edad, convive con Maribel de 30 y fruto de esta relación tienen 5 hermosos hijo. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Claudio tomó el ejemplo de sus padres, desde entonces aprendió a conocer la responsabilidad y valorar las cosas, por tanto empezó con la agricultura, actividad que lo practicaba a lado de sus padres. Actualmente se dedica en la venta de pollos, negocio que lo realiza dentro de su misma casa, es así que todos los días expende a sus clientes. Pero no todo fue un éxito en su vida, sino que también tuvo  derrotas, ya que pasaron momentos de verdadera angustia económica cuando empezó en este rubro. Pero la perseverancia logró ganar clientes, y por ende tiene buenas ganancias, por lo que desea seguir incursionándose en esta actividad. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, para poder cumplir con sus objetivos.  Por otro lado se siente muy a gusto en pertenecer a su banco comunal por que todos son solidarios. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más pollos, para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio is 40 years old.  He lives with his partner, 30 year-old Maribel, and they have five beautiful children.  They live in their own home which is located in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.

Claudio took his parents' example and learned how to be responsible and value things.  He started work farming (an activity that he carried out alongside his parents).  Claudio currently sells chickens.  This is a business that he carries out in his own home.  He sells to his customers every day.  However, not everything was a success in his life.  He also had some failures and suffered some periods of real financial hardship when he started out in this business.  However, through his perseverance, he managed to gain customers and, consequently, he now makes good profits.  For this reason, he would like to continue making inroads into this business.

This will be Claudio's third loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in achieving his goals. Claudio feels very happy to belong to his community bank because the members are all very supportive.  He will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles in buying more chickens so that he can supply all his customers.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Karla Veronica

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 38 años su actividad es una pulpería.  Este negocio surgió como su principal fuente de ingresos, ella es una persona muy responsable. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido de buena ayuda.  Actualmente sigue adelante con este negocio pues es el único medio de vida que posee, pues tiene que cuidar a sus 2 hijos a cargo que son menores de edad. El financiamiento es para invertir en su negocio   y ofrecer una gran variedad como enlatados, cremas, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos y sopas. Sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla is 38 years old.  Her business is a grocery store which is her main source of income.  Karla is a very responsible person.  This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan.  They have been very helpful to her.

Karla currently continues getting ahead in her business as it is the only way she has of earning money and she has to look after her two young children who are dependent on her.  Karla will invest this loan in her business and offer her customers a wide variety of products such as canned goods, creams, candies, soft drinks, basic grains and soups.  She dreams of her children finishing their education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, creams, candies, soft drinks, basic grains and soups

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny de 55 años es una mujer emprendedora que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 22 a 35 años,  y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  donde tiene un negocio iniciado en el año 1982, cuando no tenía ninguna fuente de ingresos y decidió emprender su aventura empresarial con un pequeño capital, arrendando un local donde instaló un kiosco que aún existe y en el que en la actualidad vende refrescos y también ofrece artesanías. Durante las ferias  exhibe sus productos y busca un ayudante porque sus ventas se incrementan y no puede atenderlas sola. Sus mayores ventas ocurren en los meses de Junio y Julio y desde Diciembre hasta  las épocas de carnavales que mucha gente compra mochilas y atuendos que adicionan a sus  disfraces. Ella es una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones y se destaca por ser muy puntual en el pago de las mismas; sus hijos son todos profesionales y esto lo han logrado con su apoyo y la gran disciplina de estudios que profesan. Sus principales clientes son transeúntes y maneja compradores en la ciudad de Cúcuta, en Norte de Santander, porque allí viven sus hijos y le apoyan. Con su trabajo ha logrado adquirir su vivienda y un local en una galería popular en la ciudad de Valledupar que se encuentra en calidad de arriendo. Su credikiva es el quinto financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará artesanías y mercancías en general, para surtir el Kiosco, porque está muy cerca la época en que repuntan sus ventas y necesita estar bien preparada, para continuar respondiendo exitosamente a su decisión de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny, 55 years old, is an enterprising woman who has 4 children, aged between 22 to 35, and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She has had a store here since 1982. She had no source of income and decided to begin her enterprising adventure with a little capital, renting a space where she installed a kiosk. It still exists and at present she sells soft drinks and artisan crafts. 

During the local fairs Jenny exhibits her products and has to look for an assistant because sales increase and she can't attend to all the business. Her largest sales occur during June and July, and between December and carnival, when many people buy back packs and attire to add to their costumes.

Jenny is a very responsible with her obligations and she is notably punctual in her payments. Her children are all professionals and this has been achieved with her help and the discipline required by their studies. Her principal customers are passers-by and she uses suppliers in Cucuta in the north of Santander, where her children live and can help.

Through her work, Jenny has acquired her home and a stall which she rents in the popular gallery of the city of Valledupar. This 'credikiva' will be her 5th loan received through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. Jenny will buy artisan crafts, and general merchandise to restock her kiosk, because the era when her sales pick up is very near and she needs to be prepared if she is to continue successfully responding to her decision to make her business grow.

loans.use: buy artisan crafts and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Irania Maria

texts.es: La señora Irania Maria tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene en su casa una pulpería ella vende leña, fósforos, sopas, golosinas, detergentes y granos básicos. Tiene 8 años de tener este negocio, el cual como una alternativa de fuente de ingreso, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Además aduce la señora que cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en: Señora Irania Maria is 38 years old and is married with three children in her care.  The Señora has a grocery store in her house where she sells firewood, matches, soups, snacks, detergents and basic grains.  She has had this business for 8 years.  She has it as an alternative source of income in order to provide support for her children.  She wants this loan in order to purchase various products and because she wants to improve her profits.  In addition, the Señora argues that the prices of products are become increasingly expensive on a daily basis. This has become a challenge for her, because the economic situation is becoming increasingly difficult.  She dreams of moving forward with her business, while always trying to have her children study and prepare themselves.

loans.use: to buy firewood, matches, soups, snacks, detergents and basic grains.

loans.name: Eleuterio Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio,  es soltero pero tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores es por ello que no están a su cargo, vive en casa propia que logro construir con mucho esfuerzo, Eleuterio se dedica a arreglar bicicletas brindando mantenimiento a las mismas , empezó a realizar esta actividad en un local pequeño, pero con el correr del tiempo ya tiene un local mas amplio, Eleuterio es muy conocido en la zona, el dinero del préstamo será invertido en  comprar materiales  como ladrillos, arena, cemento, fierro, para el techado de su casa y otra parte para pagarle al albañil , su sueño en el futuro es terminar de construir su casa con acabados para tener una mejor calidad de vida, Eleuterio esta muy agradecido con la confianza que le estamos brindando.
texts.en: Señor Eleuterio is unmarried but he has 2 children who are grown so they are not in his care.  He lives in his own home which he managed to build with much effort.   Eleuterio's occupation is providing maintenance for bicycles and fixing them.  He began this activity in a small way, but over time he has expanded it.  Eleuterio is well known in the area.  The loan will be invested in purchasing materials such as bricks, sand, cement, and iron for the roof and other parts of his home and to pay the builder.  His dream for the future is to finish building his house to have a better quality of life.  Eleuterio is very grateful for the confidence in him that we are providing.

loans.use: to improve his home and purchase sand, cement and iron for the roof of his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls, buckets and other plastic utensils for her business.

loans.name: Bacilides

texts.es: Bacilides de 42 años, casada con Darío de 45 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia  en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. El negocio que realiza es la venta de prendas de vestir, y ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a ello, recuerda que en un inicio lo hacía en la calles ofreciendo su mercadería.  Con el pasar de los años logró ahorrar una cierta cantidad de dinero y eso la ayudó adquirir un local propio y abastecerse de más ropa. Ella esta satisfecha por haber logrado esto y más por su negocio que le genera una rentabilidad segura. Ahora no solo se dedica a vender ropa, sino que también ofrece zapatos y otros enseres para la casa, asimismo ha hecho un espacio para vender comida, alimentos como verduras y diversos productos. Para el futuro desea tener una tienda de calzados, ya que no hay negocio de este rubro por su zona. Este será su primer  crédito con MFP, por lo pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una persona colaboradora en todas las reuniones. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella desea comprar zapatillas para iniciar con la venta de estos productos.
texts.en: Bacilides, 42, is married to Dario, 45, and they have 4 children.  They live in their own home in the town of Natividad in the Pichari district.   She has 11 years of experience with her business selling clothing.  She recalls starting the business by offering her merchandise for sale on the streets.  Over time she managed to save some money, and so was able to acquire a small store and stock it with clothing.  Bacilidades is pleased that she was able to achieve this, and to have a business that generates a reliable profit.  Now, not only does she sell clothing, but she also sells shoes and other household goods.  In addition, she has made a space to sell food, including vegetables and other products.  In the future, she wants to have a shoe store, since there is no such business in her neighborhood.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is asking for support from all of you to help her reach her goals.  In her communal bank, she contributes to all of the meetings.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested, she wants to buy sneakers to start selling these products.

loans.use: to buy sneakers

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Laura es socia del banco comunal El Control, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza natural y colonial, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 2 niñas de 9 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su papá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Laura trabaja como empleada domestica desde muy joven, labora de lunes a sábados todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos y patos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa como: cemento, ladrillos, arena, ripio, hierro, etc.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "El Control."  She lives in the community of Punta Corral in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty and colonial heritage; its people are friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.

Laura is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 6 who study in a school in the community.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not have their own house, so they live with her father and share the household expenses with him.

Laura has worked as a domestic since she was very young.  She works all day from Monday through Saturday.  At her house, she also raises guinea pigs, chickens and ducks that she sells in her community.

This is her second loan with her communal bank, and she will invest the proceeds in construction materials for her house, such as: cement, bricks, sand, gravel, steel, etc.

Her goal is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, steel, etc.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia se dedica a la venta de refrescos y licor. Tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, sus 2 hijos son personas muy  importantes, pero solamente 1 está bajo su cargo. Siempre busca la forma de sacarlos adelante y proporcionarles lo necesario. La mayoría de sus clientes saben los buenos productos que el ofrece y disfrutan de además hablar con ella ya que tiene un gran carisma. El crédito es para la compra de frutas, gaseosas, hielo, bolsas, pajillas y otra materia prima. A pesar no ser un negocio muy grande ella siempre está pensando en ampliarse para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en: Dionisia has a business selling drinks and liquor.  She has had this business for more than 6 years.  Her two children are very important to her, but only one is still in her care.  She is always seeking a way to get ahead and provide for her children.  Most of her customers know about the good products that she offers, and they also enjoy chatting with her since she is a very charming person.  This loan will be used to purchase fruit, soft drinks, ice, bags, straws and other supplies.  Even though her business is not large, Dionisia is always thinking about how to expand it so that she can have more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit, soft drinks, ice, bags and straws

loans.name: Clara Florinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal El Control, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza natural y colonial, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Clara tiene 45 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos de 25, 23, 17, 13, 10, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su cuarto hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos siguientes hijos en una escuelita del sector. 

La Señora. Clara se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, esta actividad empezó hace 3 meses y lo aprendió sola por habilidad propia. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cría de estos animalitos.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Clara is a member of the community bank El Control and lives in the community of Punta Corral in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its natural beauty and colonial history.  Its people are kind and friendly, and maintain their culture and traditions.
 
Doña Clara is 45, and a single mother of 7 children aged 25, 23, 17, 13, 10, 7 and 4 years old.  Her first three children are married and independent, her fourth child is in school and her next two children attend a primary school in the sector.

Señora Clara makes cakes, she started this activity 3 months ago and taught herself to have this ability. She is also dedicated to raising pigs.
 
This is her second loan made ​​through the community bank and she will invest it in buying chickens to start a business raising these birds.
 
Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa y producir longanizas desde hace 8 años. Su mercadería, específicamente ropa la compra en el barrio Meiggs, ciudad de Santiago. Para la realización de las longanizas Carmen compra un cerdo y lo faena. Estas compras las realiza usualmente 2 veces al mes, para abastecerse. 
Carmen se dedica a vender sus productos 4 veces a la semana, especialmente cuando sus clientes reciben sus respectivos sueldos. El sistema de ventas de las longanizas, es de acuerdo a los pedidos que realizan sus clientes, en cuanto a la cantidad y tiempo. En ocasiones realiza 40 kilos de longaniza para vender y entregar. Carmen cuenta con mucha clientela frecuente, que la sigue de muchos años. Su horario laboral cuando sale a vender es de 8ºº a 5ºº de la tarde.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para su negocio y un cerdo para la producción de longanizas.
Sus metas son instalarse con un local establecido para vender ropa, si este no se concretara le gustaría comprarse una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería a sus diferentes clientes. 
Carmen vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Gracias a su negocio y emprendimiento ha podido pagar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza. Además comenta que el grupo del banco comunal es muy solidario y las socias son muy esforzadas. Realizan diversas actividades para juntar dinero para tener un resguardo monetario. Los talleres realizados en las reuniones los ha podido incorporar en su propio negocio para organizarlo.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Los Luceros" in the city of Temuco.  She has been selling clothing and making sausage for the past  8 years.  She buys the clothing in the Meiggs neighborhood in the city of Santiago.  To make her sausages she buys a pig and slaughters it.  She usually makes these purchases two times a month to restock.  Carmen sells her products 4 times a week, especially when her customers receive their paychecks.  She sells her sausages on a order basis with regards to quantity and time.  At times she makes 40 kilos of sausage to sell and deliver.  Carmen has many return customers that have been coming to her for many years.   Her work schedule is from 8:00 until 5:00 in the afternoon.   With the loan she will buy clothing for her business and a pig for making sausage.  Her goals are to establish a local from which to sell her clothing, but if this doesn't work out, she would like to buy a truck to transport her merchandise to various customers. 

Carmen lives with her husband and their two children ages 15 and 12.  Thanks to her business and entrepreneurship she has been able to pay for her children's education.  She is very happy and grateful for the support given by Fondo Esperanza.  Additionally, she says that her communal bank is very supportive and that the members are very hard-working.  They engage in various activities to raise money to have financial protection.  She has been able to incorporate what they have done in the workshops at the meetings into her business to organize it.  

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In the surrounding area there is a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and striking native flora and fauna concentrated in natural areas nearby.  Notably, 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people, that exist in the country live in this region.

loans.use: buy clothing for her business and a pig to make sausage.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 52 años es un hombre de naturaleza empresarial, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 17 a 23 años de edad. Desde su adolescencia se movió en el ámbito comercial vendiendo pasabocas y en general mercáncias que le pedían sus pocos clientes, así realizó sus primeros intentos de negocio  y hoy en día vive de la actividad comercial pues vende productos alimenticios, cosméticos, útiles de aseo y variedades, mediante los sistemas de crédito y contado, durante 7 horas diarias; su mayor desafío es ampliar su capital de trabajo para aumentar sus ventas y comprar productos en ofertas para obtener precios que le permitan ahorrar en sus compras. Sus clientes son personas que hacen énfasis en el cuidado de su salud y aunque  Jorge ofrece productos de gran competencia en el mercado, se sostiene por la calidad en su atención y por el cumplimiento en sus pedidos, porque tiene el cuidado de ser oportuno. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará productos naturales y cosméticos para responder a pedidos  que han hecho sus clientes, lo cual garantiza su éxito en la inversión, porque conoce muy bien su mercado y tiene como meta ayudar a mucha gente a cuidar su salud, mediante medidas preventivas, basadas en la sana alimentación y n la complementación de los elementos en los que presente deficiencia el organismo y que justamente integran su oferta.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old.  He is a man to whom business comes naturally.  He lives with his wife and three children who are aged between 17 and 23.

Jorge has been working in commerce since he was a teenager, selling snacks and general merchandise that his few customers ordered from him.  These were his first attempts at business.  Today he lives off his commercial activity as he sells food products, cosmetics, personal care products and a range of other products.  He makes his sales, for cash and on credit, for seven hours every day.
