His biggest challenge is expanding his working capital so that he can increase his sales and buy products that are on offer so that he can obtain better prices which will allow him to save money when he makes his purchases.

Jorge's customers are people who place a lot of importance on looking after their health and, although Jorge sells products that are offered by many competitors in the market, he keeps his business running because of the quality of his customer service and because he ensures that he fills his orders in a timely manner.

This Kiva loan is Jorge's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy natural products and cosmetics to fill some orders that his customers have made.  This will guarantee that the investment is successful.  Jorge knows his market very well and his goal is to help a lot of people look after their health, through preventive measures, based on healthy eating and supplementing the elements that their bodies lack.

loans.use: to buy natural products and cosmetics

loans.name: Alcira Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora Alcira es socia del banco comunal El Control, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza natural y colonial, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Alcira tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 23 años de edad, sus dos hijos son casados e independientes. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Alcira hace 8 años se dedica a la cría de animales como chanchos, pollos y cuyes a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción ya que va a arreglar su casa.
 
Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en: Alcira is a member of the communal lender El Control, and lives in Punta Corral in the city of Cuenca, a picturesque colonial city known for its warm people and cultural traditions.  Alcira is 43, married and has two children aged 25 and 23 años, both of whom live independently. Her husband works outside of Ecuador, and she maintains her own house.  For the past 8 years, Alcira has raised domestic animals such as pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells locally.  She now seeks her third credit in order to buy construction materials to enlarge and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel   es un joven que vive en el municipio de Quillacollo de la provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba, es soltero, el estudio solo hasta el nivel de bachillerato ya que tuvo que empezar a trabajar porque las condiciones económicas en sus casa no son muy buenas, el contribuye para la alimentación de su familia, él trabaja en una  empresa que se encuentra a 10 km. de su casa él es distribuidor y el horario de su trabajo es muy exigente ya que tiene que estar  a muy tempranas horas como él vive lejos llega un poquito tarde, porque tiene que tomar por ló menos 2 buses y eso le es tiempo y costo, y corre el riesgo de que lo despidan, él quiere un crédito para poder comprarse una motocicleta la cual hará que él llegue a tiempo a su trabajo y sea un costo menor, y no lo despidan porque el ayuda con los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is a young man who lives in the town of Quillacollo in Quillacollo Province, Department of Cochabamba.  He is single and has a high school diploma.  Miguel had to begin working because the financial conditions at home were not very good.  He contributes by helping to feed his family.  Miguel works at a business that is located 10 kilometers from his house.  He works as a distributor and his schedule is very demanding.  Miguel has to be at work very early and since he lives far away, he arrives a little bit late because he has to take at least two buses.

Due to the time and expenses, as well as running the risk of losing his job, Miguel is requsting a loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can get to work on time at less cost.  He does not want get fired because he needs to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that he can get to work on time.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 35 años de edad, convive con augusto de 55 años, con quien tiene 2 hermosas criaturas, Xenia de 17 años y  Zulma de 14 años, juntos viven en casa propia en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de pichari. Isabel es una  madre de familia, desde muy joven logró adquirir una tienda, negocio que le ayuda a generar ingresos y a sostener a su familia. Asimismo su esposo la apoya con los gastos de la casa, y en la educación de sus hijas. Ella se siente satisfecha con su labor, todo esto gracias  a su desenvolvimiento en las ventas y al buen trato con sus clientes. El único problema que tiene  es que aún no cuenta con un local adecuado para su negocio. Este será su primer crédito con MFP por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes, por otro lado se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Isabel habilitara un local para su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage with Augusto, age 55. They have two beautiful children, Xenia (age 17) and Zulma (age 14). Isabel and her family have their own home in the central village of Natividad in the District of Pichari. Being a mother, Isabel acquired a store at a young age. This business helps generate income to support her family. Her husband also helps with the household expenses and their daughters’ education. Isabel is satisfied with her work. Everything she has achieved was a result of her sales performance and the good service she provides to her customers. The only problem she experiences is not having an adequate location for her business.

This will be her first loan with MFP and she hopes to receive everyone’s support. For this reason, Isabel promises to be punctual with all of her payments. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to acquire a location for her business so that she can offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to rent a larger location for her store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma forma parte del banco comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida entre estos papas fritas, hot dog, churrascos y variedad de empanadas de carne y pollo. Diariamente vende 200 empanadas, 50 hot dog, un saco de papas fritas y 10 churrascos, además ofrece té y café. Norma arrienda un local y se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 4 años, ya que quedó cesante. Su horario laboral es de 11ºº a 23ºº horas, todos los días de la semana. 
Con el crédito comprará 50 sacos de papas, aceite, mostaza, mayonesa para su negocio. 
Sus metas son comprar un sitio para construir su local de comida rápida. Además anhela comprar una freidora de papas.
Norma vive junto a sus cuatro hijas de entre 27 y 21 años de edad, además de sus 6 nietos.  Una de ellas trabaja en su mismo negocio. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son ayudar a sus hijas socioeconómicamente, hace poco tiempo una de sus hijas comenzó a estudiar y otra de sus hijas accedió a una casa propia.
Norma está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido generar mayores ingresos en su negocio, que le han permitido concretar sus sueños. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones, ya que aprende mucho y ha conocido buenas amistades. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Luceros” which is located in the city of Temuco. She prepares and sells fast food such as French fries, hot dogs, steaks, a variety of meat empanadas, and chicken. Every day she sells 200 empanadas, 50 hot dogs, a sack of French fries, and 10 steaks. She also offers tea and coffee. Norma rents her location and started her business four years ago after she lost her job. Her work schedule is from 11am to 11pm. She works every day of the week.

With this loan Norma will buy 50 sacks of potatoes, oil, mustard, and mayonnaise for her business. Her goals include buying a site on which she can build a shop for her fast food business. In addition, she wants to buy a deep fryer.

Norma lives with her four daughters who are between the ages of 21 and 27. She also has six grandchildren. One of her daughters works with her in her business. Her dreams on a personal level include helping her daughters financially. She supported one of her daughters for a short time as she began her studies and helped another daughter acquire a house of her own.

Norma is very pleased with and appreciates the support provided by Fondo Esperanza. She has been able to generate more income from her business, which has allowed her to fulfill her dreams. Norma also enjoys the meetings because she has learned much and has established good friendships.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region. This city is located 670 km to the south of Santiago, the Chilean capital. The surrounding areas have a series of lakeside resorts (such as Pucón and Villarrica) as well as striking plant and animal life found in the nature parks nearby. Half of the inhabitants of this region are Mapuche, an indigenous group that is native to Chile.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of potatoes, oil, mustard, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Miriam Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita Miriam es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por el sector Tres Marías, en este lugar la gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y como se encuentra cerca de la ciudad de Cuenca mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señorita. Miriam es soltera, vive en casa de su papá quien labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es propia.

Nuestra socia labora hace 5 años en una fábrica que elaboran pantalones, trabajan de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la entrada de una maquina coser industrial para hacer trabajos de costura.
 
Su meta es tener su propia fábrica.
texts.en:
Srta. Miriam is a member of the Communal Bank “Arco Iris” (Rainbow). She lives in the sector of Tres Marías, a place where the residents engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. This area is near the city of Cuenca where many of its people work in different business activities.

Srta. Miriam is single and lives at the home of her father, a mason by trade. He owns the house that they live in.

Miriam has worked the past five years at a factory that produces trousers. She works all day Monday through Friday.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. She was invited to join by her sister. The money from this loan will be invested in the down payment on an industrial sewing machine so that she can take in sewing jobs.

Her goal is to have her own workshop.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Ligia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por el sector Tres Marías, en este lugar la gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y como está cerca de la ciudad de Cuenca mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Ligia tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 4 años de edad y un bebé de  6 meses. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su padre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, el papá labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
La Señora Ligia labora en una fábrica de pantalones hace 8 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su quinto crédito y lo va a invertir en la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial para realizar trabajos de costura desde su casa.
 
Su meta es tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Sra. Ligia is a member of the Communal Bank “Arco Iris” (Rainbow). She lives in the sector of Tres Marías, a place where the residents engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. This area is near the city of Cuenca where many of its people work in different business activities.

Doña Ligia is 23 years old and a single mother of two children, a four-year-old and a six-month-old baby. She does not own a house, so she lives at home with her parents and shares in the household expenses. Her father works in construction as a mason and her parents own their home.

Sra. Ligia works at a factory that produces trousers. She has been in this job for eight years and works Monday through Friday all day. At home, she spends her time raising chickens.

Ligia is receiving her fifth loan as part of her Communal Bank. She will invest the funds in a down payment toward an industrial sewing machine so that she can take sewing jobs at home. Her dream is to have her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: to make a down payment toward an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Keren  Haduc

texts.es: Karen es una mujer muy dinámica que ofrece servicios para resaltar la imagen personal y profesional de damas caballeros y niños en su negocio de Spa y peluquería,   ubicado en la parte delantera de su residencia, en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, sitio que conjuga gran dinamismo productivo de negocios formales e informales, infraestructuras recreativas, zonas residenciales, pero es más conocido  porque allí está ubicado el Estadio Metropolitano de la ciudad, escenario del futbol Colombiano, llamado popularmente “ La casa del Junior” uno de los equipos de futbol más queridos de la Costa Norte de Colombia.  Su idea de negocio nació  el año 2001, después de que falleció  su esposo y se dedicara al estudio de cosmetología y belleza,  adquiriendo posteriormente su experiencia en trabajo corporal,  trabajando en un Spa, que le afianzó su saber hasta lograr implementar  su aventura empresarial en el año 2010.    La clientela principal de Keren son amigos, referidos familiares y oficinistas, que cada día crecen debido a la calidad de servicios que en este negocio ella ofrece;   la competencia es alta, pero se sostiene  por el confort que maneja, cómodos  precios y la amabilidad que aplica a sus clientes.  Keren ofrece baños de novia, limpieza facial, depilación con cera, cortes de cabello, peinados, pedicure, manicure, tiene una infraestructura sólida en cuanto a equipos se refiere y un inventario de productos de belleza que le permite atender con eficiencia a su clientela.  Actualmente  se apalanca con sus padres. Su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, tiene el objetivo de incrementar el capital de trabajo  y realizar algunas adecuaciones en el local, para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, pues ella busca mantener un fondo en efectivo para comprar productos de belleza, para los tratamientos y para la venta, especialmente porque se acercan las fechas especiales, en las cuales las personas buscan mejorar su imagen física y las de sus seres queridos, como día del padre, dia del amor y amistad, que aprovecharía  al máximo para aumentar su éxito.  Su sueño más importante es tener un local de su propiedad y se esmera trabajando diariamente para más adelante lograrlo.
texts.en:
Keren is a dynamic woman who has a spa and salon where she offers personal and professional image services for women, men, and children. Her business is located in front of her home in the neighborhood of July 20th Ciudadela. This area has a mix of formal and informal businesses, recreation facilities, residential areas, and is mainly known as the site of the city’s Metropolitan Stadium. This facility is where many Colombian soccer matches are played and is popularly called “The House of Junior” after one of the most famous soccer teams on the northern coast of Colombia.

The idea for Keren’s business came about in 2001. After her husband passed away, she took beauty and cosmetology classes. Once she acquired some hands-on experience, she began working at a spa and gained the knowledge to start her own business venture in 2010. The main customers of her business are friends, referrals, relatives, and office workers. Each day she strives to improve the quality of the services that she offers. Even though the level of competition is high, Keren is able to maintain her business by providing a comfortable atmosphere, affordable prices, and friendly service to her customers. She offers bridal packages, facials, waxing, haircuts, styling, pedicures, and manicures. Keren has a solid infrastructure in terms of equipment and an inventory of beauty products that enable her to serve her customers efficiently. At the moment, she is living with her parents.

This Kiva loan is the first form of financing that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goals are to increase her operating capital and to make a few improvements to her establishment so that she can provide better service to her customers. Keren wants to maintain a cash reserve so that she can buy beauty products for her treatments and to sell for special occasions when people want to improve their physical appearance as well as those of their loved ones. She takes advantage of these occasions, such as Father’s Day and Valentine’s Day, so that she can maximize her chances of success. Her greatest wish is to own her location, so she strives each day to attain that goal.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and to make improvements to her establishment.

loans.name: Hilda Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por el sector Tres Marías, en este lugar la gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y como está cerca de la ciudad de Cuenca mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene 1 hija de 10 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá pero independientes.
 
Doña Hilda se dedica a la cría de pollos en su casa y también labora en una fábrica de pantalones  hace 5 meses.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial para realizar trabajos de costura.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Arco Iris” (Rainbow). She lives in the sector of Tres Marías, a place where the residents engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. This area is near the city of Cuenca where many of its people work in different business activities.

Sra. Hilda is 21 years old, married, and has a 10-month-old daughter. Her husband works as an employee for a private company. They do not own a home, so they live at her mother’s house and still remain independent.

Doña Hilda raises chickens at home, but she also has a job at a factory that produces trousers. She has worked there for the past five months.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank, where she was invited to join by her mother-in-law. The money from her loan will be invested in the down payment toward an industrial sewing machine so that she can take in sewing jobs.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to make a down payment on an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo José tiene 36 años, este no es primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación León 2000, ya que es por medio de ellos que ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente el se dedica a la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, porque es aquí en donde transitan mucho clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas vestidos, trajes y otros. Su deseo es poder seguir teniendo su negocio que es tan necesario para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Ricardo José is 36 years old. This is not the first time he has requested financing from Fundación León 2000 since it has helped him get ahead. He currently sells clothing as a street vendor because he is in an area where many customers pass through.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital for buying trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other garments. His wish is to continue his business so that he can obtain what he needs to survive.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other garments.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera, vive en casa propia, vive en compañía de su con su madre y tres hermanos menores de edad,la casa de Flor está ubicada en distrito de Bernal en el departamnto de Piura en donde cuenta con servicio de agua y luz.
 
Flor se dedica a brindar servicio de filmaciones, grabaciones y fotografiás, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 05 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad desde muy joven, pero en menor frecuencia, ahora conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona muy fidelizada a su negocio.  Tambien recibe ingresos de la venta al por menor de cerveza que realiza desde su domicilio.  

Flor está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para que pueda adquirir una  nueva maquina fotográfica, ademas de incremento en el inventario de su  de negocio de cerveza 

Flor es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que lucha por obtener una mejor calidad de vida y sacar a adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is 28 years old and single. She lives in her own house together with her mother and three younger siblings. Flor's house is located in the district of  Bernal in the department of Piura, where they have water and electricity services. 
 
Flor works providing photography, video and recording services. She has done this work for 5 years. The business is located in her home. She learned this profession when she was very young, but she did it less frequently. Now she knows the field perfectly, and she has an established customer base in the area which is very loyal to her business. She also receives income from selling beer retail from her home. 

Flor is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 Peruvian new soles, so that she can buy new photography equipment, in addition to increasing the inventory of her beer business. 

Flor is a very hard-working and responsible person who is struggling to achieve a better quality of life and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a new camera for her work.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana de 29 años casado con Andrés de 33 años de edad con quien tiene 2 hijos, Kelly de 14 y Andrés de 5 años, con quienes viven en una casa propia  en el centro poblado de Canayre  del distrito de LLochegua. Emiliana se dedica en la compra y venta de cacao, actividad que lo realiza en compañía de su esposo durante 06 años. Considera muy rentable este negocio, ya que son muchos los campesinos que ofrecen los sacos de cacao que cosechan, dependiendo de la calidad es que Emiliana los compra por sacos, luego se convierte en una intermediara comercial para venderlos a varios ciudades. Su única dificultad es que debe transportarlos hacia el distrito de Pichari o LLochegua, que es ahí donde se encuentran las grandes acopiadoras, pues ellos no llegan hacia Canayre por el mal estado de las carreteras y más aún que no cuenta con movilidad propia. Es por tal motivo que Emiliana recurre a MFP para poder solicitar un crédito, para incrementar su capital y poder acopiar un volumen más alto, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Emiliana es una mujer de buenos principios y  colaboradora en su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles acopiará más volúmenes de granos de cacao.
texts.en:
Emiliana is 29 years old and married to Andrés, age 33. They have two children, Kelly (age 14) and Andrés (age 5). Emiliana lives in her own home in the central village of Canayre in the District of Llochegua. She buys and sells cacao. Emiliana and her husband have managed this business together for the past six years. She considers her business to be profitable because there are many farmers who offer her sacks of cacao that they have harvested. Depending on the quality of the product, Emiliana will buy the sacks of cacao and sell them to a commercial broker who distributes them in different cities. Her only difficulty is transporting her goods to the either the District of Pichari or Llochegua, where the large collection centers are located. She is not able to travel to Canayre due to the bad condition of the roads as well as not having her own mode of transportation.

For this reason, Emiliana has returned to MFP to request a loan. She plans to increase her capital so that she can buy in larger volumes to earn more income. This will be her third loan with MFP and she hopes to obtain everyone’s support. Emiliana is a woman who is of good principles and collaborates with her Communal Bank. Her loan of 3000 PEN will help her acquire larger volumes of cacao beans.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cacao beans in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 55 años de edad, ella es viuda, cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en un anexo llamado Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas en el distrito de Morrope.

Tomasa se dedica a desarrollar labores relacionas con la agricultura, específicamente el cultivo de maíz, el producto final lo comercializa mensualmente en el mercado Moshoqueque del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.

Tomasa está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para que con este dinero pueda comprar insumos como fertilizantes, pesticidas y también pagará la mano de obra para dar un manejo óptimo del cultivo.

Tomasa es conocida por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de  mejorar su estilo de vida en la vida.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 55 years old. She is a widow and owns a house located in Santa Rosa, a small community just outside the village of Lagunas in the Morrope district. Tomasa works in agriculture, farming maize. She sells her harvest monthly in the Moshoqueque market of José Leonardo Ortiz district. 

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativea for 2,000 PEN to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides, as well as to hire manual labor to help her on the farm.

Tomasa is known as an honest, hardworking person who is really motivated to improve her life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire manual labor for her farm.

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: Francia tiene un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras que inició hace un par de años, con el que genera ingresos para   apoyar a su familia  en los gastos, tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 13 años  y vive también con su esposo, pensionado debido a un accidente laboral,  su madre y  su sobrina. Francia inició su negocio  desde el año 2010   con dinero de la liquidación de su cónyuge, sus ventas mensuales   le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo cual  le  permite aportar a su hogar, porque los gastos de su negocio son bajos y maneja costos mínimos, que son las reparaciones de las maquinas. Aunque el margen de rentabilidad es alto,  espera incrementarlo  con la compra de 2 lavadoras más, ya que la demanda es alta en el sector donde se encuentra ubicada. Su mayor oportunidad en el mercado es que no existe competencia en el sector y muchas son las veces que no puede responder a la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta es incrementar su negocio y más adelante aprovechar el mercado que maneja para emprender un punto de venta de mercancías, variedades y papelería. Su credikiva  es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará 2 máquinas para responder a la demanda que día a día se presenta y que no ha podido dar curso., esto es lo que justamente garantiza el éxito de su inversion
texts.en:
Some time ago, Francia started her business of renting out washing machines. The income she generates goes toward supporting her family with the expenses. She has five children who range in age from 2 to 13. Her husband became a pensioner after suffering an accident at work. She also lives with her mother and her niece. Francia started her business in 2010 using the money from her husband’s severance pay. Her monthly sales result in a good profit margin that allows her to support her household. The business expenses are low since she manages to keep costs at a minimum. Her main expenses are machine repairs. Since she is able to achieve a high profit margin, Francia hopes to increase her inventory by purchasing two more washing machines. The demand for her service is high in the area where she lives. She has a great opportunity since there is no existing competition for this type of service. There have been many times when she has not been able to keep up with the demand from her customers. Her goal is to expand her business and take advantage of the marketplace by opening a variety store and stationery shop.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy two washing machines so that she can respond to the daily demand that she has yet to meet. This investment will guarantee her success.

loans.use: to purchase two washing machines.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de 29 años, convive con alejandrina de 26 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijas, Jenifer de 3 años y Yazury de 3 meses de nacido. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. William es un hombre lleno de vida con un futuro muy prospero quien decidió emprender un negocio en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene 07 años en este negocio y considera que aún le es rentable, pues durante estos años ha logrado posicionar su tienda y ahora es muy concurrido por todas las personas que viven en la zona.  William con el crédito obtenido desea  ampliar su bodega, además abastecerse de variados productos. Sin embargo el no contar con movilidad para transportar los productos que comprar al por mayor y  trasladarlos hasta su bodega le resulta complicado, ya que el costo de transporte es muy caro. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo espera que lo apoyen con el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, ampliará su bodega y abastecerse de productos.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives with his partner, 26 year-old Alejandrina.  The couple have two daughters: 3 year-old Jenifer and 3 month-old Yazury.  They live together in a rental house in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

William is a man who is full of life and has a very prosperous future.  He decided to set up a business selling basic household products.  He has been in this business for seven years and considers it to be profitable.  Over the years, he has managed to position his store and now it is very popular with all the people who live in his area.  William would like to use his loan to expand his store and stock it with a variety of products.  However, he does not have a vehicle which he can use to transport the products that he buys wholesale to his store.  It is complicated and the transportation costs are very high.

This is William's second loan from MFP.  He hopes that you will support him in developing his business.  He will use the money he is requesting to expand his store and stock it with products.

loans.use: to expand his store and stock it with products

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 56 años, ella es viuda, cuenta con casa propia  la cual esta ubicada en el Caserío Totoral Bajo del distrito D. TambogranD.. Comunidad rural pequeña, con deseos D. superación.

Lucila se dedica ala venta D. leche fresca D. las 5 vacas D. su propiedad, ella realiza la distribución D. sus producto en el lugar donD. resiD., sale a vender a los alrededores la leche fresca que produce, además también se dedica a la crianza D. animales ovinos y aves D. corral.

Lucila está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1000 nuevos soles para poder realizar mejoras en los corrales D. sus animales, pues quiere ofrecer al público un producto D. calidad.

Lucila es una  mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás
texts.en:
Lucila is 56 years. She is a widow and owns a house in the village of Totoral Bajo, which is in the TambogranD. district. Totoral Bajo is a small, rural community that is hoping to develop and grow.

Lucila owns five dairy cows and sells fresh milk from her farm. She also delivers her dairy products to surrounding villages and raises sheep and poultry. 

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN to improve her livestock pens. Lucila is a hardworking woman who works every day to improve her life. Her friends and neighbors say she is friendly and always ready to help.

loans.use: To improve her cattle corral.

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Olinda es integrante D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Luz D. San Antonio “que L. conforman 10 mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, elL. ejerce con responsabilidad hace 7 meses  el cargo  D. presidenta. L. Olinda tiene 45 años D. edad es conviviente y  madre D. 3 pequeños, a quienes  junto a su conyugue han podido sacarlos adelante en su  educación y además construir su vivienda. Olinda se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza en  donD. lleva ya 12 años en ese rubro, pero también adicionalmente se dedica a L. confección D.  variedades D. prendas D. tejido en lana, que lo realiza sobre pedidos. El anhelo D. Olinda es contar con capital para terminar D. arreglar su vivienda y así  poner  un taller D. manualidades donD. pueda confeccionar sus prendas en cantidad en  L. cual  necesitaría D. personal y  así beneficiaría  a varias personas laboralmente. Con el préstamo solicitado Olinda piensa invertir en su negocio D. productos D. belleza  aumentar su stock D. champús, colonias, desodorantes y talcos adema piensa comprar algo D. lanas para seguir tejiendo paralelamente. L. Alcancía Comunal “Luz D. San Antonio” llevan años participando con  en el programa Prosperidad y están siendo responsables en su compromisos. En L. fotografía no esta presente Flor D. María pues el trafico D. L. capital no le permitió estar a tiempo en L. reunión D. desembolso llevada a cabo en las instalaciones D. Prosperidad –EDAPROSPO Huarochirí.
texts.en: Olinda is part of the communal lending organization “Luz D. San Antonio “ along with 10 hardworking women; she has served as the group's president for the past 7 months. Olinda is 45, married and mother of three children.  Through her efforts, together with her husband, she has provided a comfortable home and educational opportunities. Olinda has sold beauty products for the last 12 years, and also sews wool garments for clients.  Olinda now wishes to improve her house and establish a workroom for her sewing and sales activities, allowing her to work with others. With this loan, she plans to buy a stock of products such as shampoo, deodorants, perfumes and powders, as well as sewing materiel.  The communal lender “Luz D. San Antonio” has participated in the credit program for several years and has always met their obligations.  Flor D. María is not in the photo attached, as she was busy working on behalf of the group when it was taken.

loans.use: to buy inventory of beauty products: shampoo, deodorants, perfumes and powders

loans.name: Rubén Antonio

texts.es:
En el Municipio de santa rosa del peñón, departamento de león, el señor Rubén Antonio se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y aprecia. El se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador y con buenos valores morales ha hecho que se gane el aprecio de muchas personas.
 Actual mete a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para ampliar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: sin, madera y sementó, ladrillo, con esto empezara a la construcción de un anexo a su vivienda, para las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en: In Santa Rosa del Peñón, León province, Rubén Antonio is known to be very hardworking and provides for the needs of his family. He is well-regarded for his moral values and work in the community.  He now seeks credit from Ceprodel El Sauce in order to enlarge his house, and plans to buy construction materials such as metal roofing, wood planks and bricks.  With these he will build an annex to his house, and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to enlarge his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock and to improve his corrals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home

loans.name: Lowella

texts.es: Lowella de 31 años es la propietaria de Miscelánea Lowella , ubicada en el barrio El Romance de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde  vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 10 años. En su negocio tiene vitrinas en las cuales exhibe los productos que vende de contado y acredito,  como ropa, cosméticos, variedades y papelería en general. Su negocio comenzó con un pequeño préstamo que obtuvo de un amigo, luego de su actividad ordenada fue creciendo paulatinamente,  hasta que adicionó vitrinas  para ordenar sus mercancías y protegerlas y con ello ha logrado incrementar su clientela.  Este es su  tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará tarjetería, papelería, cosméticos y ropa para niños encargada y son de mayor rotación en su sector. Desde que ingresó a esta organización su vida ha cambiado de manera muy positiva, pues gracias al incremento de su negocio, apoyado por esta organización,  ha logrado la adquisición de su vivienda en muy poco tiempo.  Ahora su sueño se concentra en trasladarse a ella y mas adelante convertir su negocio en un gran almacén que venda todos los productos que requieran sus clientes. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Lowella se esmera en continuar sosteniendo una rentabilidad no menor de 37% y rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada 26 días y en lograr una financiacion suficiente para lograr muchos de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lowella is 31 years old and owns a store called "Miscelánea Lowella" which is located in El Romance neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her partner and her three children who are aged between 6 and 10.  In her business, Lowella has display cases where she displays her products which she sells for cash and on credit.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and stationery products.  She started her business with a small loan from a friend and her business grew gradually.  She added display cases so that she could organize her merchandise and protect them.  As a result, she has managed to increase her customer base.

This is Lowella's third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy cards, stationery products, cosmetics and children's clothes.  She has orders for these and they have a good turnover in her area.  Since she joined our organization, Lowella's life has really changed for the better as, thanks to the increase in her business and with the support of the organization, she has managed to acquire her own home in very little time.  Now her dream is to move into her home and, in the future, turn her business into a large store where she is able to sell all the products that her customers need.  While all this is happening, Lowella takes care to continue maintaining a profitability of no less than 37% and an accounts receivable turnover period of 26 days.  She hopes to make enough money to achieve many of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cards, stationery products, cosmetics and children's clothes

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. She lives in this predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine and sells seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film to local farmers who run small farms with greenhouses. Olga and her husband started their small business 11 years ago. Since then they have already invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in the venture and have three vending locations. 

This business is the only source of income for Olga and her family. One of her long-term plans is to continue expanding and to add agricultural machinery to their inventory, e.g. mini-tractors and other equipment. Olga is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds and fertilizers for sale in the second farming season. She is going to use part of the income to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for sale in the second farming season

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is one of the members of her group named Progreso y Conciliacion 1, 2 & 3. This is a group maD. up of fifteen businesswomen and businessmen, dedicated to doing business all over their rural community, outsiD. San Pedro D. Macoris. Mayra is a married woman with four children, all living with her in a simply structured home in a rural vilL. where many Haitian families live every day, working and fighting to have a better future.

For about 5 years, Mayra has been selling clothes by walking in her community and to many different communities. She started selling underwear, after she found an underwear market in the city of Romana. She has improved her business with every loan she has taken with Esperanza. This is her third loan. She plans to use this loan to buy different styles of clothing, for men, women and children.

Mayra's story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Note: There is more than one group picture in order to present as many visible faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown-up sons. Ludmila sells womens clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. She has been in this business for five years. She has 7,000 hryvnias invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about 7,000 hryvnias. Ludmila is a hard working person who enjoys her business very much and would like to develop it further.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian hryvnia to purchase assorted merchandise for the summer season. She hopes to make additional income and invest most of it back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise for the summer season

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 35-year-old, married woman with three children.  To earn a living, she operates a beauty salon.  She started the business two years ago.  She runs the salon in a very competitive environment but she is able to retain her customers because of her good services.
Phanice dreams of opening other salons in the future for more income generation.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and cereals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household items like maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She faces a challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Saumu dreams of establishing a café business in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 39 years old and married, with two children, aged 8 and 13.  She practices poultry farming to earn a living.  She has employed one person to assist her in her tasks.  Besides poultry farming, she also does dairy farming to supplement her income.  

Zipporah has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has expanded her business to wholesale.  She hopes to open other business outlets where she will sell eggs in the future.  With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she will buy dairy feeds and mash for the chicks.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and mash for her chicks.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children; three attend school and four are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, Saumu also sells charcoal and firewood as a second source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the low season, she experiences low customer turnout numbers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season it becomes difficult for her to operate her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and coconut. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and coconut.

loans.name: Muema

texts.en:
Muema is a 37-year-old  married  man with four children.  To earn a living for his family, he sells vehicle tires.  He says he has engaged in the business for over ten years.  He has grown the business and employs two people.  
Muema works hard in his business so as to educate his children.  He is able to retain his customers in a very competitive environment because of his good services.  He hopes to buy a lorry for use in his business.  He has requested for 50,000 kenyan shillings to buy more tires.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle tires

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a single woman with 2 children, a boy and a girl. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees. 

For the past 6 years Dorcas has operated a retail business, selling utensils, plates, cups and spoons to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With a loan of Kshs 20,000, Dorcas wants to purchase bundles of utensils, plates, cups and spoons for sale.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of utensils, plates, cups and spoons for sale.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Исроил занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает запастные части автомашин. Кроме того на сегодняшний день рядом с магазином Исроил открыл обслуживающую точку, вулканзацию. Для расширения своей деятельности ему необходимо взять кредит в Хумо. Поэтому он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых аппаратов.
texts.en: Isroil lives in Dangara. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife, and his children study in high school. Isroil works in trade. He has a shop where he sells spare parts for vehicles.  Additionally, near his shop Isroil has opened a tire repair center.  In order to expand his business, he has to take out a loan from MLO Humo and Partners.  He is taking out a loan to buy necessary tools.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a single woman with 2 girls both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Nyamvula has operated a vegetable stall business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of purchasing her own plot in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, fruits to sell at a wholesale price. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married lady with two children who attend school.  She runs a salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  In addition, she sells gas cylinders to boost her income.  She was previously operating a green grocery.
Rahab has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya and has improved her standard of living.  She hopes that one day she will run a wholesale business.  Rahab has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair braids.

loans.use: To buy hair braids

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 1 boy who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees and clothing. 

For the past 4 years, Florence has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation and high competition of from other retail shop businesses. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop  in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 Florence wants to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour and salt.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 40 years old, married and blessed with two children who go to school. She operates a green grocery to earn a living. Previously, she was selling secondhand clothes. Margaret’s business is only one year old and she hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting fruits and vegetables. She also dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. She has requested a 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy onions.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is 33 years old, married and has six children. None of them has been able to get an education due to the poor financial conditions of Shaheen and her husband. Shaheen is a housewife as well as a working lady. She makes gloves and sells them at the local market for profit. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. His income is not assured, because sometimes he doesn’t get any work.

Shaheen wants to improve her business by purchasing a glove-making machine. This will help her prepare larger numbers of gloves in shorter periods of time. She started her business two years ago and now has a good number of business contacts. By purchasing a machine, she is hopeful that she will be able to expand her income and increase her profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady slightly raising her hand is Shaheen.

loans.use: to buy a glove-making machine.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия жительница района Дангары. Ей 31 год. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Ее муж водитель. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Сама Робия занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки, макаронов, конфет, колбасных изделий, сахара и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: Robiya lives in Dangara. She is 31 years old.  She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a driver. He has a taxi service.  Robiya trades in the market.  She has a shop where she sells groceries. She has been doing this for more than six years.  She is taking out a loan to buy flour, pasta, sweets, sausages, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy flour, pasta, sweets, sausages, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Maushi

texts.en:
Maushi is a married woman with two girls – one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle business. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators. She dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future.

With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to start another business and purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to start another business by purchasing bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen was born in 1973 in Kapan. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Karen’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. For the past 12 years, Karen has been managing his own food shop. Also, he has a contract with one of the Armenian ice cream factories, and he distributes ice cream to different cities in the Syunik region. Thanks to profit from his food shop, Karen has been able to buy a truck, which he uses for his shop’s needs and to deliver ice cream to different cities. 

Karen’s profit allows him to support his family and he hopes to develop his food shop in the future. He is seeking a 1,000,000 dram loan to increase his food shop's assortment and to buy a large lot of ice cream for his business.

loans.use: to increase his food shop's assortment and to buy a large lot of ice cream for his business.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 32 years old and makes gloves to financially support her family. She receives orders from different factories and shops and fulfills them to earn profits. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transport services to passengers. Robina is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her daughters are students, while her son is only 2 years old and has not started his education yet. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her glove-making business. With the loan, she will buy a glove-making machine that will help her finish her orders on time and earn her better profit. She started her business a couple of years ago, and it is doing well for her. She hopes that after the loan investment she will be able to improve it further. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.  

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy a  glove-making machine.

loans.name: Molikob

texts.ru: Моликоб проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Ее муж, пенсионер. А старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Моликоб более пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она имеет торговую точку, где продает женские национальные платья, платки и ткани. Целью кредита является покупка тканей и детской одежды.
texts.en: Molikob lives in Dangara. She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is retired. Her eldest son is working in Russia. Molikob has been trading in the market for more than five years.  She has a shop where she sells women’s traditional dresses, scarves, and fabric. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric and children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start another business selling snacks, and to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a housewife. Her husband operates a grocery store business. In his store, he sells daily household items such as cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc. He has been operating his business for the past two years and has a good number of clients in his area who purchase groceries from him because he offers his products at good prices. 

Allah Rakhi has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her sons are getting their education by attending a nearby school, while her daughter is only 2 years old and has not started her education. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband expand his business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity which will allow him to fulfill the needs of his clients in a timely way and earn more profit. Allah Rakhi is confident that a loan investment will help her husband improve his business and allow her to send her daughter to school next year. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Allah Rakhi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of lemons to sell.

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara is 28 years old, married and has three sons. None of them is able to attend school because Babara and her husband are unable to afford their education. Babara is a housewife. She stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her routine tasks very well. Her husband has a spare parts business. His shop is located in the market and he sells spare parts for different vehicles. Babara’s father-in-law also lives with her family. He is 50 years of age and works with his son in the spare parts business. 

Babara has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts of different vehicles which will allow him to offer more to his customers and increase his sales. He has eight years of experience in his business and Babara hopes that a loan investment will be very productive for him. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Babara.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 48 years old. She is married with three children. Merly has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages, biscuits and eggs. She has had this business for one year. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, canned goods and beverages.  Merly is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of tamarind for making spices and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвел родился в 1962 г. в городе Капане, в данный момент проживает в селе Шикаох (Shikahogh). Он женат  и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 20 лет, он учится в Горисском педагогическом университете на третем курсе, младшему 17 лет и он  учится в сельской школе. Жена Самвела работает учительницей в сельской школе.
Самвел работает в Шикаохском заповеднике сторожем и параллельно занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота и выращиванием овощей и фруктов. Полученную сельскохозяйственную продукцию (молоко, говядина, овощи и фрукты) он продает на Капанском городском рынке. Благодаря выручке, полученный от селькохозяйственной деятельности, Самвел содержит свою семью и платит за обучение старшего сына.
Сумма кредита в 250.000 армянских драм необходима Самвелу для организации сбора урожая (дизельное топливо и другие сельхоз.средства) и для заготовку сена на зиму.
texts.en:
Samvel was born in 1962 in the city of Kapan.  He now lives in the village of Shikahogh. He is married and has two sons.  His elder son is twenty years old.  He is in his third year  at the Gorissky Pedagogical University.  The younger son is seventeen,  and he studies at the village school.  Samvel’s wife is a teacher at the village school.  

Samvel works as a watchman at the Shikahogh Nature Reserve.  He also raises cattle and grows fruits and vegetables.    He sells his produce (milk, beef, vegetables, and fruit) at the city market in Kapan.  Thanks to the income he gets from his home farm, Samvel supports his family and pays for his older son’s education.   

Samvel needs a loan for 250,000 Armenian drams for the harvest (for diesel fuel and farming instruments) and to prepare hay for the winter.

loans.use: to pay for the harvest and to prepare hay for the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Briginta

texts.en:
Briginta is a single woman with eight children, three boys and five girls. Two children are grown while four still attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, electricity, and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase a frying pan and cooking oil, and repair her market stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a frying pan, some cooking oil, and to repair her market stall.

loans.name: Juddie

texts.en:
Juddie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juddie has a retail shop that sells several kinds of home & kitchen utensils. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of kitchen utensils. 
.
Juddie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juddie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with six children: three boys and three girls. Three of the children attend school while three are grown up. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the area. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing a tailoring business in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. 

Delma has a retail shop that sells electronic loads of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional electronic loads from several networks.

Delma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Delma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads from several networks

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 36 years old, married and has five children. Four of them are getting their education and the youngest one is only four years old and hasn’t started his education yet. Her husband makes gloves from leather and rexion. He is expert in his work and his customers are very much satisfied with his work, giving him regular orders as a result.
 
Nusrat is a housewife as well as a businesswoman. She is also involved in the glove-making business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her gloves-making business. With the loan, she will buy a glove-making machine that will allow her to fulfill the orders on time and earn more profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for the past 10 years. She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will be able to increase her profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy a glove-making machine

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Randy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & biscuits. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock for the store like sacks of rice. Randy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Randy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store like sacks of rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

For the past four years, she has operated a cosmetics shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates M-pesa (mobile money transfer), which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cosmetic shop operators. 

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase beauty products, a hair dryer and repair her computer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and a hair dryer and repair her computer.

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard is 21 years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is unmarried.

Jonard has a shop that sells green bananas. He has had this business for a year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additonal green bananas to sell.

Jonard is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI.  In the future, Jonard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additonal green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 54 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Agapita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Agapita is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI.  In the future, Agapita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children: two boys and one girl. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

She operates a food stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mary faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators. Her dream is to expand and purchase a plot in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil, baking flour and charcoal for sale. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil, baking flour and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for piglets.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children: two boys and one girl. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling fried potatoes and sambusa. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other business operators in her area. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil and charcoal. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, cooking fat oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gemma has a food shop that sells native snacks like rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making native delicacy snacks.

Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making native delicacy snacks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Betty faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing more business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Analy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesoes to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analy is a new member of HSPFI, a Kiva partner. In the future, Analy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two children; one attends school while one is still too young. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past year, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation from the market to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Rebecca has a retail shop that sells a variety of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks for the retail store such as snacks & detergents. 

Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items for the store like snacks & detergents

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a widow with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a taxi business; her potential customers are travelers and neighbours. 

In addition she also operates a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Risper faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing more business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 28 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & breads. 

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Annabelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

Annabelle is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Lina has a retail shop that sells snacks and rice per the kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional sacks of rice.

Lina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Concepcion has a mini store that displays food supplements/ vitamins and she also engaged into buying and selling of rice per kilo and sells t-shirts and blouses from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to purchase additional food supplements, rice, and other women and mens wear from Natasha and AVON products.

Concepcion is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 48 years old, and he lives in Ijevan. Armen is married and has five daughters: Two of them are married and live separately, and three of his daughters live with their parents. 

Since 1991, Armen has engaged in meat-produce trading, including smoked sausages, basturma (a kind of cured meat), frozen chickens, etc. He buys merchandise from villagers and also from Yerevan and sells it in Ijevan city’s market. 

Thanks to his trading profit, Armen was able to pay for his daughters’ educations, to organize their weddings and to buy necessary furniture for his house.
 
This is Armen’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon, and he is asking for a 300,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a large lot of sausages, basturma, shujukh and chickens to resell.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of sausages, basturma (cured meat), shujukh (a type of sausage) and chickens to resell.

loans.name: Chrisitine

texts.en:
Chrisitine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For the past two years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot dry season, the availability of water for supply is lower and demand is higher compared to the cold, rainy season when the availability of water for supply is higher and demand is lower.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase a water tank to store water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 

Clemencia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Clemencia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Clemencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marlyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling firewood from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy winter season, the availability of firewood to supply is minimal, hence not meeting customers' needs. She dreams of expanding and supplying at wholesale in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Amor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, detergents, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & biscuits.

Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business.
