loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads & biscuits

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, beverages, detergent, noodles, school & office supplies.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, detergent, noodles & school/office supplies

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is married to a businessman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. Salima dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Loribel

texts.en:
Loribel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Loribel has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, noodles, detergents & biscuits. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles & biscuits.

Loribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Loribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles & biscuits.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married to a businessman and she has three children, all of whom attend. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past one year, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling as retail to her neighbours. Kadzo also does farming which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in her business. Her dreams is to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Josie has a retail shop that sells t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.

Josie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 3 years, Chizi has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to village members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Chizi dreams of expanding and selling by wholesale in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 55 years old and she lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Luzviminda has a shop that sells native delicacy snacks like ensaymada & botche. She has had this business for 31 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients in making native delicacy snacks.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making native delicacy snacks.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with 10 children, nine attend school while one is underage. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly is school fees.

For the past 24 years, she has operated a kindergarten school, teaching children from her nearby community. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments of school fees by parents. She dreams of expanding her school to upper classes in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase desks, repair classrooms and purchase teaching materials. Constance decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase desks, repair classrooms and purchase teaching materials.

loans.name: Constantita

texts.en:
Constantita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Constantita has a food shop that sells roasted pig, per kilograms. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy pigs to be roasted for sale.

Constantita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, to be roasted, to sell.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school. One child is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, Mwenda has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a dairy farming business which contributes to her other source of income. Mwenda faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and salt.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 3 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling by retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business and sell by wholesale. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal of sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal of sale.

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en:
Comercita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Comercita has a shop where she sells powdered milk, canned goods, noodles & detergents. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Comercita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Teresa has a retail shop from which she sells fish like sardines, milk fish and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats and cattle to sell as meat.

loans.name: Ana Matilde

texts.es: Ana de 45 años vive en el Macroproyecto de vivienda Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo en sus procesos de construcciòn de comunidades  sostenibles en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. Allí tiene su negocio de Confecciones llamado “ Modisteria Gean”  el cual inició una vez logró aprender este arte, en una institucion tecnica muy reconocida de la ciudad y decidiò emprender su propia aventura que hasta la presenta ha dejado “muchos frutos”, como ella misma lo expresa. Su meta es continuar progresando para fortalecer su ingreso familiar al lado de su cónyuge, pues sueñan con  poder brindar  a sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 24 años, un mayor bienestar para que tengan posibilidades de ser exitosos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà una fileteadora, con la cual dará un excelente acabado a sus productos  y telas especiales  para batas de laboratorios, tapabocas quirúrgicos, elementos que utilizan las clinicas y diversos negocios en sus procesos de trabajo; su inversiòn será exitosa pues está fundamentada en pedidos de clientes de estas empresas y estarà garantizada por la calidad que ofrecerìa con la nueva maquina fileteadora.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and lives in the 'Ciudad Bicentenario' macro-housing development project which is run by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of their process of building sustainable communities in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  There she has her dressmaking business called "Modisteria Gean" which she set up once she had learned this art in a very well-known technical institute in the city.  She decided to undertake her own venture which, up to now, has brought her "many rewards" as she says.  Her goal is to continue making progress in order to strengthen her family income alongside her husband.  They both dream of being able to provide their children, who are 13 and 24, with a better well-being so that they have the opportunity to be successful in life.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Ana has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy an overlock sewing machine which will help her to give a good finish to her products and the special fabrics that she uses to make lab coats and surgical masks, products that clinics and some businesses use in their work processes.  Her investment will be successful because it is based on customer orders from these companies and is guaranteed by the good-quality work that she will be able to offer with her new overlock machine.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine which will help her to give a good finish to her products and surgical fabrics

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arlene makes charcoal from wood and coconut shells and sells it. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy wood and coconut shells for charcoal making.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood and coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Jingy

texts.en:
Jingy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jingy provides pedicure & manicure services. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for doing pedicures & manicures. 

Jingy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jingy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicures & manicures

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married to a farmer with four school age children.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to local neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for sale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with 2 children.  Eduardo is providing motorcycle transport or habal-habal services.  He has had this business for 3 years.  He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for maintenance services.

Eduardo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for maintenance services

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Elda has a shop that sells snacks, detergent, noodles and biscuits.  She has had this business for 4 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides de 48 años de edad vive en el Macroproyecto de vivienda Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en sus procesos de construcciòn de comunidades  sostenibles en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. Alli tiene un negocio llamado “Tienda Aquí me quedo” que vende ranchos, viveres, refrescos y articulos de la canasta familiar en general. Su idea emprendedora surgió en compañía de su esposo y de su hija cuando él quedó desempleado y su hija lo ayudó con un capita inicial; con su trabajo disciplinado y persistente han logrado que crèzca gradualmente hasta convertirlo en la fuente de ingresos con los que su familia cubre sus necesidades diarias. Su mayor desafio es el capital de trabajo insuficiente para lograr hacer una compra de contado y obtener descuentos que incrementarian sus utilidades, esta es la razòn por la cual recurren a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará viveres en volumen y adicionará otras mercancias a su tienda tipo miscelanea, como ganchos, papeleria, etc. Su meta mas adelante es tener un congelador donde conservar los productos cárnicos, para cuando aumente el número de vecinos responderle rapidamente a sus requerimientos diarios.
texts.en: Idalides, 48 years old, lives in the Macroproyecto part of the Ciudad Bicentenario development, which is administered by Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which builds sustainable communities in the city of Cartagena de Indias. There, she has a business called Tienda Aqui Me Quedo (the I'm Staying Here Store) that sells snack food, groceries, drinks, and other general items. Her entrepreneurial idea started with the help of her husband and daughter; he was unemployed and their daughter helped provide start-up capital. Through their disciplined and persistent work, they have grown the business gradually until they were able to turn it into an income stream that covers the family's daily living expenses. Their main challenge is having insufficient working capital to make cash purchases and take advantage of discounts that would increase their margins. This is why they have turned to Kiva for a loan. This first loan through Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will be used to purchase groceries in volume as well as other miscellaneous items for their store, such as paperclips, stationary, etc. Their greatest goal is to have a freezer for storing meat products so they will be able to respond more quickly to a growing number of neighbors' daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in volume as well as accessories and stationary

loans.name: Kandia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  a été créé en Mai 2010. Il compte 25 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise en troisième position de la  droite vers la gauche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 74 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle prend aussi en charge sa belle sœur. 

Elle vend de la glace, du jus depuis plus de cinq ans.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner en sucre et pain de singe.

Les bénéfices provenant de cette activité lui permettront de prendre en charge ses enfants dans la scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2010. It numbers 25 women who all live in the same neighborhood. They are all small-scale retailers. 

The lady sitting, third from left to right, the the leader of the group. She is 74, married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of her sister-in-law. She has been selling ice and juice for more than five years. 

With this loan she intends to stock up on sugar and monkey bread (baobab tree fruit). The profit from the business will allow her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to stock up on sugar and monkey bread (baobab tree fruit) to make juice for resale.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 7 children. 

Melchora is providing manicure and pedicure services.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures.

Melchora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Melchora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure and pedicure

loans.name: Jappo Jappalante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jappo Jappalante est créé en Septembre 2007  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marième (assise en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle a 03 autres membres de sa famille en charge.

Elle vend des tissus. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 16 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en tissus.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Jappo Jappalante group was created in September 2007 on the day the "village bank" was inaugurated. It is made up of 23 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are all small-scale retailers.  

Madame Marième (seated second, left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 37, married, and the mother of four children. She is caring for three other members of her family. 

She sells cloth, a business she has been in for more than 16 years. With this loan she intends to stock up on cloth. The profit from her business will allow her to put aside savings and help her husband cover food and school fees.

loans.use: to stock up on cloth.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Leonila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles and detergents.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy breads, snacks and canned goods.

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gemma has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for barbecue making.

Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecue making.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Rosanna has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, beverages, and breads. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is a market vendor from Pavlograd. Yelena sells groceries, noodles, and cereal, as well as over 50 kinds of tea and 40 kinds of coffee, in the central marketplace of her home town. She started working in the food-vending business five years ago. She works really hard to keep her business running and make it a success. Currently, her profits amount to 7,000 Ukrainian grivnyas (UAH) a month. 

Yelena needs a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase assorted grocery items for retail sale in her kiosk. Yelena believes that groceries always sell well because people have to eat, which is why she sees herself working in this sphere of trade for years to come. She likes working with this type of merchandise and thus supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase assorted food items for sale in her kiosk

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Susan has a food shop that sells viands like fried fish and vegetable dishes. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell. Susan is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a market entrepreneur. Her family of four lives in the town of Pavlograd. Nataliya sells sportswear and athletic-clothing merchandise for hiking and active living. She owns two vending facilities in the central marketplace of her home town. Nataliya has been in the market for five years. She has about 55,000 Ukrainian grivnyas (UAH) in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to 8,000 grivnyas.  

Nataliya is seeking a 13,000-grivnya loan to purchase wholesale seasonal athletic merchandise for retail sale in her kiosks. She is planning to re-stock her merchandise with summer tops, T-shirts, and polos, as well as capris and skirts for ladies. Nataliya is very energetic. She likes to stay fit and active. Her pro-health approach to life has determined her preferences, and she enjoys working in this business niche.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal sportswear wholesale

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Margie has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Margie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a son and a daughter. Her family of four lives in the town of Melitopol. Marina sells leather accessories in the local ‘Rizhskyi' market, i.e. purses, wallets, folders, etc. She launched her enterprise 14 years ago. Presently, Marina has 35,000 grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 grivnyas a month. 

Marina is planning to invest the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas in the purchase of assorted women's purses. She is hoping to meet the demands of her female clients offering them a nice selection of purses and handbags at reasonable prices that will please different tastes. Marina likes working with this type of merchandise. She is hoping to keep growing her trade and open an additional vending location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of purses for further retail sale

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya, a 55-year-old married mother of  two children, has a food shop in the Philippines that sells breads and rice cakes and serves coffee, chocolate drinks and milk. In business for five years and a new member of HSPFI, Ligaya is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more breads and coffee.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads and coffee.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two grown daughters, Anna and Irina. She is a market vendor from Melitopol. Larisa sells women's clothing in the local ‘Rizhskyi' market. 

Seventeen years of working in the business have taught her to be an efficient manager of her funds and resources. Currently, Larisa has 50,000 grivnyas invested in inventory. Her profit is about 7,500 grivnyas a month. 

Larisa is requesting a loan of 12,000 grivnyas to purchase assorted seasonal clothing for her female customers. Additional income will be re-invested in further growth of the trade as well as in the improvement of her living conditions. 

Larisa is hoping to open one more vending facility in the near future, thus expanding her trade as a result.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Merlisa

texts.en:
Merlisa is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlisa has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Merlisa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married with two grown children. She lives and works in her home town of Melitopol. Tamara runs a women's clothing sales business in a local marketplace called ‘Rizhskyi'. She started her venture 15 years ago. Presently, Tamara has about 20,000 grivnyas in working capital. Her profit amounts to 7,000 grivnyas. 

Tamara is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to re-stock her seasonal merchandise and add a variety of light and trendy blouses and tees to her selection of women's outer clothing. 

Tamara is an experienced entrepreneur who is always diligent in her work and payments. Tamara is planning to use the generated income for personal needs: she is hoping to purchase new home electronic appliances for the family.

loans.use: to add seasonal merchandise to her inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, vegetables & medicinal wines. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional vegetables & canned goods for the retail store. 

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables & canned goods for the store

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofia desde que amanece planea su dia porque se mueve en los espacios familiar, productivo y personal. En el barrio San Fernando de la ciudad de Cartagena todos la conocen por efecto de su negocio de vender mercancia variada entre empleados, trabajadores independientes, amas de casa, jovenes y especialmente mujeres, que son sus principales clientes, a las que sofia consiente porque ellas son fieles. Su negocio consiste en vender a crèdito mercancia por encargo, para que la gente lo pague a plazos acuerdo con sus posibilidades.  En la actualidad se està preparando para responder a pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, a propòsito del dia del padre y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para satisfacer esta gran demanda, por eso teniendo en cuenta que invirtiendo un capital nuevo a su negocio llegaria a muchos mas clientes, ella ha decidido acudir a asu Credikiva que es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Sato Domingo, para invertir en  calzado y ropa masculina, pues son las mercancias que tiene encargadas y que auguran su éxito, porque conoce muy bien el mercado y sabe que es una oportunidad de impactarlo con ventas oportunas. Sofia vive con su cònyuge y su hijo de 5 años, con el que sueña ofrecerle, cada diamayor bienestar hasta convertirlo en un profesional con posibilidades de tener èxito. Cuando iniciò su negocio lo hizo pensando en adicionar mas ingresos a su hogar y comenzò vendiendo a pocos clientes plateria, gradualmente ha ido agregando ropa, calzado, accesorios y en general todo lo que sus clientes le pidan, porque tiene como meta principal desarrollar mas adelante un almacen muy diversificado de productos en oferta. Sofia agraece a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo su apoyo, pues gracias a ella tiene casa propia y esto ha dado mayor bienestar a sofia y a los suyos.
texts.en: Starting at dawn, Sofia plans out her day because she is dealing with family, business, and personal life. In the San Fernando neighborhood in the city of Cartagena, everyone knows her through her business of selling a variety of merchandise to workers, individuals, housewives, youth, and most especially women, who are her main customers. Sofia caters to them because they are faithful. Her business consists of selling on credit so people can pay her when and where it is possible for them. She is currently getting ready to fill some customers' orders for Fathers' Day, and her working capital is not sufficient for satisfying all the demand. This is why she is realizing that she needs to invest more capital in her business to bring in more customers, and so she has decided to request a Kiva loan. This is the second loan that she will receive from Kiva partner Fundaciòn Mario Sato Domingo. It will be for purchasing men's shoes and clothing because these are the items that are on order and that have helped form her success. She knows the market very well and knows that this is an opportunity for impacting her sales. Sofia lives with her husband and five-year-old son. She dreams of offering her son a better quality of life every day so he can become a professional with opportunities to be successful. When she started her business, she wanted to bring in more household income, and she started by selling silverware to a few customers. Gradually she added clothes, shoes, accessories, and, in general, everything her customers asked for because her main goal is to grow into a store that offers a variety of merchandise. Sofia is grateful to Kiva partner Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo for their help, because thanks to the organization, she has her own home and and a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase men's shoes and clothes

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es: El señor Henrry, oriundo de provincia Larecaja de la ciudad de La Paz, su actividad es la renta de su vehículo y sus dos líneas de la asociación "moto taxis ", también como otra fuente son las maquinas de juegos que funcionan con monedas, el sr. Henrry esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una motocicleta así utilizara el crédito en la compra de una motocicleta para poder trabajarla de la cual obtenga otra fuente de ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia es una persona dinámica siempre viendo a que actividad dedicarse, pensando en su familia.
texts.en: Henrry, originally from the province of Larecaja and the city of La Paz, rents out his vehicle and his two telephone lines through his business Moto Taxis. Also, as another source of income he has slot machines. Henrry is grateful to our organization for placing confidence in him and helping him get a motorcycle. He will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle so he can use it for another source of income and have a better quality of life for his family. He is a dynamic person, always looking at whatever activity he is doing and thinking of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Karin Erica

texts.es: La señora Karin  se dedica a venta de cosméticos desde hace 5 años labor que realiza con la ayuda de su familia ella vende cosméticos por catalogo de distintas empresas muy reconocidas en el ámbito de la belleza, ofrece sus productos a amistades, oficinas, y por su zona ya que ella es una persona muy conocida en el área, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en  incrementar el capital de trabajo comprando mercadería que se encuentra en promoción y después ofrecerla un poco mas caro y así obtener mas ganancias, es un apersona joven con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Karin has been selling cosmetics for five years, something that she does with the help of her family. She sells cosmetics by catalog through highly recognized beauty companies. She offers her products to friends, office workers, and others in her area because she is very well known around there. The money from the loan will be used to increase working capital and purchase merchandise that she finds on sale and can later sell at a slightly higher price to earn more money. She is a young person with dreams of succeeding. She is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Marco  vive en la casa de su madre en la zona de Chasquipampa, con sus dos hijos y su esposa, ellos tienen una tienda de ropa variada (para cholitas como ser enaguas, blusas y ropa para niños, juveniles en el  mismo domicilio tienen buena venta los fines de semana ya que hay feria los días sábados donde vienen personas desde comunidades aledañas como ser palca, unni y  zonas aledañas, ellos necesitan para incrementar mas la mercadería ya que por la demanda de sus clientes necesitan  comprar mas ropa variada para todo gusto como indican ellos, también comprar ropa de invierno ya que se acerca esta epoca de frio, el sr. Marco es una persona muy trabajadora pensando en el bienestar de su familia agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marco lives in his mother's home in the Chasquipampa zone with his two children and his wife. They have a clothing store in their home (that sells) traditional skirts for the Cholitas ***, shirts, and other clothes for children and youth. They have good sales on the weekends since there is a market on Saturdays that the people from neighboring communities (Palca, Unni, and others) come to. They need to increase their merchandise because of customer demand. They need to purchase more clothing items that will appeal to everyone, and they also need to purchase winter clothes since the cold season is coming. Marco is a very hardworking person who is always thinking of his family's well-being. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.


***Cholitas are the indigenous rural women of Bolivia. They distinguish themselves by wearing bowler hats and colourful skirts and shawls and form the backbone of the social movement that in 2006 brought Evo Morales to power in their country.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothes for toddlers and youth as well as traditional indigenous clothing)

loans.name: Limber Abad

texts.es: El señor Limber,  hombre casado con una hija,  cuya actividad es de el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi) cabe mencionar que es de nuestra entera satisfacción saber que lucha y pasa los obstáculos que la vida le pone en frente todo para darle una buena y mejor vida a su familia e hija la actividad que el realiza tiene una competitividad grande en el mercado pero aun así el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento que puede tener gracias al crédito otorgado en la institución ya que utilizara el dinero en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, y también en la compra de llantas trabaja de manera sacrificada pero rentable el inicio su trabajo como chofer ahora cuenta con un vehículo propio obteniendo buenos resultados el rendimiento es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, para que el y en compañía de su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad y forma de vida.
texts.en: Limber, a married man with a daughter, provides urban transport (taxi) services. We should mention that we are so satisfied to know that he fights and overcomes all the obstacles life puts in front of him to give a better life to his family. His line of work is very competitive in the market, but the client keeps in mind the growth he can realize thanks to the loan this organization authorized. He will use the money to maintain his vehicle, and he will also purchase tires. He works in a sacrificing yet profitable way. He started working as a chauffeur. Now he has his own vehicle and is getting good results. His performance is good because of the hard work that he puts in every day of the week so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle and purchase new tires

loans.name: Sam Soom Group

texts.es: Es  Banco nuevo pero con dos socias antiguas esta conformado por ocho personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona Tembladerani por se dedican a la venta de cd venta de artículos para celulares   otros que se dedican a la venta de ropa en el alto cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo,  también están dos varones que viven en la misma zona, La presidenta se llama Shirley ella tiene la actividad de venta de cds y su puesto en una avenida céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz,  ella es antigua muy responsable, trabaja con esta actividad hace 2 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería Cds de música y películas infantiles ya que empieza las vacaciones escolares y tiene mucha demanda las este tipo de películas infantiles, la Sra. Shirley es una persona joven trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: This is a new community bank, but with two senior members, it is comprised of eight people. The majority of the women live in the Tembladerani zone. They sell CDs and cellular accessories. Others sell high end clothes that are well known in the group.  There are also two men who live in the same area. The president's name is Shirley. She sells CDs, and her locale is on a central avenue that goes through the city of La Paz. She is established and very responsible. She has been working in this business for two years. The money from the loan will be used to CDs with music and children's movies since the school holiday has started and there is a lot of demand for these children's movies. Shirley is a young, hardworking person. She is grateful to this organization for the help it provides.

loans.use: to purchase children's movies

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: La señora angélica elabora cuadernos con espiral y empastados los cuales venD. en las ciudades D. potosí, Oruro, Cochabamba y Santa Cruz al por mayor, tambien entrega a oficinas,  trabaja en su domicilio ubicado en la zona D. villa nuevo Potosí hace más D. diez años, sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración y en la venta, lamentablemente su esposo falleció y ella tuvo que hacerse cargo D. toda su familia, ahora con mucho esfuerzo logró sacar su negocio adelante y pueD. cubrir los gastos D. alimentación y educación con este negocio,  ahora piensa en el futuro D. sus hijos a los cuales enseñó muy bien el negocio para que en un futuro ellos puedan valerse por sí mismos, la señora Angélica trabaja desD. que comenzó con una perforadora y cortadora, ahora solicita el crédito para poder comprar otra y facilitar su trabajo y el D. sus hijos, doña Angélica no tiene mucho tiempo trabajando con la institución, sin embargo en este corto tiempo se pudo evidenciar que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y que es una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en: Angélica makes spiral notebooks that she sells wholesale in the cities of Potosí, Oruro, Cochabamba, and Santa Cruz. She also delivers them to offices. She has been working out of her home, located in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone, for more than 10 years. Her children help her with production and sales. Sadly, her husband passed away, and she has had to take care of the whole family. Now, through hard work, she has been able to make her business succeed and cover food and education costs. She is now thinking of her children's future. She taught them the business well so that in the future they can take care of themselves. Angélica started working with a paper cutter and a hole punch. Now she is requesting this loan to be able to buy others and support her work and that of her children. Angélica has not been working with this organization for long, but in a short period of time she has shown that she is a hard worker and that she is punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to purchase a (paper) cutter and hole puncher

loans.name: Luisa Lidia

texts.es: La Señora  Luisa se dedica a la venta de juguetes usados americanos ella trae los juguetes en fardos de segunda calidad de Oruro y los vende en La Paz en el mercado de la zona su puesto es ambulante se ubica en la acera o en distintos lugares, es madre de dos hijos, el mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y el menor comprende en la edad de 14 años se encuentra en edad escolar, la señora esta casada con el señor Luis de ocupación carpintero (tallador en madera), realiza su trabajo en forma manual el propósito del préstamo es para traer juguetes de primera calidad de Oruro el cual daría una considerable mejora en sus ingresos elevando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luisa sells used American toys. She gets the second-hand toys in bundles from Oruro and sells them in La Paz. She sells them in the local market. She has a traveling stand that is located on the sidewalk or in distinct places. She is the mother of two; the oldest is 27 years old, and the younger is 14 years old - school age. She is married to Luis, who is a carpenter. He does manual work. This loan is to get brand new toys from Oruro, which will bring in much better revenue, elevating the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of toys

loans.name: Siempre Juntos Group

texts.es: El grupo esta compuesto por 8 personas  de las cuales la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesto de la siguiente manera: la presidenta es la Sra. Laura vive en casa familiar de la madre  en la zona de sacaba vive junto a sus 3 hijos, la mencionada señora es  buena líder y se dedica a la venta ropa y otros ambulando por las distintas zonas de sacaba, y también en los mercados, es una persona muy trabajadora y el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de invierno, como chompas y sacones ya que se esta acercando la época de frio y muchas de sus clientes ya le hacen pedido de estas prendas de vestir, la Sra. Laura esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The group is comprised of eight people. Among them, the board of directors in arranged such that the president is Laura. She lives in her mother's home in the Sacaba zone. She lives with her three children. She is a good leader and does traveling sales of clothes and other items. She goes throughout the Sacaba zone as well as to the markets. She is a very hardworking person, and she will use the money from this loan to purchase winter clothes, such as sweaters and jackets since the cold season is coming and many customers have ordered these items. Laura is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es:
El negocio de Sara, es la venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de pescado el cual lleva dos años, con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia con los gastos.  Su esposo labora como conductor y ambos están al pendiente de sus dos hijos, los cuales cursan la primaria.
Los pescados un vecino se los vende, a precios accesible, el cual los alza en el frízer de la refrié y casi todos son encargados. Moviendo a si su capital.
Sara lleva cinco ciclos de préstamo en Afodenic el cual ha logrado realizar mejoras a su casa, a si como el aumento de inventario. Con este nuevo  préstamo será para la compra de una paca mixta, dos docena de sandalia de mujer, dos docenas de camisetas de varón y seguir ofertando sus productos el cual tiene algunos de encargo. y desea satisfacer a sus clientes, teniendo poca ropa que espera lograr mejores resultados con esta nueva inversion.
texts.en:
Sara's business is selling second-hand clothes.  She also sells fish.  She has been in this business for two years.  Her goal is to help her family with their expenses.  Sara's husband works as a driver and both of them are alert to the needs of their two children who are in elementary school.  Sara buys her fish from a neighbor at an affordable price.  She keeps them in a freezer and sells nearly all of them to order.  This is how she moves her capital.

Sara has been through five loan cycles with Afodenic and has managed to make some improvements to her home and also increase her stock.  She will use this loan to buy a mixed bundle of clothes: two dozen pairs of women's sandals and two dozen men's t-shirts, so that she can continue selling her products, some of which she has orders for.  She hopes to be able to satisfy her customers.  Sara doesn't have many clothes to sell and hopes to achieve better results with this new investment.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes, sandals and men's t-shirts, to increase her sales

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: La Sra. Florentina es cliente que vive al sur D. la ciudad D. La Paz, actualmente vive con sus 6 hijos que aun se encuentran en la etapa escolar y a los cuales mantiene sola puesto que ha quedado viuda hace poco. Es una socia muy responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta D. productos varios en su tienda ubicada en el mismo domicilio y para lo cual necesita el préstamo. Ella invertirá en la compra D. mayor mercadería como abarrotes para surtir su tienda y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y D. esta manera llevar a su familia para adelante. Esta muy contenta por la colaboración que se le presta y queda muy agradecida por ello.
texts.en: Florentina is a client who lives in the south end of the city of La Paz. She currently lives with her 6 children, all of whom are still in school. She supports them alone as she has recently been widowed. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who sells a variety of products from a store located in her own home and for which she needs the loan. She will invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as groceries, to stock her store in order to improve her income and to move forward with her family. She is very happy for the loan given to her and she is very thankful for it.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Dania Lissette

texts.es:
Dania tiene la edad de 35 años, casada, de oficio jefa de producción en una panadería de la capital. Su esposo es propietario de un camión el cual lo trabaja en viajes.
Como meta ha sido la construcción de su casa, el cual han venido mejorando con financiamiento que la institución de Afodenic ah otorgado en tres ciclos. Levantando toda de concreto.
Lo que quiere hacer con este nuevo préstamo es para repellar paredes, y levantar un pequeño muro. El cual está contenta por lograr cada día la terminación de su casa. Para esto comprara: trescientos bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín, estribos para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Dania, 35, is married.  She is head of production at a bakery in the capital.  Her husband owns his own truck and operates a trucking business.  
Dania wants to finish building her house, a project that she's been working on and for which Afodenic has provided three past loans.  She is using cement for all of the construction.
Dania will use this new loan to plaster the inside walls of her house and build a low outside wall.  Dania is pleased to see the progress on her house.  For the new work, she will buy: three-hundred concrete blocks, cement, rebar, plaster, beams, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairs to her house.

loans.name: Verenisa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora verenisa es madre soltera , tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos aun esta en edad escolar, verenisa de dedica a venta de hamburguesas y pollo broaster en las afueras de su casa esta labor la realiza solo por las noches, teniendo una gran acogida , ya que se encuentra en un lugar  muy transitado de la ciudad, además verenisa tienes otros ingresos por la venta de artículos de belleza como son cosméticos perfumes y otros , y por las mañana vende comida a los profesores de un colegio se su zona generándoles otros ingresos, el dinero que esta solicitando será invertido en comprar mas productos de belleza ya que estamos en campaña por el día del padre , además  de darle mejoramiento a su vivienda, su sueño a futuro es en futuro es tener un local mas grande para ofrecer sus productos de belleza y tener sus casa Con todos sus acabados y con ello brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, verenisa esta muy agradecida con confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Verenisa is single and she has 2 children, one of whom is still school aged. Verenisa sells hamburgers and roast chicken fron the front section of her house. She works only in the evenings and she has great demand because she is located in a very well traveled area of the city. Verenisa earns additional income by selling beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, etc. In the mornings she sells prepared foods to the teachers of the school in her neighborhood, thereby generating more income. The funds that she requests will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products to prepare for Father's Day. She also wants to make home improvements. Her dream for the future is to have a larger store from where to sell her beauty products and to have her house completed in every detail to provide her children with a better quality of life. Verenisa is very thankful for the trust imparted upon her.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as perfumes, skin lotions, and makeup, and to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 47 años, es dueño de un negocio que se dedica a la compra-venta de productos agricolas en general y compra-venta de animales vacunos.
Posee casa propia en Pilar, con las infraestructuras necesarias para el desarrollo de sus actividades familiares.
Gracias al crédito solicitado a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, el señor Mario podría invertir su capital en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio, logrando así un mayor ingreso en sus ventas.
Posee mercado ya seguro, está en el ramo hace más de 10 años, cuenta con productos de  muy buena calidad y precios accesibles.
Hoy día sus ingresos han mejorado y sus clientes están cada vez más satisfechos con la excelente calidad de sus hortalizas y animales ofrecidos.
El cliente  agradece nuevamente a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de solicitar un ayuda económica e incentiva a los nuevos clientes a operar con Kiva, para utilizar los fondos y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario is 47 years old.  He owns a business buying and selling agricultural products and cattle.  He owns his own home in Pilar with the infrastructure he needs to carry out his family activities.

Thanks to his loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, Mario will be able to invest his capital in buying merchandise for his business.  This will enable him to make more income through his sales.

Mario already has a stable market.  He has been in this business for ten years and has very good-quality products which he sells at affordable prices.  Mario's income has improved and his customers are increasingly satisfied with the excellent quality of the vegetables and animals that he sells.

Mario is once again grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity to request financial support and he encourages new clients to work with Kiva, to use their funds and make more income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and animals

loans.name: Caacupe Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirian es la Coordinadora del Comité de Mujeres denominado Caacupe, ella es casada con tres hijos, trabaja como vendedora de comidas en la terminal de ómnibus del distrito de María Auxiliadora, desde las 06:00 Hs., hasta las 20:00 Hs. Con los fondos de la fundación, ella quiere invertir en insumos para producir más alimentos para vender y aumentar sus ingresos.
El comité Caacupe de la ciudad de Encarnación ha surgido por promociones realizadas en la zona, el mismo cuenta con 11 integrantes y la mayoría de las integrantes se dedica a actividades productivas. Otra integrante, la sra. Carmen, es tesorera del comité y una señora muy conocida en la comunidad por ser muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella se dedica a la producción de comidas para la venta al igual que Mirian, con el fondo que solicita a la fundación la señora desea comprar bebidas para vender en coleman en la terminal junto con su compañera.
texts.en:
Sr. Mirian is the coordinator of the Caacupe women's cooperative.  She is married and has three children.  She operates a business selling prepared meals at the bus station in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.  She works from 6:00am to 8:00pm.  She wants to use this loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her production and, in turn, increase her earnings.  
The Caacupe cooperative, in the city of Encarnacion, has grown on the back of a neighborhood advertising campaign.  There are 11 members now, most of whom operate some kind of business.  Another member, Sra. Carmen, is the group's treasurer.  She is a generous, hard-working woman, well known in the neighborhood.  Like Mirian, she operates a prepared meals business.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy a drinks cooler for her business which she operates at the same bus terminal as her friend.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité San Juan de la ciudad de Encarnación, ha surgido por promociones realizadas en la zona, el mismo cuenta con 10 integrantes y la mayoría se dedica a actividades productivas del ramo de alimentos o venta de alimentos.
Juana es una señora muy conocida en la comunidad por ser muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, con el fondo que solicita de la fundación la señora desea invertir en compra de pollitos para criar, pues como desea poder aumentar sus ingresos, puede observar que la cría de animales es una actividad muy productiva que deja un buen margen de ganancias y es independiente de temporadas a diferencia de otros tipos de negocio.
texts.en:
The San Juan committee, from the city of Encarnación, was established as a result of promotional activities which took place in their area.  The group has 10 members and most of them carry out business activities making and selling food.

Juana is a very well-known woman in her community as she is very hard-working and selfless.  Her business is raising animals and farming crops.  With the money that she is requesting from Fundación Paraguaya, she would like to invest in buying chicks to raise.  She would like to be able to increase her income and she can see that raising animals is a very productive business activity that has a good profit margin and is not seasonal unlike other types of business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fanny compró materiales como suelas, pegantes y capelladas, elaboró sandalias y respondiò a sus encargos con su anterior credikiva. Ahora como va a hacer una bodega para almacenar sus productos y necesita espacio para ampliar su taller, acuD. a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprarà materiales para la adecuaciòn locativa y  materias primas, para fabricar sandalias eso si en un  espacio mas còmodo, porque tiene nuevos pedidos D. sus clientes. Fanny manifiesta que "se encuentra D. maravilla y agradecida con Dios por contar con esta entidad y espera seguir contando con ella para que su negocio siga creciendo.". Si usted quiere conocer la historia D. Fanny ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/211193
texts.en: Fanny used her last Kiva loan to buy soles, glue, etc. so that she could meet the demand from her customers for the sandals that she makes.  Now she wants to improve her workshop.  She is applying to Kiva for a second loan that she will use to buy construction materials for the workshop plus the supplies she needs for making sandals.  The improved space will allow her to more easiily fill new orders.  Fanny says that "it's marvellous and I'm very grateful [for Kiva].  I hope to continue working with them to grow my business.".  If you want to know more about Fanny's story, go to: http://kiva.org/lend/211193.

loans.use: to buy materials for improving her workshop and supplies for making sandals, both for her sandal-making business.

loans.name: Bridie

texts.es:
Bridie tiene 44 años de edad y vive con su hijo en Calle Real, barrio ubicado en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, una linda y colonial ciudad a orillas del mar caribe y frecuentemente visitada por turistas nacionales e internacionales que admiran su cálido escenario de gente amable y trabajadora. 
Desde hace 8 años Bridie vendia productos naturales para una empresa importante, pero su ímpetu emprendedor y deseo de ser independiente, primaron ante la alternativa de seguir siendo empleada o empresaria de su propia microempresa. Ella decidió emprender su aventura de negocio y tomó toda la experiencia de su antiguo trabajo y la tradujo en un negocio de venta de productos naturales en  punto comercial llamado “Tienda naturista Sol de Vida”. Con un ahorro que habia logrado, hizo su primera inversión y hasta la presente le ha ido muy bien, por eso esta entusiasmada y quiere fortalecerlo, hasta lograr un crecimiento que le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos y con ello incrementar el bienestar de su hijo hasta llevarlo a que obtenga estudios superiores y potencialice su éxito en la vida. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  productos naturales como té verde, miel de abejas, quemadores de grasa, purgantes naturales entre otros. Su mayor desafio es el capital de trabajo pues no es suficiente en la medida en que se incrementan las ventas y requiere tener un efectivo disponible para surtir especialmente con los puctos que mas rotan.  Mientras Bridie construye su sueño a fuerza de trabajo y disciplina, continua esmerandose por sostener una rentabilidad sobre sus ventas no menor del 38% una rentabilidad sobre la inversiòn no menor de un 33%, para lograr su sostenibilidad.
texts.en:
Bridie is 44 years old and lives with her son in Calle Real, a neighborhood which is located in the city of Cartagena de Indias, a beautiful and colonial city on the shores of the Caribbean sea which is frequently visited by both domestic and international tourists who admire its warm scenery and its kind and hard-working people.

For eight years, Bridie sold natural products for a well-known company.  However, her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to be her own boss prevailed over the alternative of continuing to work as an employee and she now works as a businesswoman in charge of her own microbusiness.  Bridie decided to undertake her own business venture.  She took advantage of all the experience she gained in her old job and started her own business selling natural products from a commercial sales location called "Tienda Naturista Sol de Vida".  With some savings that she had made, she made her first investment and, up to now, her business has done very well.  For this reason, she is enthusiastic and would like to strengthen her business and achieve a level of growth that will help her to increase her income and, thereby, improve the well-being of her son so that he can pursue a higher education and be successful in life.

This Kiva loan is Bridie's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy natural products such as green tea, bees' honey, fat burners, natural laxatives, etc.  Her biggest challenge is working capital as she does not have enough.  As she increases her sales, she needs to have cash available to stock her business, especially with the products that have the quickest turnover.

While Bridie builds her dreams through her hard work and discipline, she continues to take care to maintain a profitability on her sales of no less than 38% and a profitability on her investment of no less than 33%, in order to achieve sustainability in her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products such as green tea, bees' honey, fat burners and natural laxatives

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora María, domiciliada en el km 16 Acaray de Minga Guazú.
Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “San Luis”. Están en el Cuarto Ciclo, con 14 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable. 
La sra. María se dedica a la venta de alimentos en una cantina que posee, desde allí trata de proveer toda clase de comidas y bebidas a sus clientes, no es muy grande su lugar de trabajo pero cuenta con muy buena reputación en cuanto a su calidad y servicio.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de bebidas e insumos para la preparación de alimentos, a fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This committee was set up thanks to the initiative of María who lives in 16km Acaray, in Minga Guazú.  María contacted her neighbors and friends and set up the committee in her area.  The committee is called 'San Luis' and it is currently in its fourth loan cycle with 14 members.  The group is well known in the neighborhood for the unity, support and responsibility of its members.

María's business is selling food in a café that she owns.  She provides all kinds of meals and drinks to her customers.  Her workplace isn't very big but it has a very good reputation as regards its quality and service.

María is requesting this loan to acquire a larger quantity of drinks and supplies for making food.  In this way, she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Guarani, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familar y movilidad propia (moto y motocarga).
Ella se dedica a la venta de panificados  de elaboración propia. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y sus panificados son muy reconocidos por la excelente calidad de los mismos.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima, para elaborar mayor cantidad de panificados y mejorar sus ingresos; agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través de la posibilidad de adquirir el crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is married.  She is 45 years old and lives in Guarani neighborhood, in the city of Pilar.  She owns her own home and has the basic conditions she needs to carry out her business activities in the heart of her family.  She owns her own transport (a motorbike and a motorbike for carrying goods).

Lucia is in the baked goods business (she makes these herself).  She has been in this business for four years and has the infrastructure she needs to carry out this business activity.  Her baked goods are very well known for their excellent quality.

Lucia is requesting this loan to invest in buying raw materials to make a larger quantity of baked goods and improve her income.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have given her by allowing her to acquire this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making baked goods

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es:
La cliente es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, tiene su propio local y clientela formada en toda la ciudad.
La señorita es soltera, sin hijo, vive con sus padres, estudia y también realiza trabajos de Auditoría para algunas empresa en particular.
Es una persona joven, estudiosa y muy trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en la sociedad.
Agradece a la institución por los buenos servicios prestados como así también ella se compromete a cumplir en tiempo y forma con la responsabilidad en caso de adquirir el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a saleswoman who buys and sells men's and women's clothes.  She owns her own sales premises and has customers throughout the city.  This lady is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents, studies, and also carries out auditing work for some private companies.

The borrower is a young, studious, hard-working woman who has very good references.  She is grateful to the institution for the services they have provided her with.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and in full on receiving the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy jackets, tracksuits, pants and coats

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El señor Gumercindo tiene 45 años de edad, está casado y con 3 hijos, una está cursando la carrera de sicología y dos en edad escolar.
Se dedica al macate (venta ambulante), como también en el ramo de plomería, es una persona muy trabajadora, su actividad principal es el de macate ya que es una profesión que aprendió de cuna, pues, todas las personas de la zona se dedican en el ramo y es prácticamente hereditario. 
Su esposa y sus hijos son artesanos y le apoyan en el sustento diario y los créditos que ha obtenido lo ha venido invirtiendo en la compra de colchas al por mayor por lo que adquiere a menor precio y le da la posibilidad de obtener más ingreso.
Tiene como sueño mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Solicita nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar colchas, hamacas e hilos a fin de poder comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  One of his children is studying for a degree in psychology and the other two are in school.  Gumercindo is a traveling salesman and he also works as a plumber.  He is a very hard-working person.  His main business is working as a traveling salesman.  This is a profession that he learned from the cradle as everybody in his area works in this business.  It is practically a hereditary business.

Gumercindo's wife and children are craftspeople and they help to support their family.  Gumercindo has invested the loans that he has obtained in buying bedspreads wholesale, as he acquires them for a lower price which allows him to make more profits.

Gumercindo's dream is to improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

Gumercindo is requesting a new loan to buy bedspreads, hammocks and threads to sell.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, hammocks and threads for resale

loans.name: Richard Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Richard cuenta con un Autoservice desde el año 2000, dicha actividad lo lleva desarrollando durante 10 años y en el barrio donde se encuentra ya cuenta con clientes fieles.
Richard, es joven y sin hijos, por lo que cuenta con mayor capacidad de invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer con mayor rapidez.
El crédito solicitado a la Fundación Paraguaya, desea invertirlo en la compra de lácteos, gaseosas, carnes, y otros artículos que vende en su negocio.
Richard agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo otorgado, mediante el cual tendrá oportunidad de darle otro impulso a su emprendimiento y hacer conocer su historia a inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Richard has owned a supermarket since the year 2000.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has loyal customers in his neighborhood.

Richard is a young man and he doesn't have any children.  For this reason, he has a better ability to invest in his business and grow it more quickly.

Richard would like to invest the loan he has requested from Fundación Paraguaya in buying dairy products, soda, meat and other products to sell in his business.

Richard is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have provided which will give him the opportunity he needs to provide his business with another boost and make his story known to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, soda, meat and other products

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla es una señorita que vive en el departamento de Cochabamba, Provincia Quillacollo municipio de Vinto, ella tiene un vivero de flores juntamente con sus papas, ella ayuda a sus papas en la producción y comercialización ya que sus papas son de edad avanzada  y  con muy poca cultura, ella se encarga de las ventas porque a su mama la engañan en  el mercado, ella entro  a estudiar en la Universidad y quiere ampliar sus vivero para tener más ingresos con los cuales ella pueda pagar sus estudios, y tener un estilo de vida mejor al que ahora tiene.
Ella solicito un crédito para la compra de plásticos para su vivero de flores ya que en Bolivia estamos entrando a la época de invierno  y no quiere que sus flores se sequen por el frio, ella tiene las ganas y metas de poder  exportar sus flores a otros departamentos.
texts.en:
Carla is a young lady who lives in Cochabamba department, in Quillacollo province, in the town of Vinto.  She owns a flower nursery together with her parents.  Carla helps her parents to produce and sell their produce as they are now elderly and don't have much knowledge.

Carla is in charge of making sales as people cheat her mom in the market.  Carla started studying at University and would like to expand her nursery in order to make more profits with which to pay for her studies.  She would like to enjoy a better style of life than that which she has right now.

Carla requested a loan to buy plastic for her flower nursery since we are entering the Winter season in Bolivia and she doesn't want her flowers to dry out in the cold.  Carla has the desire and the goal to export her flowers to other departments.

loans.use: to buy plastic with which to protect her nursery during the winter

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 27 años de edad, está casado con Leticia de 23 años, vive en casa propia, es macatero (vendedor ambulante) hace más de cinco años, además de eso es albañil y su señora es artesana; fabrica sobrecamas que despues son comercializados por su marido.
Miguel es muy sacrificado debido a que los dias hábiles de semana trabaja como albañil, y los fines de semana se va a vender sus productos en la capital y sus alrededores recorriendo varios kilometros en su moto, realizando las ventas casa por casa.
Miguel empezó como vendedor de un primo suyo por dos años y después de que compró para su moto y con la ayuda de su primo pudo tener su propia microempresa.
Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderias (edredones y sábanas).
texts.en:
Miguel is 27 years old, married to Leticia, 23, and living in his own house.  He’s been a street vendor for over five years.  Besides that, he’s also a bricklayer and his wife’s an artisan.  She manufactures bedspreads that are then sold by her husband.

Miguel is very self-denying because during the workweek he works as a bricklayer and on weekends he goes out to sell his products in the capital and its surrounding areas covering several kilometers on his motorcycle selling door to door.

Miguel started out working for two years as a salesman for a cousin of his and later on bought his motorcycle and with help from his cousin was able to set up his own micro business.  Today, he has a well established customer base thanks to good service and the high quality of his products.  He needs money to buy merchandise (comforters and sheets).

loans.use: to buy sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este comité tiene muy buena organización, son unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. 
Se encuentran con la renovación del cuarto ciclo. Se reúnen semanalmente para organizar el trabajo en equipo turnandose cada una por igual.
Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Mbocayaty - Villarrica, en mayoría microempresarias, pues se dedican a la fabricación, compra y venta de prendas de ao poi. Manifestaron que su sueño de crecimiento y solidez del grupo sería abrir una microempresa  juntas y con la ayuda que la Fundación Paraguaya mediante los créditos que otorgan cada etapa; aprenden a ahorrar  y el día de mañana tendrán su propia microempresa de Comité pudiendo trabajar en paralelo a lo que están realizando actualmente.
La sra. Emilce se dedica desde hace tiempo a la fabricación y venta de prendas de ao poi, ella es jubilada también pues fue docente por más de 25 años y ahora como no le alcanza el dinero para poder mantener a su familia, se dedica al microcomercio.
Ella espera contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas de Kiva para poder comprar más telas y elementos necesarios para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
This committee is very well organized; they are united, hard working and mutually supportive.  They are in the fourth cycle renewal.  They meet weekly to organize the teamwork trading off equally among them.

These women are from the city of Mbocyaty-Villarica.  Most are micro entrepreneurs.  They are manufacturers and buyers/sellers of Ao Poi garments (traditional Paraguayan embroidery).  They stated that their dream of growth and group solidarity would be to open a micro business together with help from Fundación Paraguaya and its regular loans granted at each stage.  They learn to save and in the near future will have their own committee micro business to work alongside what they are currently involved in.

Emilce has been making and selling Ao Poi garments for a long time.  She was a teacher for over 25 years and is now retired but because her pension isn’t sufficient to be able to support her family she‘s working her micro business.

She hopes to have support from Kiva lenders to buy more fabric and necessary supplies to make her items.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Virgilio Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Virgilio de 46 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Mirta, tienen una hija que está cursando la secundaria, cuenta con un pequeño negocio en su domicilio hace 5 años apoximadamente. 
Empezó vendiendo bebidas y de a poco y con esfuerzo lograron agrandar su negocio, ahora  vende todo tipo de bebidas heladas y artículos de primera necesidad, como su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio atienden hasta muy tarde por lo que logró conseguir buena clientela.
El Sr. Virgilio solicitó apoyo a la fundación para poder comprar mas mercaderías como harina, huevo, panificados, bebidas, golosinas, etc. Y de esa forma poder seguir brindando a sus clientes productos variados y a buen precio.
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad de acceder a la solicitud del préstamo ya que si lo consigue le ayudará a que vaya progresando día a día.
texts.en:
Sr. Virgilio is 46 years old and married to Sra. Mirta. They have a daughter who is attending high school. He has a small business in his home that he has managed for approximately five years. He began selling beverages and was able to expand his business over time and with effort. Now he sells all types of beverages, as well as ice cream and basic necessities. Since he operates his business out of his home, he is able to stay open much later. This has allowed him to build up a good customer base.

Sr. Virgilio is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya so that he can buy more merchandise such as flour, eggs, baked goods, beverages, candy, and other products. This will help him continue to provide his customers with different products and good prices.

He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity to access this loan so that he can continue to make progress each day.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, baked goods, beverages, candy, and other products.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Doña Erika tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio solo la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Jose Alfredo el cual trabaja de agricultor, ellos tienen un pequeño hijo de nombre Alfredo de siete años de edad que asista a la primaria, Doña erika y su familia viven el el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio productor de azucar don pablo machado.

Doña erika nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar para poder ayudar a su esposo con os gastos del hogar, asi que decidio iniciar a vender cosmeticos y perfumeria por catalago, con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos platica que primero lleva sus catalagos a mostrar con sus clientes, posteriormente levanta un pedido y lo encarga con sus proveedores, cunado llega el pedido lo entrega y resive el pago por sus productos, ella nos dijo "Gracias a Dios siempre hay un poco de venta El da para todos", ella necesita este cretito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, cosmeticos y perfumeria para su posterior venta. ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea que dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y darle mas estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Erika is 32 years old and only has a preparatory school education. She is married to Sr. Jose Alfredo, who works as a farmer. They have a seven-year-old son named Alfredo who attends elementary school. Doña Erika and her family live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Erika says that more than two years ago she decided to start working so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. She sells cosmetics and perfumes through catalogs to her friends and neighbors in the community. Erika says that she brings the catalogs to show to her customers. After she receives an order, she submits the request to her distributors. When she delivers the order, Erika collects payment for the products. She says, “Thanks to God, I always am able to make a few sales. He gives me everything.”

Erika needs this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs, cosmetics, and perfumes for later resale. She hopes that this loan will help her business prosper. Erika wants to give her son a better quality of life and help him further his education.

loans.use: to purchase catalogs, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Amelia tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Rafael el cual trabaja de choofer con el cual tiene un hijo de nombre David que asiste a la preparatoria, ella y su familia viven en una comunidad de nombre Tetela la cual se encuentra en el estado de Oaxaca, la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos de el ingenio azucarero Don Pablo Machado.
