Doña Amelia nos platica que hace mas de tres años tuvo la inquietud de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar  asi que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, chiles rellenos, tamales, papas, y patanitos fritos) los cuales vende en un pequeño local que tiene ensu casa que da a la carretera al cual a llamado Antojitos Don Chipotle, ella vende solo los fines de semana de viernes a domingo apartir de las siete de la noche, sus vecinos comentan que la comida de doña amelia es muy sabrosa. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cebolla, chiles, tomates, cilantro, carne, maiz, tortilla, papas, platanos, aceite, huevos, repollo, crema queso y gas para la elaboracion de sus antojitos y posteriormente venderlos.

ella espera que con esta invesion su negocio prospere ya que desea invertir sus ganancias en la remodelacion y ampliacion de su negocio
texts.en:
Doña Amelia is 42 years old and only has a high school education. She is married to Sr. Rafael, who works as a chauffeur. They have a son named David who is attending preparatory school. Amelia and her family live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Amelia says that three years ago she was concerned about helping her husband with the household expenses. She decided to start her own business selling Mexican street food such as empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, stuffed chili peppers, tamales, potatoes, and fried plantains. Amelia sells her food from a small stand at her house that faces the highway. The name of her business is “Antojitos Don Chipotle”. She only sells on the weekends, Friday through Sunday, starting at 7pm. Her neighbors say that her food is very flavorful.

Amelia needs this loan to invest in the purchase of onions, chili peppers, tomatoes, cilantro, meat, corn, tortillas, potatoes, plantains, oil, eggs, cabbage, cream cheese, and gas so that she can prepare and sell her street food. She hopes that this investment will help prosper her business. Amelia has plans to reinvest her earnings by remodeling and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for her street food business.

loans.name: Eliquia

texts.es:
La señora Eliquia tiene la edad de 52 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Benicno el cual trabaja de agricultor, ella nos platica que actualmente vive solo con su esposo ya que sus hijos ya estan casados, ellos vien en el estado de oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio azucarero don pablo machado.

Doña eliquia nos platica que ha ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar a si que hace algunos años asistio a unos cursos que impartieron en su comunidad para aprender a elaborar manualidades como son zapatos bordados, blusas, bolsas, vestidos y servilletas pintadas y bosrdadas, desde que ella aprendi a trabajar con las manualidades decidio iniciar a trabajar vendiendolas con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ellanos platica que algunas veces trabaja por pedido pero que tambien elabora sus productos y sale a ofrecerlos casa por casa en su comunidad, ella nos dice que le ha hido muy bien con su negocio y que hace algunos meses ha iniciado a vender zapatos por catalago y ahora tiene dos pequeños negocios los cuales le gustaria hacer creser dia a dia con su trabajo.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, listones, pinturas, telas, ganchos, ahugas, zapatos y catalagos para poder realizar sus ventas.

ella es una persona muy entusiasta y nos dice que no pierde la esperanza de en un futuro tener un pequeño local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vender sus productos
texts.en:
Sra. Eliquia is 52 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Benicno, who works as a farmer. Eliquia says that she and her husband live by themselves since their children are already married. She lives in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Eliquia says that she has always enjoyed working. A few years ago, she attended a few courses that were taught in her community. She learned how to make handicrafts such as embroidered shoes, blouses, handbags, dresses, and painted and embroidered napkins. Since learning how to make these crafts, she decided to start selling them to her friends and neighbors in the community to earn extra money and help her husband with the household expenses. Occasionally she produces some items from orders, but most of the products she makes are sold by going house-to-house in her community. Eliquia says that she has done very well in her business. A few months ago, she also started selling shoes through catalogs. Now that she has two small businesses, Eliquia enjoys growing in her job day after day.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of thread, ribbons, paints, fabrics, fasteners, needles, shoes, and catalogs so that she can generate sales.

Eliquia is an enthusiastic person. She says that she has not lost hope in the future of having a small shop in her community where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase thread, ribbons, paints, fabrics, fasteners, needles, shoes, and catalogs.

loans.name: Alba Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Alba Tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor luis, doña Alba y su esposo viven en una comunidad llamada tetela la cual se caracteriza por localizarse en una zona cañera a quiece minutos del ingenio azucarero don pablo machado en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Alba nos platica que hace algunos años asistio a unos cursos que impartieron en la agancia municipal de su localidad en los cuales enseñaron a las mujeres ha elaborar manualidades como son blusas, servilletas, vestidos pintados y bordados con liston, ella nos platica que como aprendio ha elaborar muy bien sus manualidades decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y desde entonces vende sus manualidades con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad , ella nos dice que algunas veces trabaja por pedido pero que muchas otras elabora su ropa y sale a ofrecerla casa por casa. Doña Alba nos platica que gracias a Dios siempre tiene venta y que poco a poco quiere hacer crecer el negocio y tambien vender un poco de perfumeria y cosmeticos para ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de listones, telas, ahujas, pinceles, hilos para la elaboracion de sus manualidades. ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio cresca un poco mas dia a dia.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba is 38 years old and has a preparatory school education. She is married to Sr. Luis. Doña Alba and her husband live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Alba says that a few years ago she attended a some classes offered by a municipal agency in her town. These courses taught women how to produce handicrafts such as blouses, napkins, painted dresses, and embroideries made of ribbon. Since she did a good job of learning to make these crafts, Alba decided to start her own business and sell her products to friends and neighbors in the community. She says that she occasionally works from orders, but most of the time she sells the clothing she produces by going house to house. Doña Alba says she thanks God because she always has sales. Over time, she wants to grow her business and sell some perfumes and cosmetics to earn some extra money so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

Alba needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, fabrics, needles, paintbrushes, and thread for making her crafts. She hopes that this investment will help her business prosper because she wants it to grow a little bit each day.

loans.use: to purchase ribbons, fabrics, needles, paintbrushes, and thread.

loans.name: Yolanda Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene la edad de 44 años, solo estudio hasta la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Roberto con el cual tiene un hijo llamado Oscar de 16 años que asiste a la preparatoria de la comunidad.Ella vive en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.


Doña Yolanda nos dice que hace algunos meses con la ayuda de su esposa abrio una taqueria en su casa  en la cual vende los fines de semana (viernes, sabado y domingo), ella ademas de la taqueria se dedica a vender sabanas, y a coser la ropa de sus amigos y vecinos.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de carne, tortilla, chile, tomate, cebolla, col, rabanos, aceite, gas y limones para la elaboracion de sus tacos ademas de que comprara algunas sabanas para porteriormente venderlas y dara mantenimiento a su maquina de coser.

Doña Yolanda nos platica que dedidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negicio porque deciaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de su hijo, ya espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea que su hijo estudie una profesion y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is 44 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Roberto and they have a 16-year-old son named Oscar who is attending preparatory school in the community. She lives in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Yolanda says that a few months ago she opened a taco shop in her home with the help of her husband. She sells on the weekends (Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays). In addition to managing her taco business, she also sells bed sheets and sews clothing for her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan so that she can buy meat, tortillas, chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, radishes, oil, gas, and lemons for making her tacos. Yolanda will also buy some bed sheets to sell later and pay for the maintenance of her sewing machine.

Doña Yolanda says she decided to start working in her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and pay for her son’s education. She hopes that this loan will help her business prosper because she wants her son to study to become a professional. Yolanda also wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tacos, acquire bed sheets to sell, and pay for maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene la edad D. 48 años, solo estudio la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Rogelio que tiene la ocupacion D. mecanico, actualmente solo vive con su esposo ya que sus hijos ya se encuentran casados.Ella vive en el estado D. Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.

DOña Margarita nos platica que hace un poco mas D. dos años en el parque D. su comunidad impartieron unos cursos para aprender a bordar con listones y a pintar bolsas, como ella aprendio a realizar muy bonitos trabajos decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ganar un poco D. dinero extra y asi ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella realiza bolsas, blusas, faldas, servilletas, vestidos, cinturones y chalecos bordados, los cuales despues D. elaborarlos va a venderlos en su comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra D. listones, pinturas, hilos y telas para la elaboracion  D. sus manualidades y venderlos proteriormente con sus clientes.

Doña Margarita espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea en un futuro tener un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos y dar clases a las señoras que desen aprender.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is 48 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Rogelio, who is a mechanic by traD.. Margarita and her husband currently live by themselves since their children are already married. She lives in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Margarita says that more than two years ago, she took classes at the community park where she learned how to make embroidered ribbons and painted bags. When she learned how to produce these beautiful crafts, she decided to start her own business. With the little bit of extra money that she earns, Margarita is able to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes bags, blouses, skirts, napkins, dresses, belts, and embroidered waistcoats. Margarita sells these products in her community to her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, paints, thread, and fabrics for making her crafts so that she can sell them to her customers. Doña Margarita hopes that this loan will help her business prosper. In the future, she wants to have a small shop where she can sell her products and teach classes to women who want to learn.

loans.use: to purchase ribbons, paints, thread, and fabrics.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda tiene la edad de 53 años, solo estudio la secundaria, se encuentra casada  y tiene un hijo de 21 años llamado Angel  que estudia en el Tecnologico de Tierra Blanca Veracruz. Ella vive en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.

Doña Leonarda nos platica que hace un poco mas de 8 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene un local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas, garnachas y chiles rellenos) los fines de semana (vienes, sabado y domingo) ella vende por las noches y las familias salen a cenar a su local.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, aceite, chiles, tortillas, carne, frijol, queso, crema, col, sal, gas, mole, platanos, papas, tomates, cebollas y ajos para la elaboracion de sus antojitos mexicanos y venderlos posteriormente.

Doña Leonarda espera que con este credito su negocio propere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y seguirlo apoyando para que termine sus estudio ademas de que le gustaria agrandar su negocio y comprar algunas mesas y sills para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonarda is 53 years old and only has a high school education. She is married and has a 21-year-old son named Angel who is studying at the Technological Institute of Tierra Blanca Veracruz. Leonarda lives in the community of Tetela in the State of Oaxaca. This region is known for growing sugar cane and is located 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Leonarda says that she decided to start working a little more than eight years ago. She wanted her own business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. Leonarda has a stand in the central area of her community where she sells Mexican street food such as empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas, “garnachas” (tortillas topped with shredded meat, cheese, and cabbage), and stuffed chili peppers. She sells her food on the weekends, specifically Saturdays and Sundays. Her food is sold at night when families leave to have dinner at her establishment.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of corn, oil, chili peppers, tortillas, meat, beans cheese, cream, cabbage, gas, mole sauce, plantains, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and garlic for preparing Mexican street food that she will sell.

Doña Leonarda hopes that this loan will help her business prosper because she wants to provide her son with a better quality of life and to continue supporting him as he finishes his studies. In addition, she wants to expand her business by adding a few tables and chairs so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her street food business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel tiene la edad de 53 años estudio solo la preparatoria y es madre soltera de un joven de 21 años llamado Fernando que estudia la universidad en Veracruz. Ella vive en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela, esta region se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y a 15 minutos se encuetra el ingenio Don Pablo Machado.

Doña Isabel nos platica que hace mas de 30 años sus padres le heredaron una tienda de abarrotes la cual se llama "Abarrotes la Central" la cual se encuentra ubicada en el centro de su comunidad junto a la iglesia parroquial, ella nos platica que esta tienda la a ayudado mucho a sacar adelante a su hijo.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de galletas, refrescos, dulces, arroz, frijol, azucar, sal, aceite, tomates, chiles, papel de baño, jugos, arina, cafe, jabon, cloro, leche y enbutidos para resurtir su tienda.

Ella nos platica que siempre le gusta tener su tienda bien surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuentre lo que buscan y asi con gusto vuelvan a comprar, tambien nos dijo que es importante dale un buen trato a los clientes.

Doña Isabel espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y seguirlo apoyando para que termine sus estudios, ademas de que desea en un futuro poder agrandar su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Isabel is 53 years old and only has a preparatory school education. She is a single mother of a 21-year-old son named Fernando who is studying at a university in Veracruz. Isabel lives in in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Isabel says that more than 30 years ago, she inherited a grocery store from her parents called “Abarrotes de Central” located in the heart of the community with the local parish. She says that the store has been a great help with moving her son forward.

Isabel needs this loan to invest in the purchase of cookies, soft drinks, candy, rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, tomatoes, chili peppers, toilet paper, juices, flour, coffee, soap, bleach, milk, and cured meats. She says that she likes having her store well-stocked so that her customers can find what they need. As a result, they return to make more purchases. She says that it is important to provide her customers with good service.

Doña Isabel hopes that this loan will help her business prosper because she wants to give her son a better quality of life and support him with the completion of his studies. In addition, she wants to expand her grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura Tienen la edad de 22 años, estudio solo la preparatoria y esta casad con hernan el cual trabaja de agricultor, ella esta embarazada y vive con su esposo en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar hubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingeni azucarero Don Pablo Machado.

Rosaura nos platica que hace un poco mas de tres años decidio iniciar a trabajar ya que de esa manera ganaba mas y cuando se caso continuo con su venta ya que junto a su esposo quiere contruir un patrimonio para sus hijos. ella vende zapatos por catalogo, casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella primero lleva a mostrar sus catalagos con sus clientes, levanta un pedido y se surte de zapatos los cuales despues entrega y recibe su pago por sus productos. ella es una persona muy entusiasta y  amiguera lo cual le ayuda a vender mas zapatos. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Zapatos y catalogos para realizar sus ventas. rosaura espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere a que desea ahorrar para preparar la llegada de su bebe
texts.en:
Rosaura is 22 years old and has a preparatory school education. She is married to Hernan, who is a farmer. Rosaura is pregnant and lives with her husband in the community of Tetela in the State of Oaxaca. This community is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is only 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Rosaura says that she decided to start working a little more than three years ago so that she could earn more income. When she got married, Rosaura continued with her sales business since she and her husband want to build up an inheritance for their children. She sells shoes through catalogs and travels from house to house in order to visit friends and neighbors in her community. Rosaura arrives at their homes to show them the catalogs. She takes their orders and then requests the shoes. Rosaura collects payment after the merchandise has been delivered. She is an enthusiastic and friendly person, which helps her sell more shoes. Rosaura needs this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes and catalogs so that she can make sales. She hopes that this investment will help her business prosper because she wants to save up money before the arrival of her baby.

loans.use: to acquire shoes and catalogs so that she can generate sales.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casado, el tine tres hijos Zulma de 21 años y zeidy de 19 que asisten a la universidad y Rafael que asiste a primaria, el y su familia viven en el estado De Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos de uno de los ingenios azucareros llamado la margarita.

don Rafael nosplatica que hace el trabaja en el campo pero lo que gana no le alcanzaba para cubrir con los gastos del hogar asi que platicando con su esposa decidieron abrir una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes para ganar un poco de dinero extra y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. su tienda se encuentra en un pequeño local que tiene a en su casa con vista a la calle el cual lo abre todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a  ocho de la noche, el cual atiende sus hijos y su esposa. el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, papel de baño, sopa, azucar, sal, dulces, galletas y refrescos para resurtr su tienda. el nos platica que siempre le ha gustado tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y asi vuelvan a su tienda a comprar.

don rafael espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea terminar de pagar los estudios de sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad vida
texts.en:
Rafael is 45 years old.  He only finished secondary school.  He’s married and has three children: Zulma, 21, and Zeidy, 19, who go to the university and Rafael who is in elementary school.  He and his family live in the state of Oaxaca in a community called Tetela which is noted for being located in a sugar cane growing zone just fifteen minutes form one of the large sugar cane plantations called “La Margarita.” 

Rafael tells us that he works in the fields but what he earns there wasn’t enough to cover household expenses so, talking it over with his wife, they decided to open a little grocery store to earn a little extra money and provide better quality of life for their children.  The store is located in a small locale he has at home that faces the street and that opens daily from 8am until 8pm.  His children and his wife tend to it.  He needs the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, soup, sugar, salt, candy, cookies and soft drinks to restock the store.  He tells us that he always likes to keep the store well stocked so that his customers always find what they are looking for and will return to shop at his store.

Rafael hopes that his business will prosper with the loan because he wants to finish paying for his children’s schooling and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her husband's ice-selling business. With the loan, he will buy a four-wheeled cart and ice blocks which will allow him to visit different parts of the city for selling ice and earning better profits. 

Summer has come and the demand for ice is very high these days. Mussarat is confident that an investment will help her husband make his business more profitable. Previously he would rent a cart, but now that money which he paid for the cart rental will be added to his income instead. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. 

Mussarat is the mother of three daughters and two sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Mussarat herself is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

She is confident that she will be able to return the loan easily as a result of the improved business conditions of her husband.

loans.use: To buy a cart & blocks of ice

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia, a 54-year-old married mother of two children, has had a retail shop selling snacks, biscuits and  beverages for the past five years in the Philippines. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her enterprise. In the future, Cresencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 54-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where she has been selling rice cakes or bibingkas for 10 years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making more of these products. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make rice cakes or bibingkas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This business woman, who is married to a businessman and has two children aged 12 and 9 years, established her fish business In the year 2000. At the time, she realised that her husband’s income was no longer enough to support their family, so she started this enterprise to help him provide a livelihood for their children. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more cartons of fish for her business and will use the increased proceeds to build a dwelling house and educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish for her business.

loans.name: Mariecor

texts.en: Mariecor is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. For the last two years, she has made a living running a retail shop where she sells biscuits, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. In this photo, we see Mariecor and her two daughters. She's a new member of HSPFI and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Our borrower is 32 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. In 2003, she went into business for herself by selling imported food. Her goal was to earn enough money to help her husband support their family. She works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about Le 750,000 a month. She has an excellent repayment history and is applying for a new loan, for Le 500,000, to buy more  imported food to sell to her customers. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by about Le 250,000 so that she can complete construction of her home and open a second business in a new location. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more imported food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mapitch

texts.en:
Mapitch is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Mapitch has a retail shop that sells snacks, biscuits, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy beverages, snacks and biscuits. Mapitch is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Mapitch hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks and biscuits

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Rosanna has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks, biscuits and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages and breads. Rosanna is a new member of HSPFI. 

In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and breads

loans.name: Ronafe

texts.en:
Ronafe is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Ronafe has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, noodles, detergents and biscuits. Ronafe is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Ronafe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, noodles, detergents and biscuits

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Rubilyn has a retail shop that sells eggs, detergents, noodles and breads. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits and breads. Rubilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Rubilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, biscuits and breads

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old business woman. She is married, and has 3 children ages 9, 15 and 19 years. In the year 2009, she established her business selling jewelry, slippers and ladies dresses. She began her business as a means of providing a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more jewelry and ladies slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, she plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders. This will help her get more profit and support her children’s university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry, slippers and ladies dresses for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, breads, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pork and beef to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en: Jolinda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a shop where she sells spices such as onions and garlic. She is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more spices to sell to her customers. Jolinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and hopes to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 29-year-old businesswoman.  She is single and has no children. In the year 2006, she established her local foodstuffs business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs for her business such as palm oil, gari (cassava grits), foo-foo (processed cassava), bennie (sesame seeds) and groundnuts.. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, she plans to rent her own store where other traders from the provincial town will buy in large quantity to sell to the villagers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her inventory.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells biscuits, noodles, detergents & bread. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bread, canned goods & beverages. In the picture are Marlyn and her younger son.

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 31-year-old mother from the village of Rameh in the north. After completing high school, Abir took cosmetology courses. In 2005 she began running a small hair salon and has gradually built up her business activity. After surveying her clients and potential clients from the area, Abir learned there is a real need for a cosmetics salon. Women from her area want the opportunity to have makeovers and cosmetic treatments.

Abir needed this loan to renovate an extra room for this expanded activity and to purchase supplies, furniture and equipment.

Abir wants to see her salon grow and expand, eventually serving clients from throughout the region.

loans.use: To renovate an extra room for cosmetic treatments and purchase supplies, furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, bread & eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beverages, biscuits & canned goods.

Airen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Airen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, biscuits & canned goods.

loans.name: Rabah

texts.en:
Due to issues of modesty, Rabah's husband is pictured instead of her in this photo. Rabah is a 36-year-old mother from the Negev. She was trained as a teacher's assistant for young children but was unable to find adequate work in this field. In 2008 she decided to open a business and began with a small grocery store. Over the last three years she has expanded and created a nice mini-market in her neighborhood.

Rabah needed this loan for new shelves and to purchase a larger stock of goods.

Rabah wants eventually to open a full-sized supermarket in the center of her town and serve a larger customer base.

loans.use: to purchase new shelves and a larger stock of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the conditions of her daycare and purchase additional supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different types and sizes of plastic slippers.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 30 years old and comes from Israel's Negev region. She has completed fashion and design courses and taken part in business training programs. Mona designs wedding and holiday dresses for women in her area. There is a large demand for this service for both purchase and rental. Mona has begun to build her client base through strong family and personal connections. She is a serious and dedicated businesswoman.

Mona needed this loan to purchase dress material, knitting and dress-making equipment, and supplies.

Mona wants to continue and see her business expand and one day she hopes to also offer classes and training in dress-making & design.

loans.use: To purchase dress material and dress-making equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional supplies, shelving, and do some renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools, etc. needed for the service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic bowls, buckets and kitchen utensils for her business inventory.

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda  is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.  She  has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, bread & biscuits. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bread.

Gelinda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gelinda  hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bread.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Virginia has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, beverages & bread. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cartons of pans, dishes, and cooking utensils for her business inventory.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, bread & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, bread & biscuits.

Concepcion has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, bread & biscuits.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells bread, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, bread, eggs & detergents.

Medarda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Medarda hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, eggs & detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This lady is a 35-year-old businesswoman.  She is married to a shipping officer, and she has one child who lives with because she is her relative and also helps her with her business. In 2003, she established her provisions and drinks business. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

She requires a loan in order to add more drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, cheese, margarine, sardines, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She is very determined to improve her business. In future she plans to also sell rice as she is very close to the main market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, cheese, margarine, sardines, etc. for her business inventory.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells eggs, bread, biscuits & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, bread & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & bread.

Mariane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mariane hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks, biscuits & bread.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has five children aged 19, 17, 12, 8 and 5. She has one additional dependent, who live with her because he is her nephew.  

In 2005, Zainab established her plastic bowls, buckets and baskets business. She inherited her business from her late mother. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 6,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy additional plastic bowls, buckets and baskets. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Zainab plans to educate her children to university level.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  plastic bowls, buckets and baskets.

loans.name: John B

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old John.  He is married and has two children aged two and five. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because they are his nieces.  In 2009, John established his electrical spare parts business. He began his business because he had gained experience from his elder brother and wanted to be self-employed and be able to provide livelihood for his family. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. John requires a loan in order to buy additional electrical spare parts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, John plans to develop his plot of land and to educate his children.   He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To pay for electrical spare parts.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She lives in Drogobych. Irina sells men’s and women’s clothing and footwear in the local marketplace called ‘Promislovyi’. Polite and friendly customer service, as well as the favorable location of her vending kiosks, have been instrumental in the success story of her venture. 

Irina has been in the trade for 20 years. She started working in this sphere of business when she was only 18. Back then Irina lived and worked in Poland. However, later, she moved her business to Ukraine and stayed in Drogobych. Presently, she has 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear merchandise for further retail sale in the market. Her business has solid potential for further growth and development. Irina intends to invest generated funds in consistent expansion of her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear and clothing inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Africana cloth for his business.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married with a teenage son and a daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Andriy offers transportation services on the territory of Ukraine. He has been working in this business sphere for four years. Currently, his monthly net profit amounts to 5,500 Grivnyas. 

Andriy is requesting a 16,000 Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his vehicle engine, as well as to purchase four tires and an accumulator unit for his car. Andriy’s enterprise is the main source of income for his family of four. He is working hard hoping to ensure a decent living for his children. One of Andriy’s biggest dreams is to help his children through college thus giving them a chance to become educated people and get a better life.

loans.use: to do major repairs on his car engine and purchase four tires and an accumulator unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted seasonal footwear for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, beer, stout, and wine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 32-year-old businesswoman.  She is single and has two children aged four and seven. In 2007, she established her drinks and provisions business. When she dropped out of school, she started up a business to help her provide livelihood for her children. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks and provisions such as milk, mayonnaise, sugar. sardines, etc. for her business inventory. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future she plans to educate her children to the highest level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more milk, mayonnaise, sugar and sardines for her business inventory.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь замужем. Ее супруга зовут Александр. Любовь имеет свой бизнес - продает женскую одежду и обувь.  Она занимается этим делом уже 15 лет и имеет достаточный опыт.  Любовь имеет  две торговые точки: одна в городе Мелитополе, другая в Кирилловке на побережье Азовского моря. 

Любовь трудолюбивая, ответственная и открытая. Она не останавливается на достигнутом и хочет продолжать развивать бизнес.  Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на приобретение нового сезонного товара. Увеличение ассортимента поможет ей  получить дополнительную прибыль, которую она сможет потратить на улучшение благосостояния семьи и развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lyubov' is married.  Her husband's name is Alexander.  Lyubov' has her own trade business and sells women's clothing and shoes.  She has been in business for 15 years and is very experienced in the trade field.  Lyubov' has two business locations: one in city of Melitopol' and another in Kirilovka on Azov sea coast. 

Lyubov' is a hardworking, responsible and sincere person.  She's not content with what she's achieved and wants to continue developing and growing her business.  Lyubov' is seeking a loan of 15,000 hryvnas for purchase of new seasonal clothing inventory for her business.  Increasing the assortment of her inventory will help her generate additional profits, which she can then use to improve living conditions of her family and further grow her business.

loans.use: приобрести новый сезонный товар

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a very supportive lady who operates a grocery store in her community where she sells daily use items to her clients at cheap rates. She has another business selling clothes, which also earns her a reasonable amount of income every month. 

Her husband works on the Pakistan railway on a monthly income. Mariam doesn’t have any children and she spends most of her time looking after her business.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will allow her to fulfill the timely demands of her clients and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for many years and hopes that an investment will bring more profits and improve her business conditions.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business

loans.name: Veronika

texts.ru:
Вероника разведена. Сама воспитывает двоих  детей и зарабатывает на благосостояние семьи. Она трудолюбивая, настойчивая, честная и открытая женщина. Вероника хочет жить достойной жизнью и работает каждый день.

Вероника имеет собственный бизнес уже 15 лет. Она занимается продажей бытовой химии, средств для чистки и всего, что касается ухода за домом. Вероника имеет хорошую торговую точку на центральном рынке.  

Вероника просит  предоставить ей кредит в сумме  15,000 гривен на приобретение нового товара. Она сможет увеличить свой доход , так как количество клиентов увеличится.
texts.en: Veronika is divorced.  She is raising her two children on her own and earns the living for the family.  She is a hardworking, persistent, honest and open woman.  Veronika wants to live a decent life and works every day.  She has had her own business for 15 years.  She is involved in selling household products, cleaning supplies and everything that has to do with house care.  Veronika has a good retail outlet at the central market.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase new merchandise.  Veronika will then be able to increase her profits because the number of her customers will increase.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and increase profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Virgnie

texts.en: Virgnie, 48 years old, has five children ranging in age from 18-28 years old. Her husband doesn’t work. Virginie has been selling green bananas on a wholesale basis for 15 years, thus enabling her to pay for her children's school fees and their medical insurance. She is now requesting a loan to buy more green bananas to sell, and will use the additional profits to help expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami, who is 33 years old, is a construction contractor, His work is to provide construction workshops with iron and wood needed for houses and buildings. Rami took out a loan from FATEN as he didn't have enough money to purchase the goods he needs due to financial hardship in Palestine. So he had to take the loan and supply the workshop with needed iron and wood. Rami didn't want to wait until he was paid from previous work as he has 20 workers working with him and he had to keep them working in order to pay their wages and help them keep supporting their families.

Rami is photographed in the picture in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to purchase wood and iron for construction work

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 26 years old and engaged to be married. Her future husband is a soldier. Grace is a tailor and sells different traditional fabrics to make "bitenge" (African tunics) with different color patterns. She has been doing this for 11 years and her business has enabled her to develop herself. Grace is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics in order to make more profits to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a young mother of one son. Sawsan and her husband have a small clothing store that they managed to open using their savings. Sawsan and her husband are teachers in the UNRWA ( United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian Refugees).

Sawsan, who is photographed in FATEN's office, and her husband want to increase their income, so they took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more clothes to exhibit in the store as well as changing the store's decoration to adapt to the new clothes they want to purchase.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell and redecorate her clothing store.

loans.name: Heriette

texts.en: Heriette is 47 years old and has seven children between seven and 24. Her husband is a farmer. She sells food dishes which include sorghum and beans. She has had this business for eleven years. This business has enabled her buy food for her family and pay school fees for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more food such as beans and sorghum. She plans to pay school fees for her children with the profits.

loans.use: to buy food to make dishes for sale.

loans.name: Afinan

texts.en:
Afnan is married to Mumen. She is a mother of one daughter and one son. Her husband Mumen (who appears in the picture as she is a conservative woman) is a Palestinian National Authority employee and a transport car driver.

Mumen transports goods in the city where he lives. Afinan took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to buy an engine and replace the one in his car as it is not working properly anymore.

The loan will help the family have a better income as Mumen will be able to transport more goods and over longer distances. 


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: buy an engine for the car her husband drives for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43 year-old married man, living with his wife and three children in Ain. He has owned a grocery store since 1998 and is well known in the region, most of his clients being friends, neighbors and relatives. Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to make his dream of improving his business come true. Ali works hard to provide his family with the best living, education and health. He will buy summer beverages on special offer and increase his shop’s capital. He hopes that this loan will help increase his income so that he can cover all his expenses and be able to open a new branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy summer beverages on special offer and increase his shop’s capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 43 year-old married woman, mother of four children, living and working in Ain. Fatima has owned a grocery store for three years and is working hard to expand it. That’s why she has requested a fourth loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to continue expanding the shop through building extra rooms. She hopes to become a big supermarket in the future. Her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business, and she is a borrower in good standing. Fatima sells household appliances in addition to food and beverages. She is working hard to make extra space to add new products to her shop, which will increase her family’s income and cover most of their expenses.

loans.use: To continue expanding her shop through building extra rooms, and become a big supermarket

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 40 year-old married man, who lives with his wife and four children in Ain. He has worked in car repair since 1988 and is very experienced in this field. Most of his customers recommend him to others. Khaled has been an A. Majmoua-Kiva partner for ten consecutive cycles and all his previous loans helped improve his business and his family’s sociA. and financiA. situation a lot. Khaled seeks perfection in his business, which is why he’s requesting a loan to buy new, improved machines that will help improve his business more and more. He hopes to stay updating and improving his business through offering a wider set of services in the future.

loans.use: to buy new machines that will help improve his business

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 48 years old, married, and has three children.  They live in Baalbeck. Randa works in preparing and selling Mouneh, in addition to sewing wool and cotton jackets, shirts, and baby dresses.  She has been in this business since 2005. 

Randa loves her work a lot, and her customers are loyA. to her, because when it comes to the Mouneh business (Mouneh is food that is stored for later consumption, such as pickles, jams, tomato paste, etc.)they prefer fulfilling their needs from her because cleanliness is a must in such a business, and they trust her for that.
 
Randa is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy necessary products to prepare requested autumn-winter Mouneh products that are available in this summer season, in addition to buying new wool colors to prepare new winter baby designs. Randa hopes to open a baby clothes shop, all made from her handmade designs, in the future.

loans.use: To purchase necessary products to prepare requested autumn-winter Mouneh products

loans.name: Resalyn

texts.en:
Resalyn is 34 years old and lived in Catadman, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and mother of one school-aged child.

Resalyn own and operates a boarding house. She has been engaged this type of service for more than five years. Each month she earn approximately PHP 15,000 from rental fees. She established this service as a way of generating  extra income.

Resalyn requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase materials for boarding house repair.

Resalyn has been member of GDMPC for more than one year. In the future Resalyn hopes that she will have a other boarding houses and a subdivision.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for boarding house repair.

loans.name: Senando

texts.en:
Senando is 46 years old and lived in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and a father of four school-aged dependents.

Senando owns and operates business venture in the service sector, a motorcycle with sidecar transport. He established this services five years ago, as a way of generating income. He earns approximately Php 15,000 every month. Senando requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase tires and spare parts for motorcycle repair.

Senando has been member of GDMPC for one year. In the future Senando wants to buy another  motorcycle with sidecar.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Sinar Rejeki group, composed of 10 members, got a third loan from MUK. The total loan amounts to Rp. 10.000.000, so each member gets Rp. 1.000.000. (Two people could not attend the meeting where the photo was taken because of illness.)

Dewa  Ayu Ketut, 45, (raising her hand, right corner) has three children. Her first child is already in school, while the others are still toddlers. Her husband works as a motorcycle salesman. In addition to having business stalls, she also pursues efforts to raise pigs to increase the family income. This loan will be used to buy four piglets for fattening.

Dewa Ayu Ketut  has a dream: to develop this business so that she could have a lot of pigs. From the profits of this business, she plans to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Tunas Rahayu, a group with 10 members, got a third loan. When the loan was granted, all members were present.

Ni Putu, the leader of the  Tunas Rahayu Group,  lives in a rural area predominantly worked by farmers. She lives with her husband, also a farmer and two children are still in school.

In this third loan she received Rp. 1,500,000 to be used to purchase three piglets  at a price per piglet of Rp. 250,000. The rest of the loan is to be used to buy superior quality feed. These piglets are planned for fattening and will be maintained for five months until ready for sale.

Ni Putu hope this partnership will run smoothly until the group is self-sufficient and can finance themselves. Ni Putu is standing in the back, in a grey shirt on the right side.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina is a 31-year-old lady, married with two children. She couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints. She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She found the need of doing this work few years ago when she observed that her husband’s income alone was not enough for fulfilling the basic needs of the family.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who wants to improve his embroidery business. With the loan, he will purchase embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk that will allow him to fulfill the demand of his customers and provide them quality services.  

He has been operating this business for the past five years and Rozina hopes that after the investment, his business will grow further. 

This is the 2nd time Rozina has applied for a loan. In the previous loan year, she never missed a single meeting and paid her installments on time. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rozina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for embroidery business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 37 years old and married with two adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a  variety of different products in the community.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and basic cooking ingredients to sell. Each month, Rosalinda earns about Php 4,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, soap and basic cooking ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The older son serves in the army and the other children study at school. 

 Anarkan works in the financial group “Kompanion”, and she is also engaged in cultivating agricultural products. She has been doing this for twenty years, since the time she got married.  

Anarkan applied for the loan because they need additional funds for repairing the family vehicle. In the future she wants to see all her children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair the family vehicle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with four adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, Elizabeth earns about Php 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Bahyt's Group

texts.en:
Bahyt is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married to a private driver. She has raised a son, 33, who is engaged in transporting passengers, too. The family’s monthly income from the transportation services provided is 15,000 soms. 

Bahyt applied for the loan because the family needs additional funds for purchasing auto parts. Her son and her husband need to repair the vehicles. In the future the family wishes to save money to purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from different cloth markets and then sells them to her community clients for a profit. 

With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk quantity that will allow her to fulfill the demand of her customers and increase her income. She is hopeful that her business will improve after the investment and she will easily be able to repay the loan with increased profits. She has been doing her business for the past six years. She is the mother of a son who is a blacksmith by trade and a daughter who is studying in class 9. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a private entrepreneur. Her husband earns money by selling construction materials. Together they are bringing up three sons and two daughters, all of whom study at school. 

Two years ago with an initial investment of 28,000 soms Ainura started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening she earns additional money to meet the family needs. With money received from the loan Ainura wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future she wants all her children to be successful in life.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat (in the photo) is 51 years old; her husband, Buntheun, is 61 years old. They have been married since 1982 and have four sons and one daughter. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sat is a garment worker, while her husband is a security guard. She is in the process of building a new house, but lacks some money to finish it. Hence she decided to request her first loan of $1,000 to do the finishing details.

loans.use: To finish her house building.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a working woman who sews clothes for her neighboring clients to fulfill the basic needs of her family. She is very skillful and prepares beautiful looking clothes. 

Her husband operates a donkey cart with which he offers loading/unloading services to his clients. Shameem knows the importance of education, and that’s why she enrolled her only daughter in the nearby school. She wants her daughter to complete her education and become successful in life. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy an ox cart that will help him load more goods on it and provide better quality loading and transport services to his customers.  

Shameem is very much hopeful that an investment will help her husband to increase his profits.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy an ox cart.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (pictured above), 24, is single. She lives with her father and sister and brothers along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophan is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than (pictured above) is a widow with six children--three sons and three daughters. Four are married; three of them live in separate homes, and one still lives in the family home. The other two are garment workers. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Than is a weaver. Because her house is partly in bad condition, she requests a loan of $300 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 31 years old, and her husband, Sothy, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samet and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, they also produce rice wine and raise pigs at home. Samet is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. 

Photo: Samet and her husband.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek was born in 1971 in Ijevan city. He is married and has two sons. Aghabek’s wife is a disabled person.  For several years Aghabek worked as an engineer and since this year he is working with the police. 

Starting in 2010, Aghabek, simultaneously with his permanent job, has been growing plants in his own greenhouse and has also been doing beekeeping. In his greenhouse he raises watercress, coriander, green beans, etc., which he sells in the Ijevan market during the winter months. Thanks to income from all his occupations, Aghabek supports his family and paid for his elder son’s education. 

Thanks to his first Kiva loan Aghabek was able to construct a new greenhouse, where he grows cucumbers, tomatoes and hot peppers for sale. Now he is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to enlarge this greenhouse and to lay out fig and persimmon orchards.

loans.use: To enlarge his greenhouse and lay out fig and persimmon orchards.

loans.name: Konthea

texts.en:
Konthea (in the photo), 31, is single. She lives with her mother and sister and brother in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from the City.

Konthea is a farmer. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village where she lives. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Moldaly's Group

texts.en:
Moldaly is a member of this group. He is 45 and married. In order to cover his daily needs, he began to sell fruits and vegetables at the market three years ago, with an initial investment of 22,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). At the moment, his monthly profit is 8,000 soms. With money gained from his trade, Moldaly was able to purchase a cow for breeding. He applied for the loan because he needs additional funds for purchasing watermelons in order to increase the commodity turnover of his business. In the future, Moldaly plans to save money to purchase a vehicle and decrease some transportation expenses related to his business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a rickshaw and provides transport services to his passengers. He is very good at driving and has been in this profession for the past 15 years. 
 
Farida is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is also a rickshaw driver. Her second son has a tie & dye business and the youngest son is a goldsmith by profession. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients to support her family financially. Farida herself is a housewife and performs her duties by staying at home. 

With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw to help him provide better transport services to his passengers. Farida is confident that an investment will help his business grow and save his business assets. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farida.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Nusra

texts.en:
Nusra is a 39-year-old hard working single lady. Her passion to design and sew clothes since she was a young lady led her to find a full time job as a tailor in one of the biggest tailoring factories in Jordan. But that did not satisfy Nusra. She wanted to have her own business in tailoring and sewing.  So she bought a sewing machine and started every day, after getting off her full time job, to work at her house as a freelancer sewing and tailoring clothes at her clients' requests, noting that most of her clients are other tailoring workshops.

It has been three years since her own business started; now Nusra is applying for a loan to buy a modern sewing machine to help her serve her clients in a faster way. Since Nusra is a conservative person, her sister Haijar, who also helps her with her business, has agreed to have her picture taken instead of Nusra.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 31 years old and married by status. Her husband is attached to a fruit selling business. Through his shop, he sells fresh seasonal fruits to his clients at reasonable rates. Parveen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very caring lady and tries to give comfort to her family with her work. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to buy fresh seasonal fruits for the expansion of his business. More variety of fruits will enable him to fulfill the timely demand of his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the last 15 years. Parveen is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve it further after the loan investment, which will help her family to have a better standard of living.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela owns a kindergarten and preschool. She started her project seven years ago, Naela enjoys her work and dealing with the children, Naela wants to replace the old furniture in the classrooms and playrooms. Naela took out a loan from FATEN to replace the old furniture and purchase educational toys.

Naela, who is photographed here, hopes in the future to have an elementary school besides the kindergarten and preschool.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and educational toys

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.ru: Давлатби проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама Давлатби занимается торговлей. Она арендует помещение, где открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области она более 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сахара, молочных продуктов, конфет, консервированных продуктов и хлеба.
texts.en: Davlatbi lives in the Dangara district.  She is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Her oldest son is working in Russia.  Davlatbi is involved in retail sales.  She leases a space, where she opened a food store.  She has been in this field for over 7 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, dairy products, candy, canned goods and bread.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, dairy products, candy, canned goods and bread

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 42 years of age and sells bangles to support her family financially. Her clients include different cosmetics shops and her community. She is married and her husband operates a motor workshop in the market. He has been doing his business for the past 10 years and is very expert in his work. He can repair any type of vehicle and people approach him because of his good services.
