Naseem is the mother of three daughters and two sons. Her eldest daughter provides packing services to a factory. Her elder son makes and sells toys and her second son works in a factory. Her other two daughters are studying in a local school. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy repair tools for his workshop that will help him provide better quality services to his clients and earn better income. Naseem is very confident that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy repair tools

loans.name: Rasmiah

texts.en:
Rasmiah is a 59-year-old widow. All of her sons have married except her youngest, 19-year-old Odai, who is still living with her. After her husband passed away, Rasmiah opened a small market at her house to have another income for her family beside her husband’s retirement salary. She takes on shifts with her youngest son to work there. 

Now Rasmiah has applied for a loan to buy more products and goods for her market to improve her business and to serve as many people in the area as she can. 

Since Rasmiah is a conservative person, she has agreed that her son appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more products and goods for her food market

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 39 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. She has a food selling business through which she sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Each month, Jovelyn earns about Php 5,000 from doing this type of work.

Jovelyn is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to buy cabbage, eggplant and fruits to sell. In the future, Jovelyn hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 59-year-old who is married and has eight children. She has been farming for the past 26 years. Mary grows vegetables and rears dairy cows.  She gets her income from selling the vegetables and milk. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business and raise her standard of living.  She hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow for more milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1975. She lives in Van Thuong village. She is married and has two children wH. are in secondary school. Her husband is a builder. She is the leader of this group, which includes four other members. All of them have different kinds of businesses.

Thu sells fish in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycL., she borrowed 4,142,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. 

In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more fish to sell. 

About other borrowers in her group:
Trang is 29 years old. She is married and has one child. She sells clothes in the market. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

Hoa is 51 years old. She has four children. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to start a small business.

Thanh is 47 years old. She has a restaurant. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.

Nhung is 25 years old. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a 40-year-old who is married with five children. For ten years, she has been earning a living by selling cosmetics and fabric. She has employed one person to assist her with her business. In addition, she owns rental houses that earn her extra income.

Bilha joined Faulu Kenya so that she could access business loans easily. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cosmetics, bags and fabric. Bilha dreams of expanding her business in five years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, bags and fabric

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old single man from Tyre. He has been the owner of a dental lab since Jan 2011, with six years of experience in this field. Because his financial situation didn't help him to start his own business early, he was employed in order to save the money needed to open his own lab. Ali makes ceramic teeth and more. He works hard to improve his business by attracting more customers through his competitive prices.

Ali is very optimistic that his business will develop quickly and soon, because he's the only dental lab in the region and he's liked by most of his clients, relatives and friends, in addition to most of the dentists in the region. Ali hopes he improves his business and buys new improved and upgraded technical machines in the future.

loans.use: To buy a paindex machine

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 46 years old and married by status. Her husband works in the Municipal Corporation on a low income. He also operates a business selling seeds. He has a good number of business contacts and earns a good profit after completing their orders. Nasreen also supports him financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is also a very good housewife and performs her daily routine tasks very well. 

She has given birth to eight children. Her three eldest children left their education after 8th and started to work to contribute to the family financially. Her remaining children are continuing their education. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase seeds in bulk quantity for selling to earn a good profit. Nasreen hopes that her husband’s business will improve further after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for selling

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, aged 29, is married to Ruth and blessed with one child aged five years. He has been running a retail shop for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.20,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and other foodstuffs for sale. Dickson intends to use the anticipated profits to open a business for his wife and hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, aged 44, is married to George. They are blessed with one child aged 17 years. Lydia does crop farming which she has been doing for ten years.The business earns her a monthly income of KES 22,000.

This is her third loan term from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

Lydia intends to use the anticipated profits to hire another piece of land for crop farming and hopes to be a large scale farmer in future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old and married. She has 3 school-aged children. She has a clothing business where she sells different kinds of clothes in the local community.

Maribel is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional clothes to sell. Each month, Maribel earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Maribel hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 25 year old a business lady and a single mother of one daughter. She has been distributing polythene paper bags for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 5,500 which she uses to support her daughter.

Hannah is applying for the first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She plans to use the loan to purchase polythene bags in large quantities, which she will later sell at a profit. With the anticipated profits from her business she plans to educate her daughter. Her hopes are to own a polythene bag shop in the area she operates her business.

loans.use: to purchase polythene bags in large quantity.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.ru: Хилола проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает в строительной организации. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Уже год как она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Хилола берет заказы у себя дома. В основном она шьет национальные платья. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, так как ее имеющаяся машинка хорошо не шьет.
texts.en: Hilola lives in Vahdat.  She is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works in construction.  She has a high school education.  She has been making traditional dresses for a year now.  Hilola takes orders at home.  She primarily sews traditional dresses.  She is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine since her current machine does not sew well.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming. John learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and to educate his children.

John's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a particular man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kosai

texts.en:
Kosai is 28 years old. He is married and a father of two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

Kosai learned about KADET LTD. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and to educate his children. 

Koai's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 40, is married to Sophia, who does farming. They are blessed with two children, aged 9 and 11 years. He is in the motorcycle transportation business, which he has been doing for one year. The business earns him a monthly income of 14,500 Kenyan shillings.

This is his second loan term with KADET LTD, and he has successfully managed to pay his previous loan. He will use the loan funds to service his motorcycle. Francis intends to buy another motorcycle using the profits he anticipates, and in the future, hopes to educate his children and have a fleet of cars for transportation.

loans.use: to service the motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of health products and knitting threads.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old. He is married and a father of three children. He has been in farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm inputs. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grandchildren.

His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 39, is single and does a motorcycle transportation business. He has been doing this for two years and earns a monthly income of KES11,900.

This is his second loan term from KADET LTD. and has successfully managed to pay his previous loan. He will use the loan funds to service his motorcycle for efficiency. Charles intends to buy another motorbike and hopes to own a fleet of commercial vehicles in the future.

loans.use: to service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 53 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the local community.

Natividad is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy peanuts, soft drinks, noodles and other daily basic needs to sell. Each month, Natividad earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Natividad hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, soft drinks, noodles and other daily basic needs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 55, is a single mother of one child who is 13 years old. She does dairy farming which she has been doing for the last 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy another dairy cow for milk production.

Grace intends to use the anticipated profits to open a marketing center and hopes to own a milk processing plant in future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Razzak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has five children.

In 2009, Razzak opened a food market selling food, beverages and sweets. He has more than three years experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a refrigerator and to increase his market’s inventory. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and additional foodstuffs.

loans.name: Akmatbek

texts.en:
Akmatbek is a 56-year-old villager, who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. In 2000, Akmatbek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

As Akmatbek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, he started this activity with great enthusiasm. He used his initial capital of 9,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening and reselling and managed to increase the number with the monthly income of 11.000 KGS. Also, he began to cultivate wheat and clover which serve as concentration of forage for his cattle. With the revenue, Akmatbek gave a good education to his children which allowed them to successfully manage their lives. 

Now Akmatbek plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to buy more cattle for fattening and reselling. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to help his son buy his own house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Naisuako

texts.en:
Naisuako is a very hard-working lady who practices farming in Narok. She has been farming for over three years. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy agricultural products. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to re-invest in farming.

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon, aged 40, is married to Cecilia and blessed with two children. He has been selling automobile spare parts for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.30,000.

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD and he will use it to buy more automobile spare parts for resale.


Gideon intends to use the anticipated profits to open a business for his wife and hopes to have a big automobile spare parts shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: 3 Tân Nam . Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tỵ has a retail business selling electronics.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Tỵ is 60 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Tỵ is the group leader of the 9.1.3 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
Tỵ lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Tỵ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tỵ has been involved in this business for 4 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit,  Tỵ hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase electronic devices to resell

loans.name: Wahhab

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single, and lives with seven family members.

Wahhab opened a shop for selling and repairing motorcycles in 2007. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, aged 25 is married to Damaris and are blessed with one child.  He sells handicrafts and also does drawing and painting which he has been doing for two years.  The business earns him a monthly income of KES.9,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase handicrafts worth KES.14,000 and the rest he will use for drawings and paintings.  Edwin will use the anticipated profits to educate his child and hopes to start exporting the handicrafts in future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Maeda

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children.

Maeda is a tailor; she has been making and repairing women’s clothing since 2006. She gained her experience from her mother and she has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.
  
She is requesting a $1200 loan to buy a split air conditioner and a sewing machine. She is aiming to increase her income so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Moiyao

texts.en:
Moiyao , 31-years old, married and supports three people.  He has been operating a retail shop for the past four years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock.  With the profits generated he plans to expand his business from retail to wholesale.

He dreams to be rich.  He is an assiduous man who works with great effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in his store

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

Hussein has had a shop for working aluminum since 2004; he makes doors and windows. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator and to make an advertising light box for his shop. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and to make an advertising light box for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agriculture inputs for olive tree field: fertilizers, repair sprinklers, etc.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old and married.

Haydar has owned a mobile phone shop since 2010; he sells phones and mobile accessories. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2700 loan to make an advertising light box and get a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make an advertising light box and get a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson , aged 39, is married and he and his wife have two children.  He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff,and he is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. 

He hopes to use the profit to educate his children and expand his farming . He dreams of prospering in farming to provide a better life to his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy carpenter machine tools.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul is the treasurer of this group.  She is 38 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and a daughter. The sons are in school and the daughter is not yet, she is preschool age (under seven).  

Three years ago with an initial investment of 33,000 SOMS, Baktygul started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market.  In this way she earns 4,000 SOMS per month.  With money received from the loan Baktygul wants to purchase more vegetables for further resale.  In the future with money gained from the trade Baktygul wants to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child, and lives with six family members, three of whom work.

Haitham has owned a food market since 2007, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He is committed to his work and loyal to his clients.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to purchase additional foodstuffs and to make an advertising light box for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and make an advertising light box for his mini-market.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old father of four daughters and three sons. He has worked in various jobs and as he is getting old, he wanted to have more stable work. He thought of investing in a soft drink shop 2 years ago. Now that the shop is prospering, Ali decided to take out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge to keep fruit in instead of buying very small amounts to keep it fresh.

Ali is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for his soft drink shop.

loans.name: Aliaa

texts.en:
Aliaa is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children.

Everyone who knows Aliaa has seen her childlike spirit and has advised her to work in a daycare, which was a tempting idea for her, but she wanted to stay at home and be with her children in their early years. That was one of the reasons that lead her to open a small daycare at her house that will allow her to stay with her children and take care of others’.

Living in an active place in Abu Alanda where a lot of women go out of the home to work is one of the reasons why her daycare has succeeded, and by the word of mouth of those women she has now a good number of clients to serve.

Due to the increase in the number of children, Aliaa now is applying for a loan to buy more toys and mattresses for kids to rest and play, and to add more safety equipment for those kids.

loans.use: To buy more toys and mattresses for kids to rest and play at the daycare.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom work.

Kazem has a wholesale food market since 2007, selling flour and oils. He has a good reputation and he is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a tricycle (Stota), split air conditioner and to make a sliding door for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle (Stota), a split air conditioner and to make a sliding door for his market.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and married. 

Ahmad has owned a bakery since 2005. He has more than five years experience; his bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by and he has a good reputation. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate his shop and to make ceramic tiles. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to make ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old and married. 

Ahmad has had an automotive workshop for plumbing and metalwork since 2003. He has much experience in this field, has a good reputation, and he is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy electrical machinery for cars. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy electrical machinery for cars.

loans.name: Neamah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children.

Neamah has had a barber shop since 1995. He has more than 15 years experience in his field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to renovate his shop and to tile the floor. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to tile the floor.

loans.name: Wahid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and a father of one. 

Wahid has owned a small market since 2009, selling cheese, juice, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and shelves for his market and to buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and shelves for his market and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He lives with six family members, four of whom work.

Zaid has owned a food market since 2006, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use items, and dairy products. He is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 46 years old and operates a grocery store at her home to share the financial burden with her husband. Operating her business from her home also allows her to manage and perform her household responsibilities. 

Her husband is involved in selling buffalo milk. For that purpose, he has a buffalo at his home from which he gets milk every day that he sells to his community clients for a profit. He also has two goats and he will sell them to a butcher after raising them. 

Mariam is the mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will purchase groceries in bulk quantities which will allow her to fill the customers' orders and increase her profits. 

She has been operating this business for the past three years and hopes that the loan will help her improving her business further and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Beinvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 29 years old and is married with two children. He manages a corn farming business and he earns about $750 per harvest.

He grows corn and has been doing so for five years. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP as his additional capital for buying farm supplies needed such as fertilizer and pesticides.

In the future, Bienvinido hopes to maintain his business so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо жительница Вахдатского района. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем, имеет 8 детей. Ее муж работает на стройке. Сама Мехринисо занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает парфюмерию. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 5 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки косметики, парфюмерии, шампуня, лака для волос и дезодорантов.
texts.en: Mehriniso lives in Vahdat.  She is 46 years old, married, and has eight children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Mehriniso works in trade.  She has a shop where she sells cosmetics.  She has been doing this work for more than five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy cosmetics, perfume, shampoo, hairspray, and deodorant.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, shampoo, hairspray, and deodorant.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 9 hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à  Fofanabougou  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ISSA,  qui est la deuxième personne debout à droite en boubou, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
Après les récoltes, la production est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000FCFA après la campagne.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 9 hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à  Fofanabougou  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ISSA,  qui est la deuxième personne debout à droite en boubou, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
Après les récoltes, la production est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000FCFA après la campagne.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Labours, semence, engrais, herbicides et petits équipements

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 43-year-old mother, who has been hand-making different sorts of trays and baskets using various materials. She also decorates these trays and baskets using sparkling material (as shown in the picture) and they can then be used for celebrations. 

Being in the business for almost 10 years now has made her one of the best-known people in this type of work, so she now makes special orders for those who ask for it.

Randa is now applying for a loan to buy more materials in order to increase her productivity so she can have her own store or showplace for her products.

loans.use: To buy more materials for decorating trays and baskets.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 39 years old and is married with three children. He earns about $875 each cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines. He grows rice and has been doing so for ten years.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers to ensure better crop production.

In the future, Efren hopes to generate more income in order to educate all his children and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI  sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à  Kolombada,  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ALIOU, qui est la première personne debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares de maïs.
La production, après les récoltes est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI  sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles polygames à  Kolombada,  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ALIOU, qui est la première personne debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares de maïs.
La production, après les récoltes est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350 000FCFA après la campagne.

loans.use: Labours, semence, engrais, herbicides et petits équipements

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe constitué de six  hommes tous mariés, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à  YOLLA  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
TIDIANI, qui est le premier debout à droite de la photo, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana et  Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
BENKADI  est un groupe constitué de six  hommes tous mariés, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à  YOLLA  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
TIDIANI, qui est le premier debout à droite de la photo, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana et  Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA après la campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide et petits équipements

loans.name: Rwanguhya United  Assc Group

texts.en: Charles is a forty-two-year-old married man with nine children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling maize flour and soap for ten years. He started the business with 100,000 shillings, and now he has 1,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuation that causes him losses, and his vision is a wholesale business plus an educated family. Charles needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 34-year-old wife from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. She is married to Sami and a mother of two daughters and two sons. Rabab's husband used to work in a barber shop and that he has the skill and wants to improve his income, as his children are growing and their expenses are as well, he wants to start his own business in order not to share the income with others.

Rabab's husband saved money and needed $1,500 to start the barber shop as he is paying for rent, decoration, equipment, kits and other products such as creams, shampoo, shaving creams, etc.

Rabab is a conservative woman as are most Gaza Strip citizens therefore her husband is photographed here.

loans.use: To help her husband start a barber shop.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with nine family members; four of them work.

Jaafar is a carpenter; since 2008 he has owned a workshop where he makes furniture. He has more than four years experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan  He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy carpentry machine tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various grocery items and a display fridge.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and married, with three children in school.  To earn a living, she runs a green grocery.  She has been in the business for four years with four employees.  Alongside her grocery store, she sells charcoal.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Previously, she was farming.  

Gladys has improved her business through Faulu Kenya and she has bought a piece of land at her rural home.  Her dream is to have a well-established business in the future.  She has requested 80,000 KES to buy kale, onions and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy kale, onions and charcoal.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married, and has one child.

In 2005 Mohamad opened a mobile phone store, selling phones, accessories, and recharge cards. He has a good reputation and he is committed to his work and loyal to his clients.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to buy a laptop and a photocopier. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Dyanamique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chibonga, représente du groupe d’affaire « Dynamique » est entrepreneur, âgée de 39 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 2 enfants qui  étudient tous.  Elle est vendeuse de souliers usés au long de la rue ambiante de Katoyi-Quartier Mabanga. Depuis  2007, elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima dans la banque communautaire. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  20 paires de souliers usés et le reste d’argent  sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe « Dynamique » reste caractériser par le travail et le succès dans les affaires.
texts.en: The customer, Chibonga, who represents the "Dynamique" business group, is a 39 year old female entrepreneur, who lives by herself and has two children who are both studying. She sells used shoes along the busy Katoyi district road in Mabanga. She has been carrying out this business since 2007 and during this time has had six community banking loans from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to get 20 pairs of used shoes, and the rest of the money will be used for small family projects. Furthermore, her ambition is to be able to educate her children and to buy a piece of land on which to build a house. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who cannot access classic banks. The "Dynamique" group is characterised by work and success in business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 pairs of used shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is married. She is involved in a sewing business. She does this work to support her family financially. 

She learnt this art from her mother and it has served her well since her marriage. She can sew designer & non-designer dresses very easily. Her clients are very much satisifed with her work. In her working years, she has never received any complaint from her clients about her sewing. For this reason, she collects a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her to fulfill the timely orders of her clients because her current machine doesn't produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress.   

She is confident that an investment in her business will help her grow her business further and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 51-year-old married man, blessed with four children.  He has been operating a retail shop for fourteen years.  Through Faulu Kenya he was able to construct rental houses which earn him extra income.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to educate his children. Only one of them is still in school.

Thomas hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 80,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and baking flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and baking flour.
